column1: About the Role

The Senior Measurement Data Analyst plays a pivotal role in ensuring the accuracy, integrity, and reliability of measurement data used throughout the organization. You will validate, analyze, and reconcile complex datasets, support continuous improvement initiatives, and act as a technical authority in measurement processes. With your expertise, you will help maintain compliance, optimize workflows, and elevate our measurement standards.
This position is ideal for someone who enjoys investigating discrepancies, improving systems, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure flawless measurement operations.
What You&rsquo
column2: ll Do

column1: Validate, reconcile, and analyze measurement data across multiple platforms to ensure accuracy and compliance
Troubleshoot discrepancies in FLOWCAL, SCADA, EFM, and related systems
Perform complex data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and root causes
Support internal and external audits, providing technical documentation and investigative findings
Collaborate with IT, Operations, Field Measurement, and Engineering teams to improve data reliability
Develop, revise, and maintain SOPs, workflows, and reporting processes
Lead or support continuous improvement initiatives to enhance data accuracy and measurement efficiency
Provide mentorship, technical support, and problem-solving guidance to junior analysts and team members
Serve as a subject-matter expert in measurement calculations, data integrity, and system performance
Perform other duties as assigned.
Why You&rsquo
column2: ll Love Working Here

What to Expect

Join the Supplier Compliance team at Tesla, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping and improving Tesla's global supply chain, contributing to the company's mission of accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. Flawless and structured execution in the supply chain is crucial for efficient operations at Tesla's production facilities and ultimately enabling timely delivery of products to customers. As a Supplier Compliance Analyst, you will ensure that suppliers provide accurate and timely advanced shipment notifications (ASNs), utilize approved packaging and compliant labels, and adhere to Tesla's specifications throughout the procure-to-pay process. This position is open to candidates based in either our Austin or Fremont office.
What You'll Do
Manage a portfolio of suppliers, serving as the primary contact for questions and concerns related to shipment execution
Train and onboard new suppliers, ensuring they understand and comply with Tesla's requirements and standards
Develop process documentation and training materials
Communicate with suppliers to root cause and resolve issues that impact their ability to meet Tesla&rsquo
column2: s requirements

column1: Measure and improve KPIs that measure supplier performance for your portfolio of suppliers
Lead projects to improve compliance processes and tools
Act as the point of contact for warehouse and receiving dock personnel to address and provide guidance on exceptions in Goods Receiving, ensuring a smooth and compliant process
Collaborate cross-functionally with Procurement, Material Planning, Logistics, Material Handling, Packaging, Quality, and Accounts Payable teams
What You'll Bring
Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Finance, or a similar quantitative discipline, or equivalent. CPIM or APICS training is a plus
Minimum of 2 years of work experience in supply chain, manufacturing, or other process-critical operations, or evidence of exceptional ability
Experience in automotive supply chains and processes is a significant plus
Detail-oriented and organized, with a meticulous approach to identifying and diagnosing problems, and a careful consideration for drawing accurate conclusions and solutions
Ability to evaluate and analyze data to enable operational decision-making or present clear recommendations to leadership
Passionate and relentless in following up on issues until final resolution is achieved, and sustained process improvements are deployed and verified
Excellent communication skills, both internally with the team and with other Tesla stakeholders, as well as externally with suppliers - comfortable having difficult conversations
Demonstrated experience delivering results in an unstructured and fast-paced environment. Flexibility and adaptability are key
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits
Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
<ul><li>Aetna PPO and HSA plans &gt

JOB DESCRIPTION

Embark on a rewarding and challenging career as a Business Analysis Associate I with our dynamic team. You'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact by supporting process improvements, key initiatives and expanding your creative skills in a supportive and collaborative environment. Join us and contribute to our mission while advancing your career. With highly supportive leadership and programs to foster growth and career mobility, your skills and capabilities can increase and be fine-tuned to make you more agile and versatile in reaching your career potential.
As a Business Analyst I- Inbound Claims Support, in Total Consumer Operations you will be responsible for delivering top notch support that is vital to the Consumer and Community Bank.

You will leverage your advanced understanding of data analytics and automation technologies to uncover patterns, analyze complex data sets, and propose innovative solutions and your expertise in cross-functional collaboration will enable you to work effectively with diverse teams, ensuring alignment with business strategies. You will also utilize your advanced computer literacy and digital proficiency to enhance processes and customer interactions you will assist in coaching and delegating tasks to others, fostering a culture of learning and growth within the team and your decisions and work results will have a significant impact on the team and departmental goals, contributing to the overall success of the firm. The Fraud Prevention and Claims, Disputes (FCPS) Inbound Call Center team supports the intake channels for their organization including call centers and digital channels that support FCPS and Recovery and this role is specifically aligned to the Business Support organization within the Inbound Call Center and is focused on executing changes in business owned tables housed in the Consolidated Claims System (CCS)
Job responsibilities
Analyze and interpret complex data sets using advanced data analytics skills to support operational initiatives and strategic decision-making.
Utilize automation technologies to optimize processes, enhance efficiency, and support the implementation of business strategies.
Provide insights and recommendations to team members, ensuring tasks and responsibilities are aligned with project objectives for efficient and effective outcomes.
Leverage digital platforms and technological tools to improve processes, enhance customer interactions, and effectively communicate with stakeholders.
Complete adhoc business reviews/analytics requests, business cases, etc. and present findings/recommendations to key stakeholders

Develop Business Requirements for reporting or IT projects for CCS table and/or other changes and provide support for all scheduled project implementations and Audit and Central Operations Reporting (CORE) support
Perform statistical analysis on large data sets, leading to insights about improving the business, using tools like SAS, Tableau, Python, Alteryx, etc.
Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills
Demonstrated ability to conduct data analysis and interpret complex data sets, with proven expertise equivalent to 2+ years of experience.
Advanced proficiency in using automation technologies to optimize processes and implement business strategies.
A Controls focus with the ability to balance Business and Customer needs, risk based assessments and decision making
• Proven self-starter and able to easily accept change and able to multitask
Communication skills, with practical experience with presentations and ability to work with all levels of employees/management, and strong listening skills
Action oriented - able to meet assigned deadlines in a fast paced environment (some of them immediate), Negotiation/problem resolution skills
Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills
4+ years&rsquo

in-8145de11bfb29715,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=8145de11bfb29715,http://www.indeed.com/job/data-analyst-business-administrator-8145de11bfb29715,Data Analyst / Business Administrator,Macarooz,"Cypress, TX, US",2025-11-14,fulltime,,yearly,,,USD,False,,,,,"

Overview

We are introducing a new hybrid role that combines data analytics, business administration, and operational support. As our company continues to grow, we are expanding the structure of our administrative and analytical functions. The Data Analyst / Business Administrator will play a key role in supporting cross-department workflows, improving information accuracy, and strengthening decision-making through organized data and reporting.

This role will begin with a defined set of responsibilities across ordering, staffing support, operational paperwork, finance coordination, and reporting. This position will grow as the business evolves and as additional needs develop. We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive individual who is comfortable taking ownership of tasks, improving processes, and supporting a fast-moving and scaling operation.

Key Responsibilities

1. Ordering and Inventory Support

  • Serve as the primary coordinator for ordering, ensuring timely procurement of materials.
  • Manage ordering, including accurate quantity tracking and cost awareness.
  • Oversee all packaging ordering, including forecasting needs and verifying availability.

2. Staffing and Administrative Coordination

  • Review incoming resumes and applications and act as the first-level screener for candidate quality.
  • Manage all job postings, applicant communication, and interview scheduling.
  • Support onboarding processes and ensure all new-hire steps and documents are completed

3. Compliance and Documentation

  • Assist with operational paperwork review for accuracy, completeness, and compliance.
  • Help maintain organized documentation across departments.

4. Systems and Digital Operations

  • Support ERP activities, including Sales Order Lifecycle updates, data entry, and accuracy checks.
  • Conduct research and information lookups for maintenance-related tasks and other operational support.

5. Finance and Accounting Coordination

  • Support the Finance team by assisting with invoicing, QuickBooks entries, sample tracker updates, FedEx label coordination, and accounts receivable follow-up.
  • Update all necessary inputs into monthly financial reporting.
  • Provide general administrative support to the external accountant based on their needs.

6. Data, Reporting, and Pricing Updates

  • Maintain and update pricing files and ensure accuracy across internal systems.
  • Manage ongoing data tracking related to costs, customer information, and operational metrics.
  • Build and distribute internal reports and summaries to support leadership decision-making.

Qualifications

  • Experience in data analysis, business administration, operations support, or a related field.
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills with a high attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in spreadsheets such as Google Sheets or Excel, along with comfort working with data entry and reporting.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and complete tasks with consistency and accuracy.
  • Strong communication skills and comfort collaborating with multiple teams.
  • Experience with QuickBooks or ERP systems such as Wherefour is preferred but not required.

Role Growth and Future Development

This is a newly created role and responsibilities will expand and evolve over time as the company grows and new needs emerge. The ideal candidate enjoys building structure, improving processes, and taking on increasing responsibility in a growing company.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental insurance
  • Employee discount
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off

Work Location: In person

Job Description

The Business Analyst 3 will review, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs to develop solutions that align with business strategy. The role requires strong experience in business process reengineering, requirements documentation, and leveraging technology to improve business effectiveness. The analyst will play a key role in supporting enhancements to the Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS), a centralized provider enrollment portal.

The selected candidate will work with internal teams, TMHP sprint teams, and business stakeholders to ensure system requirements meet operational and legislative needs. This role requires strong communication, Agile expertise, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze program policies, procedures, and processes to determine system and business impacts.
  • Review system and project deliverables (requirements, design documents, test plans, risk assessments) to ensure compliance with business and technical needs.
  • Gather, analyze, and document business requirements and processes.
  • Translate business needs into technical requirements for vendors and development teams.
  • Serve as the Product Owner for an Agile team implementing system changes.
  • Write User Stories with detailed Acceptance Criteria following Agile methodology.
  • Develop and maintain business test scenarios
column3:
participate in systems and user acceptance testing.
  • Create use cases, test plans, and exit criteria aligned with documented requirements.
  • Execute test cases within formal testing tools.
  • Track, document, and report testing status.
  • Evaluate test strategies to ensure proper test coverage.
  • Identify risks/issues and develop mitigation strategies.
  • Provide clear project status updates to management.
  • Document business decisions and action items.
  • Conduct meetings and presentations as required.
  • Manage deliverable schedules and timelines.
  • Perform additional tasks related to PEMS as assigned.

    • Candidate Qualifications

    Minimum Required Experience:

    • 8+ years as a Business Analyst and Agile Product Owner.
    • 8+ years using Agile software development methodology.
    • 8+ years performing complex business analysis and writing technical documentation.
    • 8+ years reporting project status, risks, issues, and key decisions.
    • 8+ years identifying project risks and implementing mitigation strategies.
    • 8+ years of strong written and oral communication experience.
    • 8+ years gathering, validating, and documenting business requirements and translating them into technical solutions.
    • 8+ years reviewing and approving complex technical requirements written by vendors.
    • 8+ years working with Microsoft Teams, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
    • 8+ years developing test plans, exit criteria, and test scenarios.
    • 8+ years executing detailed test cases in a complex software environment.
    • 8+ years using testing management tools.
    • 8+ years using Microsoft Project or similar project management tools.
    • 8+ years approving and prioritizing user stories based on feedback and SME knowledge.
    • 8+ years working with Medicaid systems and processes.
    • 8+ years of claims processing experience.

    Preferred Experience:

    • Knowledge of Texas Medicaid programs (4+ years preferred).
    • Experience with Provider Enrollment and Management Systems (PEMS) (2+ years preferred).

At USAA, our mission is to empower our members to achieve financial security through highly competitive products, exceptional service and trusted advice. We seek to be the #1 choice for the military community and their families.
Embrace a fulfilling career at USAA, where our core values &ndash
column2: honesty, integrity, loyalty and service &ndash
column3: define how we treat each other and our members. Be part of what truly makes us special and impactful.

column1: The Opportunity
Reputation and Risk is seeking an experienced Business Support Analyst &ndash
column2: Mid-Level, to join our team and provide data analytics services to the Corporate Communications and Public Affairs Office. The incumbent will assist business operations by collecting moderately complex data from trusted sources, using statistical techniques to analyze the data for trends, as well as generating reports and data visualizations that leaders will use to make informed decisions. Conduct data analytics activities for high profile initiatives, such as USAA&rsquo
column3: s philanthropic, volunteer, and member-giving efforts. Make recommendations leading to the achievement of strategies and objectives.

column1: We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position will be based in the following location: San Antonio TX, Plano TX, Charlotte NC, Tampa FL, Colorado Springs CO or Phoenix AZ.
Relocation assistance is not available for this position.
What you'll do:

Provides moderately complex operational support on current processes and supports business operations and management in identifying opportunities and solutions to meet current and future business needs.
Validates information for moderately complex and interfaces with other departments to include presentations of documented findings, alternatives and recommended actions.

Participates in the planning, research, analysis, development, and implementation of new and modifications to existing applications and processes to provide new or improved capabilities, products, and/or services.
Develops and maintains a understanding of overall moderately complex business functions.
Gathers information for moderately complex processes, analyzes data and trends, identifies root causes, and develops work products.
Reviews, validates, and/or analyzes reports that function as a control to existing processes.
Assists with the documentation of new and revised departmental procedures.
Develops and analyzes additional ad-hoc reports as needed by Management.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.
What you have:
Bachelor&rsquo
column2: s degree
column3: OR 4 years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.

column1: 4 years of experience in end-to-end analysis and/or operations experience, including: requirement gathering and documentation, operational planning and forecasting, data analytics, or current/future state analysis, in direct support of business planning initiatives and optimization of business operations.
Proficient knowledge of a wide variety of systems coordination, process/product review initiatives and the development of management information requirements for related business functions.
Knowledge of business operations and systems/business requirements processes.
Experience with business intelligence tools, such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Analytics.
Experience with data analysis and programming tools, such as SQL, Python and R.
What sets you apart:
• Proven experience with predictive analytics.
Proven experience with prescriptive analytics.
Demonstrated experience with data management.
US military experience through military service or a military spouse/domestic partner.
Compensation range: The salary range for this position is: $69,920- $133,620.

USAA does not provide visa sponsorship for this role. Please do not apply for this role if at any time (now or in the future) you will need immigration support (i.e., H-1B, TN, STEM OPT Training Plans, etc.).

Compensation: USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market data of the position. The actual salary for this role may vary by location.
Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance and at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

Benefits: At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.
For more details on our outstanding benefits, visit our benefits page on USAAjobs.com.

Applications for this position are accepted on an ongoing basis, this posting will remain open until the position is filled. Thus, interested candidates are encouraged to apply the same day they view this posting.

USAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Business Analyst &ndash
column2: Power Trading (Contract)

column1: Location: Houston, Texas
Type: Contract
Salary: Depends on Experience
Summary:
The Business Analyst &ndash
column2: Power Trading will support the business in the drafting of business/functional requirements for use by software engineering and third-party system providers, to participate replacing actual in-house ETRM.

column1: Duties:

• Will interface between the business/users and software engineering teams or third-party system providers, define requirements and contribute to the delivery of solutions for, and together with, the business.
• Ensure the quality of deliveries and that business expectations are realized, and provide general support to the business.
• Ensure continuity by documenting, training and sharing knowledge with business and other IT members of the organization.
• Act as an interface to the business and ensure an understanding of the business objectives and priorities, and be proactive in proposing value-adding solutions to the business
• Configure the system via the GUI for business readiness (setup / workflow / template)
• Work with the business to define business/functional requirements, and ensure business validation of such requirements and consistency with the systems landscape.
• Work with the technical team, including software/application engineers, on solutions design and delivery
• Work with the vendor team, when it comes to core development managed externally
• Prepare and execute test plans, and ensure compliance with user/business/functional specifications and IT control framework
• Work closely with BA&rsquo
column2: s and other IT resources from across the Trading IT organization, especially in the context of migration

column1: • Leverage on your general knowledge to propose business process improvement
• Prepare project plans and other change initiatives, which may be as part of a team, and contribute to the implementation of such projects
• Liaise with the business on all aspects of service delivery and promote IT solutions delivered
• Manage a backlog of change requirements and assist in their delivery
• Provide user support and assist with the resolution of incidents and problems
Requirements:
• 3+ years of work experience in a utility or a commodity trading environment, and preferably with knowledge of the energy markets
• Strong interest in IT and technology, and experience of software engineering and application management
• Ability to manage multiple activities simultaneously and to work under pressure, good communication and organizational skills, and attention to detail
• Experience of Project Management, DevOps and Agile delivery methodologies, and requirements engineering is desirable
• Knowledge of front to back system flows and trade lifecycles including understanding of different physical and derivatives instruments and their respective risks and P&
column2: L measures

column1: Education

• Educated to degree level in an IT, technology or engineering discipline

Description

GENERAL DESCRIPTION: Performs routine (journey-level) records and information management work for records contained/submitted into the registration database. Work involves designing, evaluating, reviewing, and maintaining registration records, providing customer service on inquiries related to program requirements and functions. Works under moderate supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

The following Military Occupational Specialty codes are generally applicable to this position. https://hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_LibraryandRecords.pdf Applicants must fully complete the summary of experience to determine if minimum qualifications are met.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Maintains database information requiring the evaluation of program specific submissions
column2: classifies, scans, stores, retrieves offender records, court

column1: documents, information, and archived files.
2. Identifies documents, researches, and analyzes data. Initiates the entry of information into databases and screens and reviews data for accuracy.
3. Receives open records requests and coordinates with legal counsel and other employees to gather appropriate records and/or respond in accordance
with the Public Information Act.
4. Ensures that records are released to external customers in conformance with the approved retention schedule.
5. Trains in providing customer service and referrals to public and criminal justice agencies regarding questions pertaining to multiple registration
Programs, registrant requirements, and statutory references.
6. Collects and compiles incoming correspondence and forms. Prepare and distribute documents to various areas.
7. Facilitates activities related to interstate relocation of offenders by assessing affected jurisdiction and forwarding notices.
8. Gathers court documents and fingerprint card information to help with the identification of records.
9. Processes the reporting of deceased registrants and ensures submission complies with bureau policy and statutory requirements, contacting
contributors for clarification when necessary.
10. Identify that all information or documents are received and verified in order to flag registrants and add alias information into the Computerized Criminal
History (CCH) database.
11. Participate in the design and implementation of filing systems and filing procedures.
12. Performs quality control measures by ensuring completeness of registrant information for entry into a registration database and rejecting submissions
that do not meet established reporting standards.
13. Contacts various state and federal criminal justice agencies to obtain registration or criminal history information to make determinations if a duty to
register exists pursuant to state law.
14. Coordinates activities related to the validation of registration records pursuant to federal guidelines. Works with division staff to provide information to
agencies regarding expectations and process.
15. Scan photos and adjust images to accommodate database requirements.
16. Attend work regularly and observe approved work hours in accordance with agency leave and attendance policies.
17. Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Education &ndash
column2: High School Diploma/equivalent is required.

in-8006765c1d517e70,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=8006765c1d517e70,https://accenture.com/us-en/careers/jobdetails?id=13745816_en,Customer1 Business Process Designer - 5978977,Accenture,"Houston, TX, US",2025-11-13,fulltime,direct_data,yearly,168480.0,178880.0,USD,False,,,,,"

Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.
Key Responsibilities:

This position is for a Customer1/Business Analyst to translate the needs and issues identified by the business into technology solutions in the Customer1 CIS application. This requires the analyst to understand the underlying business need, assess the impact of the need, capture, analyze, and document requirements and support the communication and delivery of those requirements to the users and the IT development team.
This includes the following business functions:
Technical and Functional Subject-Matter Expert (SME) Support of Customer/1 application
Requirements Gathering
Functional Analysis
Documentation of Functional Requirements
User Approval and Sign-Off of Requirements
Development of User Acceptance Test Plan
Development of Post-Production Verification Requirements
Functional and technical support of UAT Testers and Developers
Support/analysis of production abends and end user application issues
Must have Customer/1 skills in the Billing functional area.
Cross-project Application Sr Architect in Customer/1 Billing to provide cross-Portfolio Product Architect Support for the Customer/1 Practice.

Will be primarily staffed year 1 on Ameren but expected to act as SME and Functional Architect in Billing across the Capability. Providing support across the full portfolio of Customer/1 projects teams for complex projects and issues support. Example Projects: PPL, SoCo, Ameren, National Grid, etc.
Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years' experience
Customer 1 Billing, Finance
COBOL Mainframe
40-60% in office onsite per week if local to the Tampa Bay area
High School Diploma or GED
Preferred Qualifications:
Business requirement analysis
Conversion metrics activities
Managing a team project
Leadership Skills

Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.
Key Responsibilities:

This position is for a Customer1/Business Analyst to translate the needs and issues identified by the business into technology solutions in the Customer1 CIS application. This requires the analyst to understand the underlying business need, assess the impact of the need, capture, analyze, and document requirements and support the communication and delivery of those requirements to the users and the IT development team.
This includes the following business functions:
Technical and Functional Subject-Matter Expert (SME) Support of Customer/1 application
Requirements Gathering
Functional Analysis
Documentation of Functional Requirements
User Approval and Sign-Off of Requirements
Development of User Acceptance Test Plan
Development of Post-Production Verification Requirements
Functional and technical support of UAT Testers and Developers
Support/analysis of production abends and end user application issues
Must have Customer/1 skills in the Billing functional area.
Cross-project Application Sr Architect in Customer/1 Billing to provide cross-Portfolio Product Architect Support for the Customer/1 Practice.

Will be primarily staffed year 1 on Ameren but expected to act as SME and Functional Architect in Billing across the Capability. Providing support across the full portfolio of Customer/1 projects teams for complex projects and issues support. Example Projects: PPL, SoCo, Ameren, National Grid, etc.
Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years' experience
Customer 1 Billing, Finance
COBOL Mainframe
40-60% in office onsite per week if local to the Tampa Bay area
High School Diploma or GED
Preferred Qualifications:
Business requirement analysis
Conversion metrics activities
Managing a team project
Leadership Skills

The Business Analyst III is a lead position that provides core IT support for the analytical needs of the Pharmacy Rebates and Business Analysis (PRBA) section of the Vendor Drug Program (VDP) within Medicaid-CHIP Services (MCS) at Texas Health and Human Services.

Assists with preparing, planning, developing, organizing, and coordinating the procurement of technology vendor services and tasking existing vendors to implement VDP projects to support the program. May perform some contract management activities as needed while working with internal and external stakeholder organizations involved in VDP initiatives. The role supports all aspects of VDP systems, including planning, coordination, implementation, management, leading projects, and effective communication related to the analysis of plans, deliverables, and data. This position is responsible for advanced work in contract management, project management, and stakeholder communications.
The Business Analyst III performs comprehensive business analysis work including gathering, developing, and documenting user requirements

Description

The IT Business Senior Analyst is an intermediate-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.
Responsibilities:
Formulate and define systems scope and objectives for complex projects and foster communication between business leaders and IT
Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions
Support system change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
• Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
• Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.

Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
5-8 years of relevant experience
Experience in data analysis with intermediate/advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
Proven interpersonal, data analysis, diplomatic, management and prioritization skills
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven ability to manage multiple activities and build/develop working relationships
Proven self-motivation to take initiative and master new tasks quickly
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience

GENERAL DESCRIPTION: Performs routine (journey-level) records and information management work for records contained/submitted into the registration database. Work involves designing, evaluating, reviewing, and maintaining registration records, providing customer service on inquiries related to program requirements and functions. Works under moderate supervision, with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

The following Military Occupational Specialty codes are generally applicable to this position. https://hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_LibraryandRecords.pdf Applicants must fully complete the summary of experience to determine if minimum qualifications are met.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Maintains database information requiring the evaluation of program specific submissions
column2: classifies, scans, stores, retrieves offender records, court

column1: documents, information, and archived files.
2. Identifies documents, researches, and analyzes data. Initiates the entry of information into databases and screens and reviews data for accuracy.
3. Receives open records requests and coordinates with legal counsel and other employees to gather appropriate records and/or respond in accordance
with the Public Information Act.
4. Ensures that records are released to external customers in conformance with the approved retention schedule.
5. Trains in providing customer service and referrals to public and criminal justice agencies regarding questions pertaining to multiple registration
Programs, registrant requirements, and statutory references.
6. Collects and compiles incoming correspondence and forms. Prepare and distribute documents to various areas.
7. Facilitates activities related to interstate relocation of offenders by assessing affected jurisdiction and forwarding notices.
8. Gathers court documents and fingerprint card information to help with the identification of records.
9. Processes the reporting of deceased registrants and ensures submission complies with bureau policy and statutory requirements, contacting
contributors for clarification when necessary.
10. Identify that all information or documents are received and verified in order to flag registrants and add alias information into the Computerized Criminal
History (CCH) database.
11. Participate in the design and implementation of filing systems and filing procedures.
12. Performs quality control measures by ensuring completeness of registrant information for entry into a registration database and rejecting submissions
that do not meet established reporting standards.
13. Contacts various state and federal criminal justice agencies to obtain registration or criminal history information to make determinations if a duty to
register exists pursuant to state law.
14. Coordinates activities related to the validation of registration records pursuant to federal guidelines. Works with division staff to provide information to
agencies regarding expectations and process.
15. Scan photos and adjust images to accommodate database requirements.
16. Attend work regularly and observe approved work hours in accordance with agency leave and attendance policies.
17. Perform other duties as assigned.

Education &ndash

Position DescriptionWhat We Do
We are a technology agency powered by people.
DIR offers secure, modern, and cost-effective technology to help government entities in Texas serve their constituents.

DIR is a fast-paced and collaborative environment with highly motivated, innovative, and engaged employees dedicated to achieving the best value for the state. We have over 250 professionals working at DIR who are honored to serve as the cornerstone of public sector technology in Texas. By joining DIR, you will be an integral part of transforming how Texas government serves Texans.
Position Summary

As a Business Analyst within the Office of the Chief Data Officer, this role supports a variety of data office functions including data governance and data management, the Open and Closed Data Portals, and Records Management Program. This role works under minimal supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgement to perform advanced (senior-level) business analysis and process improvement for data related projects and initiatives. This role works closely with the DIR Data Officer, data teams, and business stakeholders.

• Works with business and technical stakeholders to document business and technical workflows and reporting requirements.
  • Collaborates with the business and technical stakeholders to identify and document business use cases, key data elements, and to develop dashboard concepts.
  • Assists in translating business needs into data and reporting specifications to guide solution design and implementation.
  • Assists with development, documentation, review, and deployment of data artifacts to include user guides, transcripts, policies, training materials, and standard operating procedures.
  • Performs functional testing on dashboards, visualizations, and reports, including test plan creation, test case development, execution of tests, and defect tracking through resolution.
  • Conducts data validation and quality assurance checks to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and reliability across systems and reports.
  • Assists with updating, maintaining, and monitoring data inventories to support data governance and traceability.
  • Performs other work-related duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Education
  • Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, or business administration is generally preferred.
  • Additional experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis. (High school diploma or equivalent certification with six (6) years of professional experience without degree).

Experience and Training Required
  • Five (5) years of experience in performing progressively responsible business analysis work.
  • Experience with at least one major data implementation.
  • Experience documenting process procedures into a Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) format.
  • Experience in analyzing processes and gathering requirements
column2: includes creating &ldquo
column3: as is&rdquo
column4: and &ldquo
column5: to be&rdquo
column6:
process maps.
  • Experience communicating and working collaboratively with all levels of staff and management.

column1:
Experience and Training Preferred
  • Experience with software development life cycle and systems development life cycle concepts.
  • Experience in project management principles and practices.
  • Experience using data analysis fundamentals.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  • Knowledge of the Data Management Body of Knowledge (DMBOK).
  • Skill in business analysis methodologies
column2: in analyzing and evaluating complex information technology applications, data sources, policies, and issues
column3:
and in developing creative and workable solutions to complex problems and issues.
  • Skill in business analysis and documentation of business processes with the goal of creating efficiencies.
  • Ability to analyze and interpret technical information, including regulations, policies, and automation system documentation/specifications
column4: to communicate in writing
column5: to translate user/business needs into a technical style
column6: to communicate technical instructions to system users
column7: to analyze, evaluate, and integrate business rules into system requirements
column8: to exercise sound judgment in making critical decisions
column9:
and to communicate effectively.
  • Ability to serve as a liaison with the data office and other teams (including ITS, PMO, business groups, and the AI division) to understand data needs and insights and work with developers to ensure that requirements and concepts are produced that meet customer needs.
  • Ability to assist with data quality initiatives, requirements gathering, and testing of dashboards prior to publishing.
  • Ability to use strong data analysis skills including analyzing and interpreting data sets and communicating the results.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective and cordial working relationships at all organizational levels, including agency management, direct supervisors, co-workers, internal and external customers.
  • Ability to understand, follow and convey brief oral and/or written instructions.
  • Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing, in a clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to support and contribute to a cohesive team environment.
  • Ability to work under pressure and exacting schedules to complete assigned tasks.
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule to meet required deadlines.
  • Ability to comply with all agency policy and applicable laws.
  • Ability to comply with all applicable safety rules, regulations, and standards.
  • Ability to maintain the security and integrity of any critical infrastructure researched, worked on, or accessed for work purposes.

column1:
Computer Skills
  • Proficiency in the use of a computer and applicable software necessary to perform work assignments e.g., word processing, spreadsheets (Microsoft Office preferred).

Other Requirements
  • Regular and punctual attendance at the workplace.
  • Criminal background check.

Working Conditions
  • Frequent use of computers, copiers, printers, and telephones.
  • Frequent standing, walking, sitting, listening, and talking.
  • Frequent work under stress, as a team member, and in direct contact with others.
  • Occasional bending, stooping, lifting, and climbing.

DFW Airport is seeking a Business Process Analyst to optimize the parts and materials acquisition process for our Energy, Transportation &amp
column2: Asset Management (ETAM) Department. This analytical and strategic role drives process improvements, enhances supply chain efficiency, and ensures that DFW&rsquo
column3: s infrastructure maintenance programs operate at peak performance.

column2: s operational goals.

column1: Prepare detailed reports and recommendations for senior management, summarizing key findings, trends, and improvement opportunities.

Evaluate and implement industry best practices in supply chain and materials management.
Assist in designing dashboards, KPIs, and performance tracking systems for materials management performance.

Job Description:
The Role

As a Senior Business Analyst at Fidelity Workplace Consulting, your role will be embedded in the Fidelity Workplace Investing Agile Model. You will assess business needs, outline detailed analyses, compose user stories with explicit descriptions and acceptance criteria, establish business acceptance testing plans and strategies, and offer solutions for medium to high complexity business needs.

Experience contributing to the development of multiple products simultaneously, including managing overlapping priorities, coordinating with multi-functional teams, and ensuring consistent delivery of business requirements across diverse initiatives.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to capture/document requirements and identify improvement opportunities.

column1: The Value You Deliver

You bring a unique blend of resilience, initiative, and strategic thinking that enables you to thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments. A self-starter who takes ownership of challenges and opportunities alike, with a strong predisposition toward action and continuous improvement.
Entrepreneurial and Creative: Approach problems with curiosity and creativity, always looking for innovative solutions and new ways to add value.
Collaborative Team Player: Work well across teams, valuing diverse perspectives and fostering a culture of trust and shared success.
Resourceful and Organized: Adept at juggling multiple priorities&mdash
column2: while staying focused and organized.

column2: t always clear, using strategic thinking and adaptability to navigate uncertainty.

column1: Strong Communicator: Bring clarity and confidence to both written and verbal communication, ensuring alignment and momentum across stakeholders.
The Team

The Fidelity Workplace Consulting Group is made up of over 600 professionals who advise clients on the management of their domestic and global benefits. We are a fast-growing business within Fidelity, offering a broad range of services that span benefits design, strategy, funding, communication, and delivery. Many of our team leaders bring experience from other leading consulting firms. While we primarily serve Fortune 1000 companies, we also work with Fidelity clients of all sizes ranging from Fortune 50 to tax-exempt market to Fortune 2000. For more information about Fidelity Workplace Consulting please visit this link: https://www.fidelityworkplace.com/s/workplaceconsulting.
The base salary range for this position is $80,000-153,000 USD per year.
Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate&rsquo
column2: s relevant experience, and other factors.

column1: Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.

We offer a wide range of benefits to meet your evolving needs and help you live your best life at work and at home. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage and emotional well-being support, market-leading retirement, generous paid time off and parental leave, charitable giving employee match program, and educational assistance including student loan repayment, tuition reimbursement, and learning resources to develop your career. Those laws and regulations may restrict Fidelity from hiring and/or associating with individuals with certain Criminal Histories.

in-f5cb235eba8d73f4,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=f5cb235eba8d73f4,https://recruiting.paylocity.com/recruiting/jobs/Details/3716987/TG-Natural-Resources/Upstream-Operations-Data-Analyst?source=Indeed_Feed,Upstream Operations Data Analyst,,"Carthage, TX, US",2025-11-13,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"

Position Summary

The Upstream Operations Data Analyst will be a key contributor in managing and analyzing drilling and completion data to support optimization and performance improvement across the organization. This individual will serve as a key link between field operations, engineering, and leadership by transforming raw operational data into meaningful insights that drive informed decision-making. The ideal candidate brings strong analytical and visualization skills, a proactive mindset with a passion for improving workflows and data integrity, and a general understanding of upstream oil and gas operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop, Maintain, and enhance datasets, dashboards, and reporting tools that support daily drilling and completion performance tracking
  • Aggregate and validate large volumes of operational data from multiple internal and third-party systems to ensure data quality, consistency, and accessibility
  • Create visualizations and performance dashboards in Power BI, Spotfire, and Excel to communicate key metrics to technical and leadership teams
  • Facilitate generation of cost estimates and maintain ongoing progress tracking for project budgets and schedules
  • Conduct analytical deep dives into drilling, completion, and production datasets to identify performance trends, cost drivers, and efficiency opportunities
  • Support engineering and operations teams by providing workflow automation solutions
  • Collaborate with IT, engineers, and operations personnel to standardize data collection, nomenclature, and reporting processes
  • Maintain and evolve master data structures for drilling and completions
  • Assist in developing and implementing data governance best practices to ensure consistent, reliable data across platforms
  • Contribute to ongoing digital transformation and continuous improvement initiatives focused on enhancing visibility, automation, and decision support

Qualifications

  • Bachelor&rsquo
column2:
s degree in Data Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Petroleum Technology, or a related field (preferred)
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and Spotfire for data analysis and visualization. Familiarity with Microsoft Project also preferred
  • Experience with SQL, Python, or similar tools for data querying, transforming, or automation
  • Demonstrated ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights
  • Passion for contributing to collaborating and working with teams to innovate, develop, and continuously develop and improve systems and processes
  • Ability to travel monthly with occasional overnight stay required
  • Prior experience in upstream oil &
column3:
gas, preferably with exposure to drilling, completions, or production operations
  • Understanding of upstream operational data flows (daily drilling reports, completion reports, cost tracking, time/depth data, etc.)
  • Familiarity with data warehouse environments and API-based data integration
  • Background in supporting multi-rig, multi-pad, or multi-fleet operations with analytics and reporting solutions

column1:
Core Competencies

  • Collaborative Team Player: Engages effectively with engineering, operations, and IT to align data efforts with business objectives
  • Self-Starter: Driven to identify opportunities, streamline workflows, and deliver value with minimal supervision
  • Analytical: Enthusiastic about uncovering insights to improve efficiency and reduce cost
  • Detail-Oriented: Ensures data integrity and reporting accuracy in fast-paced operational environments
  • Communicative: Able to present findings in formats which are clear to both technical and non-technical stakeholders within the organization
",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,Texas

column1: Job Title: Data Scientist: Customer Insights &
column2: Omnichannel Intelligence Analyst

column1: Location: Remote, United States (travel required)
Position Overview
The Customer Insights &
column2: Omnichannel Intelligence Analyst plays a key role in transforming complex customer data into strategic insights that drive marketing performance, enhance customer experience, and improve operational efficiency. Working at the intersection of data science, marketing analytics, and business strategy, this role builds predictive models, designs experiments, and delivers actionable intelligence to support growth across a dynamic omnichannel retail environment.

column1: Area of Responsibility
Analyze behavioral, transactional, demographic, and engagement data across digital and in-store channels to understand customer journeys, segmentation, and lifetime value.
Build and refine marketing attribution and ROI models to connect customer behavior and sales performance to campaigns (email, paid media, loyalty, etc.).
Integrate and align data across ecommerce, mobile app, CRM, POS, and loyalty platforms to create a unified view of customer activity and business impact.
Develop machine learning models and advanced analytics to forecast trends, recommend next-best-actions, and optimize campaigns and promotions.
Design and analyze A/B and multivariate experiments using uplift modeling and causal inference techniques.
Collaborate with marketing, ecommerce, merchandising, operations, and executive teams to translate data findings into strategy, priorities, and performance dashboards.
Create compelling visualizations and presentations to communicate insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Evaluate third-party data sources and platforms for predictive value and integration opportunities.
Document data sources, definitions, models, and strategies for transparency and reproducibility.
Apply innovative analytical approaches to drive business impact and support decision-making.
Qualifications:
Advanced degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering, Data Science, or related quantitative field.
3&ndash
column2: 5 years of experience in predictive analytics, data analysis, or business intelligence, ideally in retail, ecommerce, or consumer-facing environments.

column1: High proficiency in SAS (Base SAS and SAS Enterprise Miner certifications preferred).
Experience with R, SQL, Python, or other analytical tools.
Familiarity with data visualization platforms such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong skills in Excel and Microsoft Office.
Experience in marketing analytics, customer segmentation, and attribution modeling.
Understanding of omnichannel retail ecosystems and customer data platforms (CDPs).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks, AWS, GCP) is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to bridge technical and business domains.
Intellectual curiosity, strategic thinking, and a passion for data-driven decision-making.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with CRM systems or loyalty program data.
Familiarity with retail KPIs such as sell-through, basket size, foot traffic, ROAS, and channel attribution.
Knowledge of MLOps, dashboard automation, or API-based data workflows.

What We're Looking For
The Slate Data Analyst supports Baylor University&rsquo
column2: s mission by developing, maintaining, and optimizing data systems within Technolutions Slate for Enrollment Management. This position leverages Slate&rsquo
column3: s querying and reporting tools, particularly Configurable Joins, to ensure accurate, targeted audience segmentation, data-driven insights, and effective communication workflows across the admissions lifecycle. The analyst partners closely with admissions, marketing, and data operations teams to support recruitment strategy, workflow efficiency, and institutional goals.

column1: A bachelor's degree and two years of work experience are required. Five years of relevant experience is preferred.

Successful candidates will possess and exhibit the following knowledge, skills and abilities:
• Strong analytical and technical skills, including database design, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
• Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Proficiency with SQL or other database programming languages.
• Experience working collaboratively across teams to meet deadlines and project goals.
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a data-driven environment.
• Strong organizational and problem-solving skills, with a commitment to continuous learning and technology adoption.

• Experience using Power BI or other data visualization and reporting tools.
• Knowledge of higher education recruitment processes, CRM workflows, and enrollment management data systems.

Job Description

Business Analyst (BA) is needed to support the legislatively approved Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) projects. PEMS is a centralized electronic method for Medicaid and non-Medicaid program providers interested in enrolling to submit a single application, in a single location (a web portal), to be accepted and processed by a single entity based on their National Provider Identifier (NPI). HHSC would like to make significant changes to PEMS to improve the provider experience and system functionality.
The Worker will serve as a Business Analyst/Product Owner for the PEMS project and support activities as needed. The Worker will work directly with internal units (Provider Services)
column2: TMHP technical sprint teams
column3: and business users to provide subject matter expertise, perform critical analysis, ensure requirements are gathered that meet the functional needs and assist in creating and maintaining a prioritized and healthy backlog as directed by the legislative mandate.

column1: The Worker will be responsible for delivering quality products that meet the state's desired operational and technical requirements. The worker will have considerable latitude to use their experience and judgement to ensure successful completion of their assigned tasks. The Worker will be required to multi-task, analyze priorities, communicate clearly, and set expectations for the phases of the project. The Worker will be responsible for communicating with multiple internal and external stakeholders including program and technical staff, and other contracted and vendor resources. The Worker will participate in meetings, track deliverables and schedules, and alert management of any issues that may impact providers.
The services to be provided include, but are not limited to the following:
A. Analyzes program policies, procedures, and processes to determine the impact on business systems and functional areas.

B. Analyzes and reviews system, data, and project deliverables such as business user requirements, design documentation, test plans, and risk assessment plans to ensure business and technical requirements are met.
C. Works with program area staff to solicit, analyze and document business processes and requirements.
D. Acts as a liaison between state staff and vendors to translate operational and business requirements to vendors.
E. Serves as the Product Owner for an Agile team, including working with Agile/Scrum teams of contracted software vendors to implement system changes.
F. Analyzes and writes User Stories with Acceptance Criteria based on business needs and according to the Agile methodology.
G. Develops and maintains business user test scenarios and participates in systems and user acceptance testing.
H. Creates use case scenarios, test plans, and exit criteria that accurately map back to the documented business requirements or user stories.
I. Reviews, analyzes and executes test cases with a formal testing tool.
J. Tracks, documents and reports the status of testing.
K. Evaluates proposed test strategies to ensure appropriate test coverage.
L. Identifies potential project risks and issues and develops mitigation strategies,
M. Reports project status to management on established timelines.
N. Documents action items and business decisions.
O. Conducts meetings and/or presentation tasks as needed.
P. Manages schedule for deliverables as established.
Q. Other duties as assigned related to PEMS projects.
II. CANDIDATE SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Requirements:
Candidates that do not meet or exceed the minimum stated requirements (skills/experience) will be displayed to customers but may not be chosen for this opportunity.

Required

Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the Texas Health and Human Services Commission. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed.
The primary work location(s) will be at 701 W. 51st, Austin, Texas 78751. The working position is On Site.

Please do not submit candidates who are currently out of state and are planning to move to Texas. Candidates must already reside in Texas.

Brief Job Description

The Data Analyst V performs highly complex (senior-level) data collection, reporting, and analysis to monitor, evaluate, and increase efficiencies for PFD. The position acts as a liaison between PFD, HHS policy, and program areas. This position oversees, plans, directs, and monitors key analytic functions relating to the QRU team&rsquo
column2: s day-to-day activities. The Data Analyst works with various teams to explore different aspects of a system (people, policy, and processes) to determine why particular areas are performing well or have opportunities for improvement.

column1: Essential Job Functions
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Data Analysis and Visualization: Work involves conducting detailed analysis of data sets, including monitoring and ensuring data quality, to be used as input for performance dashboards and reports. Compiles, queries, and loads data points using SQL and other query languages into databases from a variety of source formats to support complex analyses. Cleans and prepares data, as necessary, to produce data required for data visualization software products and develops resulting dashboards. 25%
Reporting: Oversees development and develops high-quality written project updates and reports
column2: guides the selection of data management tools, the development of standards, usage guidelines, and procedures for those tools. Defines, develops, and implements data standards. Determines trends and resolves operational problems related to performance and quality measure data across multiple programs. Coordinates with others who collect, organize, analyze, and prepare materials in response to requests for information and reports specific to performance measure data. Analyzes performance measure data using standard tools, methods, and techniques. Prepares concise, comprehensive technical reports to present and interpret data
column3: makes recommendations on revisions to data collection methodologies. Develops software applications or programming to use for statistical modeling and graphic analysis. 25%

column1: Coordination: Utilizes strong communication skills to explain PFD and QRU business processes and negotiate for information and resources needed to ensure successful Program initiatives. Consults with internal and external stakeholders regarding program performance measures. Coordinates with Program subject matter experts to ensure accuracy of reporting tools, workflows, and reporting procedures. Provides direction to other areas providing data support
column2: may supervise the work of others. 10%

column1: Data Quality/Integrity: Establishes and updates data quality metrics, recommending and implementing improvements to data quality associated with processes. Ensures data integrity by identifying data gaps, errors, anomalies, inconsistencies, and redundancies in the content, structure, and relationships within data
column2: coordinates with stakeholders to improve data quality. Interprets results to identify significant differences in data. Identifies and interprets data patterns and trends and assesses data quality. 10%

column1: Identifies and Implements Improvements: Provides suggestions regarding systematic changes to improve data collection and align data infrastructure with business needs. Provides routine updates on the status of projects and initiatives. 10%

Infrastructure Support: Oversees, plans, directs, and monitors key analytic functions relating to the day-to-day activities of the QRU team. Consults and provides requirements for developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Oversees the evaluation of performance measure reporting activities to ensure program reporting requirements are met. May perform quality assurance and serve as a subject matter expert on data integrity, extraction, and compilation. 10%
Performs other related work as assigned. 10%
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
<ul>
• Ability to work collaboratively across PFD to accomplish objectives.
• A keen attention to detail and the ability to implement creative solutions to problems.
• Able to balance team and individual responsibilities.
• Knowledge of data analysis techniques and best practices.
• Knowledge of PFD and other areas within HHS.
• Knowledge of data quality and integrity processes.
• Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of database and application design, development, and structure.
• Skill in complex analytic work, identifying trends, concerns, recommending opportunities for improvement, as well as areas of excellence.
• Skill in using SQL, SAS, SPSS, Python, and other query languages.
• Skill in using Extract, Transform, and Load tools.
• Knowledge of and experience with reporting and visualization tools.
• Skill in communicating to both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Ability to work on a team, and to be flexible and creative with data demands.
• Ability to plan, organize, and conduct data analytic projects.
• Ability to develop and interpret data charts, maps, and tables.
• Ability to interpret and publish data analytic findings.
• Ability to exercise independent judgment and show initiative.
• Ability to maintain detailed and organized documentation of data analytic projects.
<li>Ability to compile, review, and analyze data
column2: to prepare reports
column3: to maintain accuracy and attention to detail
column4: to communicate effectively
column5: and to supervise the work of others.

Brief Job Description:

The Business Analyst (Business Analyst II) position reports to the Director of Operations, Administrative Applications. The Business Analyst (BA) performs business analysis work in support of Rapid Application Development (RAD) using the Salesforce platform and in support of the HHSC Grants Management System. This role works closely with business owners through the product planning, requirements definition, and delivery of cycles for Salesforce solutions and web-based enterprise-wide usage. The BA is the bridge between the customer and the development team. Assists in the analysis of complex technical and business processes, identifying efficiencies and helping to prioritize needs. Coordinates the gathering, development, and documentation of all requirements. The BA works in partnership with Information Technology (IT) and subject matter experts, helping customers realize business value. This position works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Responsible for the creation and validation of system testing.
Must be willing to work from an HHS office designated by the hiring manager 3, or more, days per week located in Austin, TX.
Essential Job Functions:

Elicits and oversees the business requirements for the implementation of Salesforce solutions to solve system-wide business requests. When necessary, fulfills the role of the Product Owner to act as the voice of the customer. Accurately represents business needs and effectively communicates them with stakeholders and development team. Maintains documentation, including updates to system training materials. (35%)

Creates and manages the product backlog by eliciting, and documenting all types of requirements as themes, epics, user stories with user acceptance criteria. Works with all stakeholders to prioritize the backlog into a complete and cohesive representation of a products&rsquo
column2: roadmap, defects, and technical debt. (20%)

column1: Collaborates daily with manager to ensure product roadmaps and delivery of features follows a predictable and steady pace through daily stand-up meetings, product planning meetings, and other key ceremonies. Participates in Agile ceremonies and leads them when the Product Owner or Scrum Master is not available. (20%)
Performs functional testing and manages User Acceptance Testing by ensuring adequate test cases exists and all User Acceptance Criteria are met. (15%)
Develops deep expertise with assigned application. Obtains stakeholder sign off on requirements and priorities. Performs other duties as assigned. (10%)
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of experience with Agile/Scrum methodology practices.
Knowledge in Salesforce configuration, using development and testing environments for effective change management.
Knowledge of the capabilities and limitations of computer systems or management information systems.
Knowledge of large-scale IT operations and information technology industry trends.
Knowledge of process or systems analysis and design work.
Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) process for report development.
Knowledge of software usability concepts.
Skill in defining all types of requirements, functional specifications, and other deliverables.
Skill in business/systems analysis.
Skill in working collaboratively and cooperatively with colleagues and in building consensus.

Skill in interpersonal relationships, including the ability to work with people under pressure, negotiate among multiple parties, resolve conflicts, and establish and maintain effective working relationships with various levels of personnel in governmental entities.
Skill in troubleshooting, performance tuning, and problem-solving.
Skill in verbal, written, and presentation communication.
Ability to guide technology decisions relative to the Salesforce requirements and serve as subject matter expert and design resource to others.
Ability to provide technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems, or questions about programs.
Ability to build consensus across multiple teams and working with teams located in different geographic locations.
Ability to work independently and deliver results in an environment of broad, consultative management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Ability to accurately track time spent working on projects, as well as the ability to accurately estimate changes or enhancements.
Registrations, Licensure Requirements, or Certifications:
Preferred Certified Scrum Product Owner or IIBA CBAP.
Initial Screening Criteria:

Graduation from a four-year college or university with major coursework in business, communications, computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field. Appropriate experience including working on complex enterprise-wide applications and experience writing epics, user stories including acceptance criteria may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis up to four years.
Minimum of 5 (five) years of experience working on complex enterprise-wide applications. Minimum of 5 (five) years of experience in an analysis role that required complex problem solving.
Minimum of 5 (five) years of experience writing epics, user stories including acceptance criteria, and definition of done.
Minimum of 3 (three) years of experience with Agile methodologies &ndash
column2: (Scrum, for example).
