Overview
Since our founding in 1924, we've cut cardiovascular disease deaths in half, but there is still so much more to do. To overcome today&rsquo
column2: s biggest health challenges and accelerate this progress, we need passionate individuals like you. Join our movement, be part of the progress, and help ensure a healthier future for all. You matter, and so does the impact you can make with us.

column1: This internship supports the Data Science team and offers hands-on experience in data science and statistical analysis within clinical or biomedical research settings. Interns will contribute to the development of machine learning models, conduct experimental design and evaluation, and assist in summarizing results and drafting manuscripts. You will have the opportunity to work closely with staff across departments and contribute to impactful, high-quality research.
The American Heart Association&rsquo
column2: s Internship Program provides college students an opportunity for hands-on experience in various facets for individuals interested in gaining work experience with a non-profit, voluntary health organization.

column1: The Association offers many resources to help you maintain work-life harmonization through your changing needs and life situations. To help you be successful, you will have access to Heart U, our award-winning corporate university, as well as training and support locally and through our National Center.
\#TheAHALife is more than a company culture
column2: it is our way of life. It embodies our commitment to work-life harmonization and is guided by our core values where our employees can thrive both personally and professionally. Discover why you will Be Seen. Be Heard. Be Valued at the American Heart Association by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, X, and at heart.jobs.

column1: Internship Overview:
• Time Commitment: 25 hours per week
• Internship Duration: 1/26/26-5/1/26
• Location:Remote
• Salary: $23.00 per hour
Internship Outcomes:
Individuals participating in the internship program are provided with an opportunity to:
• Gain important and practical job skills to be successful in a non-profit environment.
• Opportunity to explore a career-path with a reputable voluntary health/service organization.
• Complete an internship that enriches your academic and professional resume as well as enriching your personal life by making a difference in the lives of others.
Responsibilities
Tasks could include things like the following:
• Retrieve, process, and clean large-scale biomedical data, build high-quality datasets.
• Design and develop machine learning models for clinical or biomedical research, with a focus on Large Language Models (LLMs), medical imaging, or multimodal AI.
• Conduct experimental design and evaluation, including statistical analysis, performance assessment, error analysis, and robustness testing.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including clinicians, data scientists, and engineers, to refine research questions and interpret results.
• Contribute to scientific writing, including drafting manuscripts for peer-reviewed journals and preparing materials for presentations or conferences.
• Develop interactive data visualization tools to communicate insights clearly.
Qualifications
• Currently pursuing an MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Informatics, Engineering, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.

• Demonstrated experience with large-scale machine learning or foundation models, including training, fine-tuning, and evaluating LLMs (e.g., GPT, BERT) or vision models (e.g., CNNs, Vision Transformers.
• Strong programming skills in Python (or R), with experience in machine learning frameworks.
• In-depth knowledge of study design, data analysis, and statistical methodologies, with prior experience working with clinical or biomedical data (e.g., EHRs, images.
• Prior authorship or co-authorship of peer-reviewed publications is strongly preferred.
• Experience with interactive visualization tools (e.g., Plotly, Dash, D3.js, or React) is a plus.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Ability to deal professionally in a corporate or non-profit environment and assume responsibility for guiding projects and programs from inception through completion.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment managing multiple priorities involving multiple entities.
• Intermediate to excellent proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint.
• Minimum availability of 20 hrs/wk, M-F between the hours of 8:00am-5:00pm.
• Required Equipment: Reliable WiFi Connection.

• Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship, now or in the future. For any roles working remotely, the work must also be performed inside the United States, not in a foreign country.

Onsite- No Remote Work (Must live in Austin TX area)
I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES

Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standard business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.
The Business Automation Support (BAS) unit within the Medicaid and CHIP Services (MCS) Department oversees Texas Medicaid &
column2: Healthcare Partnership (TMHP) systems and related support activities. BAS provides oversight of LTC program systems, which supports LTC providers for services delivered to individuals
column3: modifications and updates to TMHP vendor systems
column4: and encounter data and MCO file support and coordination.

column1: A Business Analyst (BA) is needed to support the legislatively approved Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) projects. PEMS is a centralized electronic method for Medicaid and non-Medicaid program providers interested in enrolling to submit a single application, in a single location (a web portal), to be accepted and processed by a single entity based on their National Provider Identifier (NPI). HHSC would like to make significant changes to PEMS to improve the provider experience and system functionality.
The Worker will serve as a Business Analyst/Product Owner for the PEMS project and support activities as needed. The Worker will work directly with internal units (Provider Services)
column2: TMHP technical sprint teams
column3: and business users to provide subject matter expertise, perform critical analysis, ensure requirements are gathered that meet the functional needs and assist in creating and maintaining a prioritized and healthy backlog as directed by the legislative mandate.

column1: The Worker will be responsible for delivering quality products that meet the state's desired operational and technical requirements. The worker will have considerable latitude to use their experience and judgement to ensure successful completion of their assigned tasks. The Worker will be required to multi-task, analyze priorities, communicate clearly, and set expectations for the phases of the project. The Worker will be responsible for communicating with multiple internal and external stakeholders including program and technical staff, and other contracted and vendor resources. The Worker will participate in meetings, track deliverables and schedules, and alert management of any issues that may impact providers.
The services to be provided include, but are not limited to the following:
• Analyzes program policies, procedures, and processes to determine the impact on business systems and functional areas.

• Analyzes and reviews system, data, and project deliverables such as business user requirements, design documentation, test plans, and risk assessment plans to ensure business and technical requirements are met.
• Works with program area staff to solicit, analyze and document business processes and requirements.
• Acts as a liaison between state staff and vendors to translate operational and business requirements to vendors.
• Serves as the Product Owner for an Agile team, including working with Agile/Scrum teams of contracted software vendors to implement system changes.
• Analyzes and writes User Stories with Acceptance Criteria based on business needs and according to the Agile methodology.
• Develops and maintains business user test scenarios and participates in systems and user acceptance testing.
• Creates use case scenarios, test plans, and exit criteria that accurately map back to the documented business requirements or user stories.
• Reviews, analyzes and executes test cases with a formal testing tool.
• Tracks, documents and reports the status of testing.
• Evaluates proposed test strategies to ensure appropriate test coverage.
• Identifies potential project risks and issues and develops mitigation strategies.
• Reports project status to management on established timelines.
• Documents action items and business decisions.
• Conducts meetings and/or presentation tasks as needed.
• Manages schedule for deliverables as established.
• Other duties as assigned related to PEMS projects.
II. CANDIDATE SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Link Technologies (LinkTechConsulting.com), a Las Vegas-based IT consulting firm, is currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our team.

JOB SUMMARY
This role will help support the Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) projects. PEMS is a centralized electronic method for Medicaid and non-Medicaid program providers interested in enrolling to submit a single application, in a single location (a web portal), to be accepted and processed by a single entity based on their National Provider Identifier (NPI). The position will work directly with internal units (provider services), technical sprint teams, and business users to provide subject matter expertise, perform critical analysis, ensure requirements are gathered that meet the functional needs, and assist in creating and maintaining a prioritized and healthy backlog.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of eight (8) years of experience in the following areas:

  • Business analyst and agile product owner role
  • Utilizing the Agile software development methodology

  • Reporting project status to management, including risks, issues, and key decisions

in-350e872f31f16f32,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=350e872f31f16f32,http://www.indeed.com/job/data-analyst-sql-tableau-prior-capital-one-exp-350e872f31f16f32,"Data Analyst - SQL, Tableau (Prior Capital One Exp)",Appex Innovation,"Dallas, TX, US",2025-11-13,contract,direct_data,yearly,93600.0,114400.0,USD,True,,,,,"

Overview
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, developing insightful reports, and supporting strategic decision-making processes. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge analytics tools and methodologies, contributing to the organization&rsquo
column2:
s data-driven initiatives. The position requires a strong foundation in data analysis, business intelligence, and database management, with proficiency in various analytical and visualization platforms.

Responsibilities

  • Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets using SQL, R, Python, and ETL tools such as Talend and Looker.
  • Design and develop dashboards and reports utilizing Tableau, Power BI, and Looker to visualize key metrics.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
  • Support project management activities within Agile frameworks, ensuring timely delivery of analytics projects aligned with SDLC best practices.
  • Perform database design and management using Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, and linked data sources to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
  • Develop automation scripts using VBA, Bash (Unix shell), or other scripting languages to streamline data processing workflows.
  • Conduct business analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for process improvements.
  • Document processes using Visio and maintain comprehensive documentation of data models and analysis procedures.
  • Stay current with industry trends in analytics tools such as Business Analysis techniques, Data Analysis Skills, and emerging technologies.

Requirements

  • Proven experience with SQL databases (Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle) and ETL processes.
  • Strong proficiency in data visualization tools including Tableau, Power BI, and Looker.
  • Hands-on experience with programming languages such as R and Python for data analysis.
  • Knowledge of SDLC methodologies and Agile project management practices.
  • Familiarity with database design principles and linked data concepts.
  • Ability to perform complex analysis skills with attention to detail.
  • Experience working with Bash (Unix shell), VBA macros, Talend, Visio, and other relevant tools is a plus.
  • Excellent business analysis skills coupled with strong communication abilities to interpret technical findings for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects effectively within a fast-paced environment. This position provides an excellent platform for professionals passionate about leveraging data analytics to drive business success while working in a collaborative environment that values innovation and continuous learning.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $45.00 - $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

  • Capital One: 1 year (Required)
  • Data analytics: 7 years (Required)
  • SQL: 5 years (Required)
  • Tableau: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Dallas, TX 75204

in-a9f4ff31ea19a2f4,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a9f4ff31ea19a2f4,https://jobs.smartrecruiters.com/Guidehealth/3743990010308425-senior-analyst-vbc-strategy-and-performance-remote,"Senior Analyst, VBC Strategy and Performance - Remote",Guidehealth,"Dallas, TX, US",2025-11-13,fulltime,direct_data,yearly,110000.0,125000.0,USD,True,,,,,"
Company Description
WHO IS GUIDEHEALTH?

Guidehealth is a data-powered, performance-driven healthcare company dedicated to operational excellence. Our goal is to make great healthcare affordable, improve the health of patients, and restore the fulfillment of practicing medicine for providers. Driven by empathy and powered by AI and predictive analytics, Guidehealth leverages remotely-embedded Healthguides&trade
column2: and a centralized Managed Service Organization to build stronger connections with patients and providers. Physician-led, Guidehealth empowers our partners to deliver high-quality healthcare focused on outcomes and value inside and outside the exam room for all patients.

column1: Join us as we put healthcare on a better path!!
Job Description
The Senior Analyst, VBC Strategy and Performance plays a critical role in driving success with Guidehealth&rsquo
column2: s value-based care (VBC) client. This colleague will collaborate closely with VP and C-level clients at Guidehealth&rsquo
column3: s partner providers and with Guidehealth&rsquo
column4: s operational leaders, senior executives, analytics and finance teams to advance achievement of performance incentives in our VBC contracts. This colleague will analyze data to track performance and identify potential improvement opportunities, validate those analyses and opportunities with operational leaders, facilitate internal and client-facing performance meetings and ideation sessions, scope and manage capability-building projects, and work with our data and analytics colleagues to build new reporting and ensure timely delivery of critical data. This colleague&rsquo
column5: s insights and work will have high visibility with our executive leadership team and our Board of Directors, and the colleague will be able to grow at Guidehealth through their frequent C-level exposure.

column1: WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Performance management and improvement
Internal performance optimization

Working with operational and data leaders to structure, execute, and validate analyses that identify opportunities to improve performance including medical cost, patient engagement, quality of care, and other metrics
Supporting operational leads in performance management and C-level leadership progress updates, including regular performance reviews
Expanding reporting capabilities by identifying and scoping new reports for different levels of the organization and working with our data and analytics teams to build and deliver them

Identifying and validating potential performance improvement opportunities and work closely with our operational and technical leads to scope new projects, initiatives, and capability builds to capture them
Helping manage ongoing performance improvement and capability-build projects, supporting our project management teams with critical analyses and insights to ensure our efforts stay on-track
Client delivery support
Working with Guidehealth and client operators to prepare for standing meetings by preparing and aggregating materials and managing the project cadence
Attending, facilitating, and in some cases leading these standing meetings (mix of hybrid and in-person) and ensuring timely execution of next steps
Leading ad hoc projects with clients and internal teams targeted at specific opportunities using an agile execution approach (e.g., sprints to improve patient engagement or quality of care)
Preparing opportunity analyses for validation and presentation to client operators and leadership
Qualifications
WHAT YOU'LL NEED FOR SUCCESS
Bachelor's Degree
2-3 years of experience in management consulting or healthcare corporate leadership development
Strong generalist toolkit: Excel, PowerPoint, Creation of Executive Communications
Entrepreneurial mind set and willingness to proactively advance your ideas and thinking
Expert level analytical skills
Open to domestic travel 1-2 nights every 2 weeks
Additional Information
The salary range for this role is $110,000.00 to $125,000.00 per year.
ALIVE with Purpose: How We Thrive at Guidehealth
At Guidehealth, our values come to life in everything we do.
We are Driven by Accountability &mdash
column2: grounded in transparency, reliability, and integrity as we navigate challenges and opportunities alike.

column1: Always Growing, Always Learning &mdash
column2: staying curious and continuously improving inspires us to shape a better future for healthcare.

column1: With Collaborative Innovation, we solve problems creatively, making every experience better for our employees and the patients we serve.
At Guidehealth, Every Voice Matters &mdash
column2: we believe our collective strength is rooted in the unique perspectives of each team member.

column1: And through Empathy in Action, we build stronger connections with those who count on us.
This is what it means to be ALIVE with purpose. This is how we thrive &mdash
column2: together &mdash
column3: at Guidehealth.

column1: BENEFITS:

All full-time employees of Guidehealth who work 30 hours per week or more are eligible for our comprehensive benefits package. While you are hard at work advancing value-based healthcare, we are here to ensure YOU have the care you and your family need and the opportunities for growth and development. Our commitments to you include:
Work from Home: Guidehealth is a fully remote company, providing you the flexibility to spend less time commuting and more time focusing on your professional goals and personal needs.
Keep Health a Priority: We offer comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision plans to keep you covered.
Plan for the Future: Our 401(k) plan includes a 3% employer match to your 6% contribution.
Have Peace of Mind: We provide Life and Disability insurance for those &quot
column2: just in case&quot
column3: moments. Additionally, we offer voluntary Life options to keep you and your loved ones protected.

column1: Feel Supported When You Need It Most: Our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is here to help you through tough times.
Take Time for Yourself: We offer paid time off plans helping you achieve work-life balance and meet your personal goals.
Support Your New Family: Welcoming a new family member takes time and commitment. Guidehealth offers paid parental leave to give you the time you need.
Learn and Grow: Your professional growth is important to us. Guidehealth offers various resources dedicated to your learning and development to advance your career with us.
COMPENSATION:

The listed compensation range listed is paid bi-weekly per our standard payroll practices. Final base pay decisions are dependent upon a variety of factors which may include, but are not limited to: skill set, years of relevant experience, education, location, and licensure/certifications.
OUR COMMITMENT TO EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT
Diversity, inclusion, and belonging are at the core of Guidehealth&rsquo
column2: s values. We are an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation and identity, national origin, citizenship, religion, marital status, familial status, physical, sensory, or medical disability, Family and Medical Leave, military or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth or other related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. Our management is fully dedicated to ensuring the fulfillment of this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruitment advertising, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.

column1: OUR COMITTMENT TO PROTECTION OF PATIENT AND COMPANY DATA
This position is responsible for following all Security policies and procedures in order to protect all PHI and PII under Guidehealth&rsquo
column2: s custodianship as well as Guidehealth Intellectual Properties. For any security-specific roles, the responsibilities would be further defined by the hiring manager.

column1: REMOTE WORK TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Guidehealth is a fully remote company. We provide new employees with the necessary equipment to function in their role at no charge to the employee. Employees provide their own internet connection, capable of conducting video calls on camera and connecting to various internal and external systems. The required internet speed is a minimum of 100 mbps download, 10 mbps upload. Please run a speed test here to confirm your internet connection meets these requirements.

column1: Boeing Global Services (BGS) has an exciting opportunity in the BGS Supply Chain Strategy team for a Supply Chain Category Analyst. This team is responsible for supply chain category strategy across all BGS businesses. This role is located in Dallas, TX
column2: Plano, TX
column3: <b> Seattle, WA
column4: Everett, WA.

column1: Integral to the profitable execution of the BGS business, Supply Chain Category Management is responsible for developing and implementing category plans to improve supply chain delivery and execution. Specifically, this role is responsible for:
Designs, extracts, analyzes and prepares reports

Data analysis, including analyzing and synthesizing procurement data, such as spend, part classification, supply chain planning / forecasting, cost performance, delivery performance, quality performance, etc., across all BGS businesses
Develops, analyzes and maintains processes, tools, information and industry best practices in support of Category Management and procurement processes

Utilizes multiples data sources to baseline current state and develop alternatives, such as potential suppliers for dual sourcing, understanding how to connect and balance customer requirements with supplier capacity, and improving supplier performance
Informs sourcing activities, including strategic sourcing, alternate / dual sourcing, part qualification, customer qualification / approval, long-term contracting
Assesses requests for information (RFI), requests for proposal (RFP), requests for quote (RFQ), and/or other solicitations
Assists in developing new sources / manufacturers, including conducting capability assessments, capacity assessments, customer and part qualification / approval
Collaborates with BCA and BDS Category Management

The successful candidate is a motivated self-starter who is fueled by curiosity and applies structure and discipline to drive thoughtful and thorough data analysis to create value for Boeing and its customers.
The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options:
Dallas, TX
Plano, TX
Seattle, WA
Everett, WA
We need a Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our team and bring the following:

Data analysis. Structures data in an organized way, identifies issues and risks, analyzes data inside and outside Boeing to develop alternatives. Tracks progress through KPIs, makes performance accessible to all through dashboards and regular reviews, enables Category Managers and leadership to understand issues and track progress.

Data reporting. Access to and familiarity with all BGS Supply Chain reporting systems. Deep understanding of problems and issues with ability to synthesize many data sources and develop actionable steps and takeaways.
Continuous improvement. Originates action to improve existing conditions and processes
column2: uses appropriate methods to identify opportunities, implements solutions, and measures impact.

in-d483ceaf62d9f63a,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=d483ceaf62d9f63a,https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/sanantoniotx/jobs/5141366/human-resources-analyst-recruitment-staffing,Human Resources Analyst - Recruitment & Staffing,City of San Antonio,"San Antonio, TX, US",2025-11-12,fulltime,direct_data,yearly,50221.0,75332.0,USD,False,,,,,"

Job Summary

Under general direction, is responsible for performing professional human resources work in the Recruitment Division of the Human Resources Department. Individuals in this position exercise independent judgment and perform assignments consistent with the policies and goals of the department. May exercise supervision over assigned staff.
Primary Work Location
City Tower - 100 W. Houston Street, San Antonio, TX
Work Schedule
7:45 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., Monday - Friday
column2: Occasional evenings and weekends required.

column1: Essential Job Functions

• Assists in the development and implementation of marketing strategies to advance the City of San Antonio brands throughout diverse markets and professional communities and to promote each city department as a prime employer of choice.
Partners and coordinates with hiring managers to identify department needs and trends in order to source the best talent to fulfill position needs.

Establishes and maintains candidate eligibility lists by reviewing applications, resumes, and credentials for appropriateness of skills, experience, and knowledge in relation to position requirements.
Extends offers of employment to selected candidates under the direction of the department and within the guidelines of the City's compensation policy.
Maintains a network of contacts and cost-effective recruiting resources to help identify and source qualified leads and recruit the very best candidates.

Participates in external recruitment efforts, including job fairs, outreach events, and promotional activities to provide complete, accurate, and inspiring information to candidates about the City of San Antonio and its employment opportunities.
Prepares reports, presentations, program plans, and statistical analysis utilizing Microsoft Office Suite.
Researches and analyzes data to obtain information for formulating projects, plans, surveys, reports, strategies, forecasts, and trends.
Assists the Human Resources project managers and coordinators with projects and special assignments.
Performs related duties and fulfills responsibilities as required.
Job Requirements
• Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with preferable coursework in Human Resources, Public Administration, Business, or other related field.
Valid Class 'C' Texas Driver's License.
Preferred Qualifications
Two (2) years of experience in Human Resources recruitment utilizing proactive recruiting and outreach techniques.
Knowledge of SAP.
Knowledge of NEOGOV Applicant Tracking System.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Teams).
Bilingual in English and Spanish (speak and write).
Applicant Information

Unless otherwise stated, applicants are permitted to substitute two years of related full-time experience for one year of higher education or one year of related higher education for two years of experience in order to meet the minimum requirements of the job. One year of full-time experience is defined as 30 or more hours worked per week for 12 months. One year of higher education is defined as 30 credit hours completed at an accredited college or university.

Applicants selected for employment with the City of San Antonio in this position must receive satisfactory results from pre-employment drug testing and background checks. If required for the position, a physical, motor vehicle record evaluation, and additional background checks may be conducted.

Please be advised that if selected for this position, information regarding employment history as it relates to the qualifications of the position will be needed for employment verification. Applicants claiming military service to meet the experience requirement for this position may attach a DD214 to the application.

If selected for this position, official transcripts, diplomas, certifications, and licenses must be submitted at the time of processing. Unofficial transcripts and copies of other relevant documents may be attached to the application for consideration in advance.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
• Knowledge of and familiarity with related employment law and policies, such as the Fair Labor Standards Act, Equal Employment Opportunity, and the Americans with Disabilities Act.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods and basic mathematical skills.
Skill in utilizing personal computers and associated MS Windows- based software applications (e.g. Word, Excel) in the completion of assignments.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively.
Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision, and use rational judgment in making work-related decisions.
Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines for specific projects.
Ability to conduct necessary research in a timely and comprehensive manner.
Ability to plan and coordinate complex assignments, utilizing additional staff if necessary.
Ability to interact effectively and professionally with a wide variety of people on a daily basis.
Ability to perform all the essential functions of the position, with or without accommodations.

Ability to work primarily in an office environment.

San Antonio, TX 78205","10,000+",,"The City of San Antonio is the seventh-largest city in the country, and we are looking for great people to join our team!",,,,,,,Texas

column1: FHLB Dallas Offers a Professional, Inclusive Culture
FHL Bank Dallas employees are committed to and exemplify the following principles:
Service to our members is first and foremost
All business will be conducted honestly and ethically
Each employee contributes to customer service by directly serving our members or supporting those who do
Interaction with members should focus on building professional relationships and helping customers achieve their goals

column1: A Business Analyst (BA) is needed to support the legislatively approved Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) projects. PEMS is a centralized electronic method for Medicaid and non-Medicaid program providers interested in enrolling to submit a single application, in a single location (a web portal), to be accepted and processed by a single entity based on their National Provider Identifier (NPI). HHSC would like to make significant changes to PEMS to improve the provider experience and system functionality.
The Worker will serve as a Business Analyst/Product Owner for the PEMS project and support activities as needed. The Worker will work directly with internal units (Provider Services)
column2: TMHP technical sprint teams
column3: and business users to provide subject matter expertise, perform critical analysis, ensure requirements are gathered that meet the functional needs and assist in creating and maintaining a prioritized and healthy backlog as directed by the legislative mandate.

column1: The Worker will be responsible for delivering quality products that meet the state's desired operational and technical requirements. The Worker will be responsible for communicating with multiple internal and external stakeholders including program and technical staff, and other contracted and vendor resources. Title: Sales Analyst
Location: Bentonville, Arkansas
POSITION SUMMARY

The Sales Analyst supports the Walmart team at Petmate by generating and analyzing Retail Link and Report Builder data for both in-store and online sales. They provide insights to guide strategic decisions, assist in forecasting and joint business planning, and maintain reporting tools. The role works closely with the Walmart Director and Sr. Manager of Data Analytics.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze large datasets and clearly communicate insights to support business decisions.
Deliver weekly performance reports covering sales, in-stock levels, OTIF, and SQEP metrics.
Provide ad hoc analytical support for sales, marketing, and business management presentations.
Collaborate with Replenishment teams on forecasting, out-of-stock issues, and supply planning.
Support Walmart Omni item setup processes, including Item 360 and QMS submissions.
Assist Walmart.com NAM with:<ul><li>
Consumer and Home Tester Club reviews
Catalog management, content score reporting, and item audits
Contribute to showroom and planogram management:<ul><li>
Modular resets, sample prep and delivery, and line review support
Perform other tasks as needed to support business growth and operations.
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Requirements:
Knowledge of Walmart Retail Link tools, including: Report Builder, Item 360, Decision Support, OTIF platforms, eHalo, Prospec, and Luminate
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite: Excel (pivot tables, formulas, data analysis), PowerPoint (presentations), Word (documentation)
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Strong analytical and influencing skills.
High emotional and social intelligence.
Growth mindset with a passion for continuous learning.
Strong attention to detail and task follow-through.
Ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
Self-motivated with a proactive, positive attitude.
Adaptable to change with a can-do mentality.
Education and Experience:
College graduate or currently enrolled in the Certified Retail Analyst (CRA) program.
2 years in sales or customer support roles preferred.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Frequent use of hands and fingers for typing, data entry, and handling documents.
Occasional standing or walking during meetings, presentations, or office movement.
Visual acuity to read and analyze data on screens and printed reports.
Occasional lifting of items up to 15 pounds (e.g., laptops, files, or presentation materials).

Ability to travel occasionally for meetings, training, or retail store visits (if applicable)

Brief Job Description:
<div>

Performs advanced (senior-level) professional organizational and policy analysis work conducting organizational studies and evaluations, analyzing systems and procedures, conducting work simplification studies, and preparing operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
<div>

This position is responsible for coordinating Community-Based Care implementation and operations activities at the catchment/community level and serves as the area's liaison to the Single Source Continuum Contractor (SSCC) and works under the direction of the Director of Implementation in the Office of Community-Based Care Transition. The position interacts routinely with DFPS staff, the SSCC, other agencies in the community, community boards, judges, schools, and the public.
<div><b>
Essential Job Functions (EJF):
<div>
Coordinates, plans, and directs organizational studies and evaluations.
• Gathers stakeholder information for ongoing process evaluations and other statewide studies.
• Provides and coordinates relevant information as Subject Matter Experts to inform various studies and evaluations
• Conducts training gap analysis
Develops new or modifies existing operational program policies, procedures, goals, and objectives.
<ul>
• Oversees, monitors, analyzes and maintains Community-Based Care-related training process documents and resource guides
• Establishes and retains standard operating procedures and policies related to staff training and development

• Plans, organizes, and facilitates meetings and workgroups with internal and external stakeholders for assigned community areas, and future areas as requested, to develop solutions, change strategies, and training as needed for readiness/implementation of Community-Based Care and ongoing CBC operations

As a state agency, DFPS is required by Texas Administrative Code (TAC 206 and 213) to ensure all Electronic Information Resources (EIR) follow accessibility standards. The staff must be familiar with the WCAG 2.1 AA and Section 508 to create accessible content including but not limited to
column2: Microsoft Office documents, Adobe PDFs, webpages, software, training guides, video, and audio files.

column1: DFPS uses E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work. Employees must provide documentation to DFPS to show their identity and authorization to work in the US. Please review the following link for authorized documents: https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central/form-i-9-acceptable-documents .

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS/DFPS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS/DFPS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview.

Nearest Major Market: Austin

About WFS

Join our Worldwide Flight Services family and contribute to the timely delivery of cargo shipment, luggage, business to customer delivery, and on-time flights while operating safely and securely. We perform at the highest level for our customers every day, and strive to be an exceptional leader in our industry with our teams of cargo, passenger, ramp handling, and technical service experts in 164 airport locations, 18 countries, and on 5 continents. Are you ready to take off on your next career with us?
Job Summary
The Business Analyst &ndash
column2: Operational Excellence supports the three pillars of Operational Excellence (Amazon, Cargo, and Lean Six Sigma) by transforming operational data into insights that drive measurable business results. This role quantifies, validates, and tracks financial and operational benefits, ensuring consistent visibility into key initiatives. The analyst develops tools and dashboards that enhance leadership decision-making and acts as a bridge between operations, finance, and data teams to enable data-driven execution across the network.

column1: Responsibilities
Cross-Pillar Performance Tracking:
Partner with business units across Amazon, Cargo, and Lean Six Sigma pillars to track and sustain improvement initiatives.
Ensure standard benefit calculation methodologies and performance tracking frameworks are applied consistently across all pillars.
Identify and quantify efficiency opportunities through data analysis and collaboration with operational teams.
Financial and Metric Validation:
Develop and maintain benefit-tracking models and dashboards to monitor realized and projected savings.
Operational Excellence &amp
column2: Process Improvement:

column1: Support Lean Six Sigma and Continuous Improvement initiatives through data collection, benefit validation, and KPI tracking.
Collaborate with CI leaders and Green Belt project owners to define baselines, measure outcomes, and calculate ROI.
Provide analytical support for process mapping, root cause analysis, and performance benchmarking.
Executive Reporting and Insights
Prepare executive-level dashboards, scorecards, and presentations summarizing progress, financial impact, and risks.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for senior leadership.
• Support governance and reporting structures to drive accountability and informed decision-making.
Technology Collaboration and Data Integration
• Act as a liaison between Operational Excellence, IT, and Data teams to ensure alignment on data architecture, reporting, and analytics initiatives.
Understand and translate business requirements into technical solutions, supporting integration of data sources and automation of performance reports.

Leverage foundational technical skills such as SQL, familiarity with databases, and experience with at least one programming or scripting language (e.g., Python, R, or VBA) to analyze data more effectively.
Minimum Requirements
• Bachelor&rsquo
column2: s degree in business administration, Finance, Industrial Engineering, Operations Management, or a related field

column1: 4+ years of experience in business analysis, operations, or project management
Proven experience quantifying and validating operational or financial benefits
Proficiency in Excel (advanced modeling, pivot tables) and Power BI or Tableau
Working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies
Strong analytical, communication, and storytelling skills for executive audiences
Experience with SQL, databases, or scripting languages such as Python, R
Preferred Skills
• VBA preferred
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification preferred
Physical Requirements/Working Conditions
• Ability to work for extended periods in a seated position using a computer and other standard office equipment.
• Must be able to communicate effectively via video conferencing, email, and other digital platforms.
• Occasional lifting of items such as laptops or documents, typically not exceeding 20 pounds, may be required for home office setup or travel.
• Visual acuity required for reading technical documentation and monitoring system performance.

in-76f0db4d1ee98b76,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=76f0db4d1ee98b76,https://otod111.rec.pro.ukg.net/CRI1500CRPS/JobBoard/1f4f343e-1292-4315-943d-8a1d6d0c9a7f/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=5e377093-8834-4115-b4dc-3b4f08dd9419&postingId=9ce92773-f08d-4de5-be5a-66150e0e5784,HRIS Reporting Analyst,Critical Project Services Llc,"Dallas, TX, US",2025-11-12,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"

We are seeking an experienced HRIS Reporting Analyst to join our HRIS team. This role is responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing HR reports and dashboards within the UKG (formerly UltiPro) platform. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data structures, strong analytical skills, and advanced Excel expertise. You&rsquo
column2: ll play a key role in delivering critical insights to HR, Payroll, Finance, and Executive Leadership through complex and ad hoc reporting.

column1: Primary Responsibilities
• Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot complex reports and dashboards in UKG BI (Business Intelligence).
• Utilize joins, cross joins, and subqueries to create advanced reports across multiple data sources.
• Partner with HR, Payroll, Benefits, Talent Acquisition, and Finance teams to define reporting needs and deliver timely, accurate outputs.
• Design dynamic dashboards and visualizations to support decision-making and operational insights.
• Provide ad hoc reporting and data extracts for audits, compliance, and business requests.
• Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance in all reports and dashboards.
• Assist with testing and validation of new system features and data fields.
• Maintain documentation for report logic, fields, and version history.
• Support data-driven storytelling through trend analysis and insights.
• Create EEO1 reporting for compliance and other required company reporting.
Professional Qualifications
<ul>
• 5+ years of experience in an HRIS or HR Reporting Analyst role.
• Strong expertise in UKG BI (UltiPro/UKG Pro Business Intelligence) required.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, complex formulas, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, Power Query, etc.
• Proven experience writing complex SQL-style reports, including joins, cross joins, unions, platform configured fields and data aggregation.
• Hands-on experience with dashboards and visual reporting tools (within or outside UKG BI, including turnover).
• Burst reports and BI alerts experience required
• Familiarity with HRIS data such as payroll, benefits, job data, compensation, and org structures.
• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.
• Experience supporting system updates, implementations, or HRIS upgrades.
• Familiarity with HR compliance, auditing, and workforce analytics best practices.
• Bachelor's degree in HR, Business, IT, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

This is a full-time position with hours dictated by business needs. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Job Title: Business Analyst III
Location: Austin, TX
Duration: 8 Months
Interview Format: Microsoft Teams (Video)
Work Arrangement: 100% Onsite (No Remote Work)
Eligibility: Local candidates only &mdash
column2: must reside within a 50-mile radius of Austin, TX

column1: Position Overview

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst (BA) / Product Owner to support a large-scale Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) modernization project. The position involves close collaboration with technical teams, business users, and project stakeholders to analyze requirements, enhance functionality, and ensure the delivery of high-quality system improvements.
The selected candidate will work with multiple business units, technology vendors, and system integrators to analyze policies, processes, and business needs &mdash
column2: transforming them into detailed functional and technical requirements. This role requires strong analytical, communication, and Agile project management skills.

column1: Key Responsibilities
<ul>
• Analyze program policies, procedures, and processes to determine the impact on business systems and functional areas.
• Review system documentation, business requirements, design specifications, and test plans to ensure compliance with business and technical needs.
• Serve as a Product Owner for Agile teams, translating business needs into detailed user stories and acceptance criteria.
• Facilitate Agile ceremonies, collaborate with sprint teams, and maintain a prioritized backlog.
• Develop and execute test scenarios, test cases, and exit criteria aligned with user requirements.
• Conduct and participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and system validation efforts.
• Monitor project progress, report status, and communicate risks, issues, and decisions to management.
• Act as a liaison between internal business units, vendors, and technical teams.
• Identify project risks and develop mitigation strategies.
• Document business processes, decisions, and deliverables.
• Manage schedules and ensure timely delivery of project milestones.
• Lead meetings and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Minimum Qualifications
Candidates must have a strong record of experience that clearly demonstrates the following:
<ul>
• 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst and Agile Product Owner.
• 8 years of experience working within Agile software development environments.
• 8 years of experience performing complex business analysis and creating technical documentation.
• 8 years of experience reporting project status to management, including risks, issues, and decisions.
• 8 years of experience identifying project risks and implementing mitigation strategies.
• 8 years of experience with clear, effective written and oral communication, including documentation of requirements, deliverables, and test results.
• 8 years of experience gathering, validating, and documenting business requirements and translating them into technical solutions.
• 8 years of experience reviewing and approving complex user and system requirements developed by vendors.
• 8 years of experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
• 8 years of experience developing and coordinating test plans, strategies, and test scenarios.
• 8 years of experience executing detailed test cases in complex software environments.
• 8 years of experience using testing management software tools.
• 8 years of experience using project management tools such as Microsoft Project or equivalent.
• 8 years of experience prioritizing and approving user stories based on stakeholder feedback and expertise.
• 8 years of experience working with Medicaid systems and processes.
• 8 years of experience with claims processing systems.
Preferred Qualifications
<ul>
• 4 years of experience or knowledge of Texas Medicaid programs.
• 2 years of experience with the Provider Enrollment and Management Systems (PEMS) project or similar provider management platforms.
Key Skills
<ul>
• Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
• Requirements analysis and documentation
• Business process reengineering
• Data and system analysis
• UAT coordination and execution
• Risk and issue management
• Excellent stakeholder communication and presentation skills
For more details reach at resumes@navitassols.com

We offer the most competitive pay for every position. We understand this is a partnership. You will not be blindsided and your salary will be discussed upfront.

in-995fc7b2ffb93e84,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=995fc7b2ffb93e84,https://apply.workable.com/j/852D54A44E,Supply Chain Data Analyst,Unimacts Global,"Conroe, TX, US",2025-11-12,fulltime,direct_data,yearly,56000.0,60000.0,USD,False,,,,,"

Ready to be a part of something monumental?

Unimacts is redefining contract manufacturing and global supply chain management across the renewable and industrial sectors. With operations spanning the U.S., Mexico, Spain, India, and China, we deliver precision-engineered components and assemblies for some of the world&rsquo
column2: s most innovative solar, wind, and industrial OEMs. Backed by top-tier venture capital and powered by the innovation engine of Zetwerk Manufacturing USA, Unimacts is driving the next era of smart, sustainable manufacturing. It&rsquo
column3: s an extraordinary time to be part of our growth story.

column1: The Supply Chain Data Analyst supports the Operations and Commercial teams by providing data-driven insights to improve sourcing, logistics, and inventory planning performance across the Unimacts global supply chain. This role focuses on analyzing supplier data, purchase orders, inventory movements, and cost structures to identify trends, reduce inefficiencies, and improve decision-making across multiple business lines.

You will work closely with the Supply Chain Managers, Finance, and Engineering teams to ensure data accuracy across systems, support continuous improvement projects, and build reporting dashboards that enhance transparency and operational control.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
<li>
Collect, clean, and analyze supply chain data from ERP, purchasing, and logistics systems to identify cost, schedule, and performance trends.
• Develop and maintain Power BI or Excel dashboards tracking supplier on-time delivery, quality metrics, lead times, and inventory turns.
• Support demand and supply forecasting by integrating order, shipment, and production data into predictive models.
• Collaborate with procurement and operations to validate data for purchase orders, invoices, and freight charges.
• Prepare monthly and quarterly analytics reports for leadership, highlighting performance against KPIs and actionable insights for improvement.
• Monitor supplier and logistics performance metrics (OTD, PPV, lead time, MOQ, etc.) and assist in root cause analysis for deviations.
• Support cost modeling, landed cost analysis, and freight optimization initiatives.
• Contribute to ERP data accuracy through validation and periodic audits (item master, supplier data, pricing, lead times).
• Partner with global operations teams in India, China, and Mexico to standardize reporting and data collection templates.
<li>Assist with process automation projects&mdash
column2: such as transitioning manual Excel reports to Power BI or ERP-integrated dashboards.

column1: Why you'll love this job
Use your analytical talents and creativity to drive performance improvements at the largest airline in the world.
As an Airport Operations Analyst you will partner with senior leaders, front line staff, and other operational business units to identify root cause and provide a data driven solution.
This job is a member of the Airport Operations Performance Analytics Team within the Operations Planning and Performance (OP&amp
column2: P) organization.

column1: What you'll do

As noted above, this list is intended to reflect the current job but there may be additional essential functions (and certainly non-essential job functions) that are not referenced. Management will modify the job or require other tasks be performed whenever it is deemed appropriate to do so, observing, of course, any legal obligations including any collective bargaining obligations.

Perform complex quantitative analysis on airport performance subject areas such as turn performance, airport staffing, baggage handling, and more to identify insights, create reports, develop data driven tools, and drive process improvement.
Perform advanced business analysis using SQL and Python to develop prescriptive operational improvement plans.
Automate and improve current programs, processes, reports, and forecasts using SQL, Python, and Databricks
Understand the complexities of airport operations and interact with front-line team members to learn operational challenges and identify areas of opportunity.
Build data visualizations to track KPIs, identify root causes, and highlight opportunities.

Develop statistical predictive models on large-scale datasets using statistical modeling such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees and other machine learning, or data mining techniques.
Work collaboratively with various airports and internal teams to develop innovative and insightful solutions to improve airport performance.
Develop presentations and present findings and recommendations to key stakeholders and senior management.

<div><div><div><h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
General Overview
Functional Area: ENG - Engineering
Career Stream: FAC - Facilities/Real Estate Engineering
Role: Analyst
SAP Short Name: ANA
Job Title: Facilities Analyst
Job Code: ANA-ENG-FAC
Job Level: Band 07
Profile-Holding: N
Direct/Indirect Indicator: Indirect
Summary

Incumbents are fully qualified to execute job/role accountabilities working independently on most aspects of the job. Work is performed within established professional standards and practices. Tasks are moderately complex in nature where judgment is required to complete recurring assignments independently and to determine the best methods to follow to complete assignments. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results may have a negative impact on the divisions/departments operations, schedules, and/or performance goals. Works under general Supervision. Situations not covered by standard processes, procedures and methods are referred to manager or expert resource. May demonstrate work methods to new employees. Builds internal and external relationships, with emphasis on those that facilitate the achievement of job/role accountabilities, such as relationships with key suppliers, customers and internal service.
Detailed Description
Performs tasks such as, but not limited to, the following:

Facilities: Manages multiple office and production projects varying in complexity and dealing with internal customers to identify statement of requirements, budget, schedule. Delivering all aspects of the projects as negotiated and agreed to. Handling facilities requests based on geography, scope and/or discipline. Provides leadership and management of construction and renovation projects., Ensures good communications and acts as liaison between internal customers and service providers. Deals with projects that have a relatively high complexity level, scope and risk level. Uses good project management skills to maintain control of projects, contractors and employees. Prepares proposals for facilities related work and identifies opportunities for continuous improvement in space and services optimization. Responsible for the overall maintenance of plant equipment on a daily basis. Maintains all systems including monitoring and keeping appropriate logs and measurements as required by site or local/governmental regulations. Ensures compliance to ISO 14001 Environmental Management System Standards.

Industrial Hygienist: Plans and implements a site risk assessment and evaluation program and process. Recommends measures for control of hazardous conditions such as radiation, noise, and toxic materials. Conducts training and communication programs in areas such as hazard communication, personal protective equipment use, hazardous materials response, chemical safety, radiation safety, laser safety, and noise exposure. Investigates the adequacy of ventilation, exhaust equipment, lighting and other conditions which may affect employee health, comfort, or efficiency. Selects vendors to, or performs sampling of, dusts, gases, vapors or other potentially toxic materials. Prepares reports, including observations, analysis of contaminants, and recommendations for control and correction of hazards. Tracks and interprets regulations to ensure compliance. Identifies if and when additional processes and guidelines are needed and ensures implementation. Reviews and approves process changes and purchasing requests for new chemicals and capital equipment in order to reduce the use of hazardous substances and minimize liability. Works with Occupational Health Nurse and Consulting Physician to institute biological monitoring for potentially hazardous conditions and equipment. Ensures compliance to ISO 14001 Environmental Management System Standards.

Occupational Health Nurse: Manages health related programs including Worker's Compensation and disability case management, in conjunction with Human Resources and management. Ensures delivery of appropriate benefits, directs activities of third party vendors for compliance with company service agreements, ensures compliance with regulatory requirement
Knowledge/Skills/Competencies
• In-depth knowledge of facilities management and operations.
• Understanding of environmental, health and safety regulations, programs (local and government), including ISO 14001 requirements.
• Good organization and project management skills.
• Ability to evaluate, diagnose and troubleshoot problems.
• Ability to gather and analyze data and determine root cause of problems.
• Ability to effectively communicate with a variety of internal and external customers.
• Current CPR certification and Registered Nurse license required for OH Nurse position.
<li>Knowledge of Workers&rsquo
column2: Compensation laws.

Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.
The Business Automation Support (BAS) unit within the Medicaid and CHIP Services (MCS) Department oversees Texas Medicaid &amp
column2: Healthcare Partnership (TMHP) systems and related support activities. BAS provides oversight of LTC program systems, which supports LTC providers for services delivered to individuals
column3: modifications and updates to TMHP vendor systems
column4: and encounter data and MCO file support and coordination.

column1: A Business Analyst (BA) is needed to support the legislatively approved Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) projects. PEMS is a centralized electronic method for Medicaid and non-Medicaid program providers interested in enrolling to submit a single application, in a single location (a web portal), to be accepted and processed by a single entity based on their National Provider Identifier (NPI). HHSC would like to make significant changes to PEMS to improve the provider experience and system functionality.
The Worker will serve as a Business Analyst/Product Owner for the PEMS project and support activities as needed. The Worker will work directly with internal units (Provider Services)

column3: and business users to provide subject matter expertise, perform critical analysis, ensure requirements are gathered that meet the functional needs and assist in creating and maintaining a prioritized and healthy backlog as directed by the legislative mandate.

Job Description:
The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and responsive team player who can multi-task and has excellent analytic skills. Our work is highly collaborative and involves close coordination and excellent communication with our clients, market data vendors and key business and technology partners across Fidelity.

The Associate Investment Data Analyst will perform critical functions to support daily data management operations relating to third-party market reference data providers and ensure accurate, complete and timely delivery of data to downstream consumers. This includes managing daily data quality routines, performing detailed data analysis through querying to analyze and validate data, and troubleshoot production related issues and engage with our Technology and Business partners to resolve when needed. This role will also participate in operations projects/initiatives involving multiple business partners and will help to provide subject matter expertise. Quality, accuracy, and timeliness are critical to the success of this function.
The Experience and Skills You Bring
Bachelor's degree in Business/Finance/Data Analytics or related field
1-2 years&rsquo

Data analytics, data mining, reporting, operations research, and data manipulation experience preferred
Note: Fidelity is not providing immigration sponsorship for this position
The Team

The Global Data Services (GDS) team within Fidelity Fund and Investment Operations (FFIO) is a global, investment data management organization that specializes in the sourcing, analysis, integration, management and distribution of security, index, and portfolio data. GDS provides these data services for reference, evaluative, performance and analytical data in support of global investment decision making organizations. Data Management Operations (DMO), a division of GDS, specializes in managing, integrating, and validating vendor and Fidelity-defined data associated with investment entities (securities, issues, brokers, funds, portfolios, and index data).

SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.
BUSINESS OPERATIONS ANALYST (STARLINK)

One of the most ambitious missions that SpaceX has undertaken to date, Starlink is leveraging our experience in building rockets and spacecraft to deploy the world's most advanced broadband internet system and largest satellite constellation to provide fast, reliable internet to millions of users worldwide, connect humanity, and fund Mars colonization.

Starlink's Growth Business Operations team combines traditional planning and analysis with broader business decision-making and strategy, directly supporting SpaceX's leadership. Growth Business Operations is embedded in daily operations, supporting both near-term execution and long-term planning. Team members are expected to analyze data and provide recommendations and to lead cross-functional decision-making and implementation of the recommendations. in-d4378fc82fbf6f9a,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=d4378fc82fbf6f9a,http://www.indeed.com/job/senior-data-quality-analyst-d4378fc82fbf6f9a,Senior Data Quality Analyst,"WorldVision Technologies, Inc","Dallas, TX, US",2025-11-12,contract,direct_data,yearly,126880.0,126880.0,USD,False,,,,,"

Senior Data Quality Analyst

Duration: 12 months +

Job Summary

The Senior Data Quality Analyst will serve as the Data Steward for the Resilience Analytics Project, supporting the development of foundational data domains and advancing enterprise-wide data integrity initiatives. This role plays a key part in establishing a medallion data architecture across multiple domains where none currently exist, ensuring that critical data assets are accurate, consistent, and fit for analytical use. The analyst will define and enforce data quality standards, design quality-monitoring frameworks, and collaborate with data owners, engineers, and business partners to operationalize best practices in data governance.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Lead the creation and implementation of data quality rules and validation frameworks across new and existing data domains.
  • Partner with business stakeholders and data engineers to design medallion architecture layers that ensure data trustworthiness and lineage transparency.
  • Conduct proactive data profiling and root-cause analysis to identify quality issues, assess impacts, and drive corrective actions.
  • Define data quality metrics (DQIs, KPIs) and develop dashboards to monitor and report on data health across critical systems.
  • Serve as the Data Steward for the assigned domain&mdash
column2:
maintaining ownership of metadata, business definitions, and quality thresholds.
  • Collaborate with the Data Governance Office to align processes with enterprise data policies, classification standards, and compliance frameworks.
  • Support cross-functional teams in data remediation efforts and continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Document and communicate data quality strategies, providing guidance and training to other data practitioners.

    • Required Skills &
column3:
Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience building data domains from the ground up, including data modeling, rule definition, and implementation of data quality controls.
  • Proficiency with data quality and governance tools such as Informatica DQ, Collibra, Alation, Talend, or similar platforms.
  • Hands-on experience with SQL, Python, or Spark for data validation and cleansing.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and identify systemic issues.
  • Experience developing data quality dashboards and metrics using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Snowflake dashboards, or Dataiku).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, particularly in cross-functional and technical-business hybrid environments.
  • Working knowledge of data governance frameworks, metadata management, and data lifecycle management.
  • Bachelor&rsquo
column4: s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field

equivalent experience may be considered.

  • Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, or similar cloud data ecosystems.
  • Understanding of data stewardship roles within an enterprise governance model.
  • Exposure to regulatory or compliance-driven data environments (e.g., NERC, ISO, SOX, or utility sector data).
  • Knowledge of machine learning data quality monitoring and anomaly detection methods.

EHC is currently looking for a Senior Functional Analyst for a client in the south Houston, TX area.

Job Summary:

The Senior Functional Analyst will interpret and contextualize strategy for operational needs gathering specific artifacts such as business and value streams maps to help bridge the gap between strategy and execution. This will help streamline and rationalize the infrastructure enablement process. In addition to developing specific deliverables, views, and viewpoints, the business architect synthesizes and synergies the work of others and experience from disciplines such as strategy development, business analysis, process management, operations, and systems analysis. Lead the effort to attain lean enterprise-level performance within the client and family of companies. Encompassing the integration of each company into the standardization of the client's process.

Responsibilities:

Align best practices for a lean enterprise vision for the single company standard

  • Process control - Directed at monitoring, controlling, stabilizing, and pursuing ways to improve the process for value.
  • Capture the relationships among roles, capabilities and business units, the composition of those units into subunits, and the internal or external management of those groups

Fuel Loyalty Data Analyst
The Fuel Loyalty Data Analyst will support 7-Eleven&rsquo
column2: s fuel pricing department by driving measurement, analysis, and testing initiatives. This role requires a blend of business insight and data expertise to create reporting, analytics, and testing frameworks. You&rsquo
column3: ll uncover actionable insights to support the fuel pricing team, optimize loyalty strategies, and improve business processes.

column1:
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:

  • Analyze complex data sets to identify, interpret, and communicate trends, patterns, and key insights.
  • Deliver clear reports, KPIs, dashboards, and recommendations to support loyalty strategies and pricing decisions.
  • Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests, providing actionable recommendations.
  • Conduct cost&ndash
column2:
benefit analyses of promotions, programs, and marketing efforts.
  • Develop and maintain databases, data pipelines, and analytics systems to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and quality.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for process improvements, system enhancements, and data governance practices.
  • Create documentation to ensure analysis methods and processes are transparent, repeatable, and easy to replicate.
  • Maintain standards for delivery, quality, and visual presentation of delivered SQL, Tableau and Excel solutions.
  • Prioritize information needs of the fuel pricing team to align analytics with business objectives.
  • Acquire and manage data from primary and secondary sources. Filter and &ldquo
column3: clean&rdquo

Knowledge and Skills:

Required:

  • Strong background in data management, analysis, and statistical techniques.
  • Proficiency in data visualization (Tableau/Tableau Prep), SQL, and/or Python (Databricks experience a plus).
  • Advanced analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.

column2: benefit analysis, and calculate ROI.

column1:

  • Experience with statistical packages (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
  • Familiarity with clustering, time series analysis, proximity analysis, and sales forecasting.

in-c08ace7a8ef10108,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=c08ace7a8ef10108,https://theapplicantmanager.com/jobs?pos=aq1048&src=Indeed,Marketing Analyst,ARGO,"Richardson, TX, US",2025-11-11,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"

ARGO is a leading provider of software and analytics solutions for both the financial services and healthcare industries. ARGO transforms business processes for financial service providers and healthcare organizations using proven business models and software innovation informed by real customer challenges, breakthrough technology, and rich analytics.
JOB TITLE(S):
Marketing Analyst/Digital Marketing Analyst/Marketing and Web Analyst
JOB SUMMARY:
The Marketing Analyst job is customer-facing and focuses on expanding customer acquisition and engagement capabilities for ARGO&rsquo
column2: s Connects product suite for the Financial Services industry.

column1: The Marketing Analyst role encompasses ensuring ongoing product suite market competitiveness and solution delivery readiness to Argo&rsquo
column2: s Financial Services customers. The Connects solution extends customer experience and engagement throughout the customer's journey. It supports acquisition, fulfillment, service, retention, and risk management. It meets the needs of both individual and business customers in an Omni-channel world.

column1: The Marketing Analyst will be responsible for working with Argo&rsquo
column2: s client&rsquo
column3: s to optimize their usage of the Connects solution for customer engagement campaigns through all stages of the customer journey from a lead thru conversion using insightful analytics to help better understand the client&rsquo
column4: s end users and reporting back with easy to understand data visualization and clear solutions. Your role will continue post client implementation to ensure our clients are getting the full value of our solutions.

column1: EXPECTED WORK AND PERFORMANCE:
Job duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned as needed.
1. Marketing Plans:
a. Have an in-depth understanding and the application of customer journey stages, especially how our solution generates earlier engagement in the Awareness and Consideration phases of the journey.
b. Create best practice methods and specific customer engagement campaign models using scientifically proven engagement methods.
c. Plan, develop, and monitor digital (email and SMS) campaign performance and channel tracking.
d. Translate requirements into technical specifications for development, data, and reporting teams and, conversely, technical approaches into easily digestible insights.
2. Client (Customer) Engagement:
a. Define, design, and communicate storyline and demonstration on value proposition to customers.
b. Create best practice-based templates to facilitate rapid customer implementation.

c. Define and design campaigns for each stage of the customer journey, from prospect nurturing through awareness, influencing conversion, onboarding, soliciting feedback, customer management, retention, and relationship expansion,
which are automated, and staff led to optimize use of staff?
d. Recommend campaign optimizations to reduce customer friction and increase customer engagement.
e. Devise and evaluate methods for collecting data, such as surveys, questionnaires, focus groups, opinion polls, etc., interpret, organize, and present actionable findings to clients.
f. Serve as the voice of our customers, understanding their needs for topics including surveys and campaigns and communicate those to both Argo and Client teams.
3. Marketing Research:
a. Research and recommend marketing constructs that will benefit both Argo and client (Relevance by market segment, etc.)
b. Conduct competitive research, analyze benchmarking data, and provide value add recommendations.
c. Analyze current/ongoing targeting strategies to define and implement new opportunities for media optimization, including A/B testing of delivered content and success ratios.
d. Content types and uses for Awareness and Consideration &ndash
column2: effectiveness research &ndash
column3: video, text, pictures, infographics (what should we consider for product knowledge and education)

column1: e. Research, recommend, and obtain digital marketing certifications for our staff that increase our value proposition to customers as directed.
4. Marketing Automation:

a. Oversee the marketing automation strategy inclusive of customer journey framework, customer data platform (CDP), segmentation and customer preference management, content and creative, targeting and list management in collaboration with technical teams.

b. Define marketing process around single and multifunctional campaigns across multiple channels, Including A/B testing. campaigns for prospect nurturing and lead generation i.e. conversion to customer.
c. Create and document best practices for customer delivered content (Email, SMS) with a focus on creating compelling calls to action (CTA)
d.
e. Ensure marketing automation tools are intuitive and easy to use.
f. Research and document plans for integration to third-party advertising such as Google &ndash

b. Interpret performance results using data science models, draw conclusions about findings.
c. Measure, evaluate and report on the effectiveness and ROI of marketing channels, methods, strategies, and digital marketing campaigns.

d. Have knowledge of customer segments, collect, and analyze data regarding customer preferences, demographics, buying patterns, habits, and needs to better identify market potential and factors influencing product demand.

e. Study and understand the behavior and expectations of online users with ability to communicate out the customers experience and behaviors. Such as customer intent and effectiveness of the sales funnel.
f. Create and communicate informative reporting that highlights marketing KPI&rsquo
