At Houston Methodist, the Data Analyst position is responsible for the provision of analytical support of data generated by the department. This position will assist in creating, designing and implementing processes to ensure accurate data collection and input. The Data Analyst position will assist with maintenance of department database and on-going training of end users. This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing and reporting statistical information and patient outcomes to both external and internal customers which may include statistical power and sample size determination, inferential hypothesis testing, algorithm development and numerical methods, data mining and knowledge discovery in databases. Reporting duties for the Data Analyst position will involve the provision of monthly departmental reports and ensuring timely regulatory reporting completion. Additional responsibilities for this position include making recommendations for the implementation of technology and processes required to support the goals of the department with emphasis on regulatory compliance. The Data Analyst position will complete or assign other data requests.
<div><b>
PEOPLE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
<ul><li>
Communicates results of queries in database systems and upgrades regarding electronic protocol management system to coworkers, staff and management.
Completes and works directly with physicians, clinical staff and management on customized data queries and other requests for operational and research needs.
Fosters teamwork approach in all interactions with peers and team members. Anticipates needs of other team members
column2: proactively offering assistance. Provides contributions towards improvement of department scores for turnover/retention/employee engagement.

column1: SERVICE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
<ul><li>
Provides troubleshooting logic in relation to technical support.
Provides and/or supervises gathering, entering and auditing of data in database.
Assists with design and implementation of processes to ensure accurate data collection and input.

Performs statistical analysis interpretation by preparing reports (monthly, quarterly and/or as needed) on productivity, quality activities, trends and other clinical or business metrics relevant to the department.
QUALITY/SAFETY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
<ul><li>
Conducts routine data processing and implementation of quality control methods.
Develops standard operating procedures. Ensures compliance with all HIPAA/confidentiality regulations.
In conjunction with management, participates in performance improvement program for department.
FINANCE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
<ul><li>
Conducts, as appropriate, statistical power and sample size determination, inferential hypothesis testing, data mining and knowledge discovery in databases.
Responsible for all aspects of clinical data analyses for multiple studies.
Programs and develops algorithms for numerical methods and develops workflow and data pipelines as needed for project(s).
GROWTH/INNOVATION ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Collaborates with Technology regarding software system proposals, purchases, installations, upgrades, enhancements and modifications.

Identifies and assumes responsibility of own learning needs, consults with team experts and seeks continuing education opportunities to meet those needs. Completes and updates the individual development plan (IDP) on an on-going basis. Ensures own career discussions occur with appropriate management.
This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive
column2: the employee will also perform other reasonably related business/job duties as assigned. Houston Methodist reserves the right to revise job duties and responsibilities as the need arises.

Company Profile:

Houston Methodist Academic Institute oversees the Education Institute and Research Institute, including 772 faculty and 56,250 learners. The Academic Institute aligns our research and education initiatives in service to the clinical mission, providing solutions that answer the call for new technologies and skills our clinicians need for patient care. Houston Methodist Education Institute coordinates our primary academic affiliation with Weill Cornell Medicine and other joint programs, including the Engineering Medicine Program at Texas A&amp
column2: M University Intercollegiate School of Engineering Medicine. The Education Institute also oversees continuing medical education and graduate medical education, and supports more than 1,000 trainees in residence for medical, nursing, allied health and research education programs. Houston Methodist Research Institute supports research programs and infrastructure that enable faculty across the system to bring new scientific discoveries to patients as rapidly as possible through the full cycle of a cure from conceptual bench research, to prototyping and development, to clinical trials and FDA approval. The Research Institute supports more than 1,387 clinical research protocols and $70.3 million in extramurally funded translational research programs.

About loanDepot:

loanDepot (NYSE: LDI) is a digital commerce company committed to serving its customers throughout the home ownership journey. Since its launch in 2010, loanDepot has revolutionized the mortgage industry with a digital-first approach that makes it easier, faster, and less stressful to purchase or refinance a home. Today, loanDepot enables customers to achieve the American dream of homeownership through a broad suite of lending and real estate services that simplify one of life's most complex transactions. With headquarters in Southern California and offices nationwide, loanDepot is committed to serving the communities in which its team lives and works through a variety of local, regional, and national philanthropic efforts.

Base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay for this role is between $79,000 and $139,500. Your base pay will depend on multiple individualized factors, including your job-related knowledge/skills, qualifications, experience, and market location.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. in-a8de6d9e8a84bea9,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a8de6d9e8a84bea9,https://habitatenergy.bamboohr.com/careers/158?source=indeed&src=indeed&postedDate=2025-11-12,Reporting Analyst,Habitat Energy,"Austin, TX, US",2025-11-11,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"

Habitat Energy is a fast growing technology company focussed on the physical and financial optimisation of energy storage and renewable generation assets globally through complex models and trading. By maximising the returns from these assets we aim to drive investment in renewable energy and accelerate the transition to a low carbon world. Our rapidly growing team of 120+ people in Austin, TX, Oxford, UK, and Melbourne, Australia brings together exceptionally talented and passionate people in the domains of energy trading, data science, software engineering and renewable energy management.

We have a vacancy for a Reporting Analyst to join our U.S. team based in Austin, TX. This role will support the development of our middle and back office reporting functions and facilitate broader product and development and customer experience initiatives. The ideal candidate will bring experience with financial settlements, energy markets, and/or credit risk management along with their strong understanding of reporting processes and data analytics.
Your responsibilities will include:
<ul>
• Analyzing market data from multiple sources including power markets, operational telemetry, commodity markets, and energy trading platforms.
• Generating daily, weekly, and monthly reports via automation related to commercial activity, financial and managerial performance, asset reporting, and operational performance.
• Developing, maintaining, and enhancing automated reporting tools and dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
<li>Maintaining ongoing shadow settlement and P&amp
column2: L reports for current ERCOT operations, with additional RTO/ISO markets likely to be added in the future.

column1: • Monitoring and documenting market changes affecting settlement processes, and implementing necessary updates to relevant files.
• Supporting departmental initiatives by contributing to project requirements, tracking the status of ongoing projects, and performing UAT.
• Providing subject matter expertise in cross functional projects, performing ad hoc analysis and reporting.
Preferred skills and experience:
<ul>
• Energy experience: wholesale energy markets (ERCOT, PJM, MISO, etc.), or development/management of renewable generation projects or energy infrastructure.
• 3+ years using SQL and writing advanced queries, with an understanding of adjacent concepts such as data warehousing, ETL processes, data visualization, and the software development lifecycle.
• Bachelor's degree in analytics, finance, engineering, or other related fields. An advanced degree is a plus.
• Exceptional attention to detail, adaptability, and commitment to continuous improvement.
• Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders both inside and outside the organization.
&lsquo
column2: Nice to have&rsquo
column3: skills and experience:

column1: <ul>
• Professional experience in product/project management, or as a business analyst preferably in the front/middle office or supporting department (e.g. IT, accounting, operations, etc.).
• Experience using Python to develop automation processes or projects beyond basic standard reporting

Ultimately we are looking for someone who is a great fit for our company so we encourage you to apply even if you may not meet every requirement in this posting. We value diversity and our environment is supportive, challenging and focused on the consistent delivery of high quality, meaningful work.

The

Additional Information
When You Join Us, We'll Create Something EPIC Together

Epsilon is a global data, technology and services company that powers the marketing and advertising ecosystem. For decades, we've provided marketers from the world's leading brands the data, technology and services they need to engage consumers with 1 View, 1 Vision and 1 Voice. 1 View of their universe of potential buyers. 1 Vision for engaging each individual. And 1 Voice to harmonize engagement across paid, owned and earned channels.

Epsilon's comprehensive portfolio of capabilities across our suite of digital media, messaging and dedication solutions bridge the divide between marketing and advertising technology. We process 400+ billion consumer actioevery single dayday using sophisticated AI and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Epsilon is a global company with more than 9,000 employees around the world.

Epsilon has a core set of 5 values that define our culture and guide us to create value for our clients, our people and consumers. We are seeking candidates that align with our company values, demonstrate them and make them significant in their day-to-day work:
• Act with integrity. We are visible and have the courage to do the right thing.
Work together to win together. We believe collaboration is the motivator that unlocks our full potential.
Innovate with purpose. We shape the market with big ideas that drive big outcomes.
Respect all voices. We adopt differences and develop a culture of connection and belonging.
Empower with accountability. We trust each other to own and deliver on common goals.
Because You Matter

As a Senior HR Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in enabling business strategy through data driven insights. You will be responsible for research, analysis and presentation of key HR data to build understanding and insights that will enable informed decision-making across business functions and the global HR organization. You will identify program and process improvement opportunities for HR organizations, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Your subject matter expertise will be valuable in mentoring others within the HR organization on reporting and analytics for new and existing processes and programs.

Job Description: Job Summary

Southwest Airlines promises to provide Employees with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. The Senior Technical Operations (TO) Supply Chain Management (SCM) Data Analytics Analyst uses data and automation to help monitor the aircraft part inventory to make sure parts get to the right place at the right time. This role serves as an experienced internal consultant, responsible for the application of advanced data and computer science concepts to design, create, implement, and support integrated data solutions in self-service environments across the Technical Operations Supply Chain. The Senior TO SCM Data Analytics Analyst is a highly technical role that will support an integral part of the Company and help pilot the future of Southwest Airlines .
Additional details:

The culture of Southwest Airlines means we value the camaraderie, collaboration, and innovation that occurs when we come together and interact face-to-face at our vibrant Corporate Campus. Due to the nature of this role, you would be required to work from our Dallas, TX headquarters facility during business hours.

column2: BI Lead Analyst, VP is an intermediate level position responsible for driving efforts to prevent, monitor and respond to information/data breaches and cyber-attacks. column1: Responsibilities:
Report production:

Perform Quality Control checks on others' reports for both formatting and data issues. Be able to look at the source data and compare it with the pdf reports and spot discrepancies and other issues.

Be proficient in creating, modifying and generating reports

Required soft skills:
Crisp and clear written communication style Crisp and clear verbal communication skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills to senior management and business users
Customer-oriented, resourceful and enthusiastic.

Analytical problem solving skills

Industry Cybersecurity certifications are a plus.
Proficiency in Cognos report authoring is strongly preferred
Minimum 6 years working in IT / Information Security, preferably focused in Financial Services industry.
5+ years of Reporting area experience is a must.

Undergraduate degree required

At Memorial Hermann, we pursue a common goal of delivering high quality, efficient care while creating exceptional experiences for every member of our community. When we say every member of our community, that includes our employees. We know that when our employees feel cared for, heard and valued, they are inspired to create moments that exceed expectations, while prioritizing safety, compassion, personalization and efficiency. If you want to advance your career and contribute to our vision of creating healthier communities, now and for generations to come, we want you to be a part of our team.
Job Summary

The Digital Product Analyst is responsible for advancing the digital product and platform. The Analyst will collaborate heavily with the Product Manager and other Digital Product Analysts to understand, communicate, and implement digital consumer experiences in partnership with other departments, including Consumer Experience, Analytics, Marketing, Operations, IT, and various lines of business. The Analyst plays a key role in ensuring that the product is moving towards the overall vision and business objectives. The Digital Product Analyst reports directly to the Manager, while receiving leadership from Senior and Lead Product Analysts and Product Managers.<h2 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
Job Description
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education: Associates degree in Business, Healthcare Administration, Information Technology, or related field or two (2) years experience in lieu of a degree required

Job Classification
Job Type: Full-Time
Location: Houston or Austin, TX Office
FLSA Status: Exempt
Reports To: IT Manager
Job Summary

Data Integrations and Analysis Administrator with deep expertise in Power BI and data integration to design, develop, and maintain advanced data integration, reporting, and analytics solutions. This role plays a critical part in enabling data-driven decision-making across sales, supply chain, manufacturing, and finance. Leveraging tools such as Power BI, Microsoft SQL, Azure SQL, and API integrations, this role gathers design requirements and delivers automated reports, interactive dashboards, and data models that support strategic decision-making and compliance requirements.
Key Responsibilities

• Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and define reporting and dashboard requirements.
  • Partner with cross-functional IT teams to identify and integrate relevant data sources.
  • Develop automated reports (daily, weekly, monthly, annual) covering shipments, inventory, capacity, and compliance metrics.
  • Design and maintain real-time dashboards across all areas of business operations.
  • Integrate data from ERP, CRM, Microsoft Fabric, and Azure SQL into unified reporting models.
  • Build ETL workflows using Power BI Dataflows or Azure Data Factory.
  • Validate and reconcile data across platforms to ensure accuracy and consistency.
  • Provide custom reporting to support audits, incident responses, and exception management.
  • Analyze operational trends, anomalies, and root causes to support continuous improvement.
  • Optimize Power BI reports for performance, scalability, and user experience.
  • Manage data refresh schedules to ensure timely and reliable reporting.
  • Document reporting processes, data models, and integration of workflows to support audit readiness.
Qualifications

• Minimum of 3 years of experience in Power BI development and data analysis is required.
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience gathering requirements and designing dashboards for large-scale data projects is required.
  • Minimum 3 years creating data integrations between systems using API&rsquo
column2:
s and other tools.
  • Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Azure data services is required.
  • Strong understanding of data validation, reconciliation, and auditability is required.
  • Experience working in compliance-driven reporting environments is required.
  • Experience designing and building reports using Microsoft SSRS is preferred.
  • Experience in designing and building Crystal Reports is preferred.
  • A bachelor's degree in data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field is preferred.

About Citi:

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

column1: The Sr. Data &amp
column2: BI Lead Analyst, VP is an intermediate level position responsible for driving efforts to prevent, monitor and respond to information/data breaches and cyber-attacks. The overall objective of this role is to ensure the execution of Information Security directives and activities in alignment with Citi's data security policy.

column1: Responsibilities:
Report production:
Build and maintain highly detailed Business Intelligence reports in Cognos.
Produce monthly and periodic reports on designated Cybersecurity programs and on any assigned topics.
Work with the Cybersecurity program owners, gather Cybersecurity risk data from them, process the data as needed and produce IS reports and metrics.
Maintain the reports as needed. Analyst needs to have a keen eye for the numbers, be able to self-QC his /her own reports and data, be able to present the data in clear and concise way.
Report QC:
Perform Quality Control checks on others' reports for both formatting and data issues. Be able to look at the source data and compare it with the pdf reports and spot discrepancies and other issues.
Data Analysis:
Perform data analysis using, database tools (SQL), Excel, and Access.
Produce data sets which are the basis for the interactive analytics and update the data sets on a daily / weekly / monthly basis through automatic ETL jobs.
Create and maintain and improve the interactive analytics dashboards with appropriate data visualizations.
Design and document Business Requirements supporting automation of data feeds from upstream applications to the Cybersecurity reporting application.
Presentation skills:
The reports and data analysis artifacts must be presented to stakeholders in clear and easily understood format in Excel, PowerPoint, Word or PDF documents.
Work on Cybersecurity Metrics related projects
Work on assigned projects which generally involve the above areas.

Be proficient in crafting data sets needed to support interactive analytics
Understand the concepts of ETL (extraction, transform, and load)
Must be able to produce precise and well-crafted reports, familiarity with SQL, and databases
Understand general Information Security and understand Info Sec metrics in particular
Should be able to work independently and also in a team environment Be able to multi-task
Be able to pay attention to details
Be proficient in Microsoft Office products such as Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Word
Have a working understanding of databases, tables, and data design concepts
Have good presentation skills and produce precise and well-crafted reports
Be able to automate one's tasks for expediency
Required analytical skills:
Be able to work with structured and unstructured data and be able to answer questions about the data
Be able to analyze and present the data from different angles
Be able to put Excel and Access to use in the analysis be able to construct queries and manipulate the data when necessary
Must be able to perform simple macro writing and VBA programming
Design and build reports on Cognos platform Design and build interactive analytics dashboards on Cognos platform
Be proficient in creating, modifying and generating reports
Knowledge of other Business Intelligence (BI) platforms is a plus
Required soft skills:
Crisp and clear written communication style Crisp and clear verbal communication skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills to senior management and business users
Customer-oriented, resourceful and enthusiastic.
Focused on considering business enablement while reaching balanced information risk judgments.
Analytical problem solving skills
Be able to present materials in a format that facilitates senior management decision making.
Adept at multitasking and time management with the ability to remain calm under pressure and meet deadlines
Qualifications:
Industry Cybersecurity certifications are a plus.
Proficiency in Cognos report authoring is strongly preferred
Minimum 6 years working in IT / Information Security, preferably focused in Financial Services industry.
5+ years of Reporting area experience is a must.
Education:
Undergraduate degree required
column2: Masters in Data Sciences preferred.

column1: Inclusion and Belonging

At Commerce, we believe that celebrating the unique histories, perspectives and abilities of every employee makes a difference for our company, our customers and our community. We are an equal opportunity employer and the inclusive atmosphere we build together will make room for every person to contribute, grow and thrive.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you need an accommodation in order to interview at Commerce, please let us know during any of your interactions with our recruiting team.
Learn more about the Commerce team, culture and benefits at https://www.commerce.com/careers/
Protect Yourself Against Hiring Scams: Our Corporate Disclaimer
Commerce, along with many other employers, has become the subject of fraudulent job offers to hopeful prospective job seekers.
Be advised:
Commerce does not offer jobs to individuals who do not go through our formal hiring process.
Commerce will never:
• require payment of recruitment fees from candidates
• request personally identifiable information through unsanctioned websites or applications
• attempt to solicit money from you as part of the hiring process or as part of an employment offer
• solicit money to complete visa requirements as part of a job offer.

If you receive unsolicited offers of employment from Commerce, we urge you to be extremely cautious and avoid engaging or responding.

At Commerce, our mission is to empower businesses to innovate, grow, and thrive with our open, AI-driven commerce ecosystem. As the parent company of BigCommerce , Feedonomics , and Makeswift , we connect the tools and systems that power growth, enabling businesses to unlock the full potential of their data, deliver seamless and personalized experiences across every channel, and adapt swiftly to an ever-changing market. Simply said, we help businesses confidently solve complex commerce challenges so they can build smarter, adapt faster, and grow on their own terms. If you want to be part of a team of bold builders, sharp thinkers, and technical trailblazers, working together to shape the future of commerce, this is the place for you.

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our AI Operations team and help define, manage, and improve the workflows that power automation and AI initiatives across the company. This role bridges business and technical teams&mdash

in-3ae6a2510b74a61c,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=3ae6a2510b74a61c,https://hcas.fa.us1.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1001/requisitions/preview/4237,OBIEE Business Analyst,Overhead Door Corporation,"Lewisville, TX, US",2025-11-10,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"

This position is responsible for gathering and analyzing business reporting requirements and developing them into effective BI solutions. The ideal candidate will possess strong domain expertise in Manufacturing and Supply Chain. The role requires close collaboration with business users to define KPIs, metrics, and reporting needs, as well as hands-on development of BI reports and dashboards using Oracle BI tools such as OAS, OBIEE.
Collaborate with business stakeholders across different business functions such as manufacturing and supply chain to collect and document reporting and analytics requirements.
Develop BI reports and dashboards using Oracle BI tools (OAS, OBIEE, BI Publisher, BIAPPS etc.) based on defined requirements.
Act as a liaison between business users and technical teams to develop dashboards, data visualizations, analytics, and other BI-related solutions.
Work on customer support tickets and requests. Provide reporting support, assist project, development, security, and operations teams as required. identify opportunities for enhancement based on evolving business needs.
Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) and validate BI solutions against business requirements.
Maintain clear documentation of requirements, design specifications, and reporting logic for future reference and audit purposes.
Skills/Experience Requirements

5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst in IT or BI environments.
3+ years of experience in Manufacturing and Supply Chain domains.
Experience gathering and documenting reporting requirements and converting them into BI solutions.
Experience with Oracle BI tools (OAS, OBIEE, BI Publisher, ODI, BIAPPS) including report and dashboard development.
Exposure to Oracle eBusiness Suite (EBS) modules such as Inventory, Purchasing, and Order Management is a plus.
Proficient in writing SQL queries

column1: Minimum qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
• 5 years of experience in data analysis, including identifying trends, generating summary statistics, and drawing insights from quantitative and qualitative data.
• 5 years of experience managing projects and defining project scope, goals, and deliverables.
• 5 years of experience with Python, R or SQL.
• 3 years of experience in the application of ML/AI, could include GenAI solutions.
• Experience with fraud, abuse detection or risk management.
<h3 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
Preferred qualifications:
• Experience in digital advertising industry in a technical role.
• Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in a fluid environment.
• Excellent communication skills to convey technical concepts with cross-regional and cross-functional stakeholders at all levels.
About the job

Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust-and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us show that quality on the Internet trumps all.

As a Trust and Safety Associate you defend the integrity of Google, its users, and partners worldwide by defining and communicating product policies, fighting spam, fraud, and abuse across Google products. You are proactive, motivated, organized, responsible, innovative-and able to work well in a fast-paced, global, cross-functional, and team-oriented environment while demonstrating technical know-how, effective communication and getting things done.

The Trust and Safety Ad Traffic Quality team is to make the ads ecosystem universally trusted and defended against invalid Traffic. We analyze events and create scalable methods to stop motivated fraudsters from causing harm. When we get this right, we help users, advertisers, publishers, and Google gain information and monetize the internet safely and usefully.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $147,000-$216,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.
Responsibilities
• Apply advanced statistical methods to complex data sets to analyze the impact of abuse on the Mobile ads ecosystem.
• Perform fraud and spam investigations using various data sources, identify product vulnerabilities and drive anti-abuse experiments to prevent abuse.

• Work with engineers and stakeholders to improve workflows via process improvements, automation and anti-abuse system creation. Work directly with Product, Engineering, and Trust and Safety teams to prevent abuse by changing policies and closing product loopholes.

• Lead and conduct complex fraud investigations using data and identify gaps in current defenses, explore/experiment with new signals and develop solutions for scalable enforcement on non-compliant publisher inventory with a focus on Android.
• Be able to review or be exposed to sensitive content.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Discover your future at Citi
Working at Citi is far more than just a job. A career with us means joining a team of more than 230,000 dedicated people from around the globe. At Citi, you&rsquo

column1: Job Overview
About Citi:

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients&rsquo
column2: best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations &amp
column3: Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do from keeping the bank safe, managing global resources, and providing the technical tools our workers need to be successful to designing our digital architecture and ensuring our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. We reimagine client and partner experiences to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and efficient services.

column1: Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We&rsquo

column1: The Sr. Data &amp
column2: BI Lead Analyst, VP is an intermediate level position responsible for driving efforts to prevent, monitor and respond to information/data breaches and cyber-attacks. The overall objective of this role is to ensure the execution of Information Security directives and activities in alignment with Citi's data security policy.

column1: Responsibilities:
Report production:
Build and maintain highly detailed Business Intelligence reports in Cognos.
Produce monthly and periodic reports on designated Cybersecurity programs and on any assigned topics.
Work with the Cybersecurity program owners, gather Cybersecurity risk data from them, process the data as needed and produce IS reports and metrics.
Maintain the reports as needed. Analyst needs to have a keen eye for the numbers, be able to self-QC his /her own reports and data, be able to present the data in clear and concise way.
Report QC:
Perform Quality Control checks on others' reports for both formatting and data issues. Be able to look at the source data and compare it with the pdf reports and spot discrepancies and other issues.
Data Analysis:
Perform data analysis using, database tools (SQL), Excel, and Access.
Produce data sets which are the basis for the interactive analytics and update the data sets on a daily / weekly / monthly basis through automatic ETL jobs.
Create and maintain and improve the interactive analytics dashboards with appropriate data visualizations.
Design and document Business Requirements supporting automation of data feeds from upstream applications to the Cybersecurity reporting application.
Presentation skills:
The reports and data analysis artifacts must be presented to stakeholders in clear and easily understood format in Excel, PowerPoint, Word or PDF documents.
Work on Cybersecurity Metrics related projects
Work on assigned projects which generally involve the above areas.
Required technical skills:
Be proficient in crafting data sets needed to support interactive analytics
Understand the concepts of ETL (extraction, transform, and load)
Must be able to produce precise and well-crafted reports, familiarity with SQL, and databases
Understand general Information Security and understand Info Sec metrics in particular
Should be able to work independently and also in a team environment Be able to multi-task
Be able to pay attention to details
Be proficient in Microsoft Office products such as Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Word
Have a working understanding of databases, tables, and data design concepts
Have good presentation skills and produce precise and well-crafted reports
Be able to automate one's tasks for expediency
Required analytical skills:
Be able to work with structured and unstructured data and be able to answer questions about the data
Be able to analyze and present the data from different angles
Be able to put Excel and Access to use in the analysis be able to construct queries and manipulate the data when necessary
Must be able to perform simple macro writing and VBA programming
Design and build reports on Cognos platform Design and build interactive analytics dashboards on Cognos platform
Be proficient in creating, modifying and generating reports
Knowledge of other Business Intelligence (BI) platforms is a plus
Required soft skills:
Crisp and clear written communication style Crisp and clear verbal communication skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills to senior management and business users
Customer-oriented, resourceful and enthusiastic.
Focused on considering business enablement while reaching balanced information risk judgments.
Analytical problem solving skills
Be able to present materials in a format that facilitates senior management decision making.
Adept at multitasking and time management with the ability to remain calm under pressure and meet deadlines
Qualifications:
Industry Cybersecurity certifications are a plus.
Proficiency in Cognos report authoring is strongly preferred
Minimum 6 years working in IT / Information Security, preferably focused in Financial Services industry.
5+ years of Reporting area experience is a must.
Education:
Undergraduate degree required
column2: Masters in Data Sciences preferred.

Job Details:
General Notes
UT Austin provides an outstanding benefits package including but not limited to:
Competitive health benefits (Employee premiums covered at 100%, family premiums at 50%)
Vision, Dental, Life, and Disability insurance options
Generous paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays
Teachers Retirement System of Texas (a defined benefit retirement plan)
Additional Voluntary Retirement Programs: Tax Sheltered Annuity 403(b) and a Deferred Compensation program 457(b)
Flexible spending account options for medical and childcare expenses
Robust free training access through LinkedIn Learning plus professional
Tuition assistance
Expansive employee discount program including athletic tickets
Free access to UT Austin's libraries and museums
Free rides on all UT Shuttle and Capital metro buses with staff ID card

For more details, please see: https://hr.utexas.edu/prospective/benefits and
https://hr.utexas.edu/current/services/my-total-rewards
Purpose

The Institutional Research Analyst will work closely with IRRIS staff to manage and analyze data supporting institutional decision-making, data requests, and federal and state reporting. This role provides an excellent opportunity to work with large datasets, develop coding skills and contribute to institutional reporting. Please be advised, this is a 2-year position, with the possibility of renewal.
Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities
Research &amp
column2: Data Analysis

column1: Collect, merge, document, and otherwise prepare data from multiple sources to generate datasets using SPSS or similar tools.
Analyze data and produce descriptive statistics using SPSS, Excel or other statistical software.
Summarize trends in data for both external and internal stakeholders through reports, Tableau dashboards, and infographics.
Produce and maintain comprehensive documentation for institutional data such as state and federal reports, dashboards, datasets, statistical analyses and other outputs.
Gain in-depth knowledge of student and faculty data and serve as a data steward for the university.
Communication &amp
column2: Collaboration

column1: Clearly communicate data and information to campus stakeholders.
Interact with subject matter experts, data analysts, and IT programmers to understand data structure, assumptions, methodology, business rules, and limitations.
Serve as a liaison with units across the university to assess data and reporting needs.
Clearly communicate university business processes to facilitate use of institutional data and reports.
Follow and develop departmental protocols to support team members and contribute to the overall success of projects.
Exhibit patience, flexibility, positivity, attentiveness and a willingness to learn in all professional interactions.
Additional Duties
Perform other related duties as required.
Required Qualifications
Master's in social sciences, information sciences, statistics, or a related field (or equivalent
Experience with SPSS or similar statistical software packages (R or SAS) to organize and analyze large datasets.
Experience producing and maintaining detailed documentation of all work.
Demonstrated ability to think critically when working with data to identify errors, develop creative solutions
Proven ability to complete complex projects with minimal supervision.
Excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate in a team environment and effectively give and receive feedback.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in a higher education environment.
Advanced proficiency in SPSS, Tableau, or similar tools.
Familiarity with Drupal or similar website editing platforms.
Salary Range
$62,000 + depending on qualifications
Working Conditions
May work around standard office conditions.
Repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation.
Applicants must be legally authorized to work for any employer in the United States. This position is not eligible for sponsorship of work visas.
Hybrid - remote and on-campus work
Standard office conditions with repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation
Required Materials
Letter of interest
Resume/CV
3 work references with their contact information
column2: at least one reference should be from a supervisor

The University of Texas at Austin will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor&rsquo
column2: s legal duty to furnish information.

Title: Data Analyst IV

Job Summary:

Client is seeking an experienced Data Analyst IV to drive data-driven insights and optimize performance across its gaming ecosystem. The ideal candidate will bring a strong foundation in data analytics, business intelligence, and live game economy management. This role requires deep analytical thinking, strong communication skills, and the ability to partner cross-functionally with product, design, and publishing teams.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze complex datasets to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights across gaming products.
Partner with product managers and designers to evaluate in-game economy performance, player engagement, and monetization strategies.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and data pipelines using SQL, Python, or R.
Translate data insights into clear recommendations that inform live operations and publishing decisions.
Conduct A/B testing and performance analysis for new game features or economy adjustments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data integrity, consistency, and scalable reporting frameworks.
Support live ops initiatives through detailed KPI tracking and performance optimization.
Required Qualifications:
7+ years of professional experience in data analytics or business intelligence, preferably within a technology or gaming environment.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Excel for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Proven ability to interpret complex datasets and communicate insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a remote, fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Hands-on experience with live ops economies, digital economy modeling, and in-game monetization analysis.
Background in game publishing or analytics for high-profile gaming titles.
Experience building and balancing digital economies, including virtual currencies, player rewards, and progression systems.
Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.

Job Description:

At Ascentium Capital, the Syndications Credit Analyst is responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating credit in addition to gathering, inputting, and examining customer financial data with the aim of securing financing through outside lending partners. This position also prepares loan origination packages, submits to lenders and manages the decision, documentation and funding processes.

Ascentium Capital, a division of Regions Bank, provides convenient access to financing for business equipment and technology and serves small organizations to Fortune 500 companies with programs that benefit manufacturers, distributors and direct to businesses nationwide. Our finance specialization covers several segments, including technology, healthcare, hospitality, franchise, commercial vehicles, and other markets. We strive to be the premier provider of customized finance programs that add value to our customers' businesses.
Primary Responsibilities
Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates credit
Gathers, inputs, and analyzes customer financial data
Pre-screens applicants to determine credit worthiness
Works with syndicate partners to attain credit approval
Prepares lease/loan origination packages for internal/external underwriter reviews
Generates lease/loan documents in an accurate and timely manner to maintain the established business process
Manages internal and external sales transactions through the funding process

Fosters an open dialogue and strong working relationships with the Sales Representatives, Intermediary Sources, Potential Customers, Vendor Service Representative Department, Customer Service, Asset Management Group and other groups to ensure internal and external customer satisfaction
Partakes in the assessment of lease/loan product goals/objectives to optimize utilization of human and financial resources to achieve corporate financial goals
Works closely with the senior management on all business opportunities and issues related to the lease and loan product
Provides input, feedback, and recommendations to senior management for enhancement of the lease and loan product
Participates in meetings with other units/departments to provide input and improve the process
This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.
This position is incentive eligible.

Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent in related field
One (1) year of related experience
Preferences
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting or Finance, or related field
Business to business lending or related industry experience
Skills and Competencies

Ability to learn additional systems as needed
Ability to research, analyze data, and derive facts
Ability to work in a team environment when applicable
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Strong attention to detail and proof-reading skills
Strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
Strong work ethic and self-motivation
This position may be filled at a higher level depending on the candidateâ€™s qualifications and relevant experience.

Responsibilities
Serve as a key resource for an assigned customer area to understand and explain business and technical issues and to provide viable technology solutions.

Work with customers to clarify and plan for their current and future technology needs. Determine and map existing business processes/functions and recommend changes required to fit a tightly integrated system.
Design and implement projects requiring systems integration, small teams and multiple technical platforms.
Conduct Return on Investment (ROI) and other financial analysis to support project funding/prioritization.
Collaborate on driving improvement activities to achieve department and organizational goals.
Assume a proactive role in driving improvement activities to achieve department and organizational goals to deliver value.
Coordinate with functional team to assure consistency and optimization of overall work product.
Maintain current knowledge of industry and business process trends and is able to apply that knowledge to existing business processes.
Requirements
Education:
High School diploma equivalency with 2 years of cumulative experience OR Associate's degree/Bachelor's degree OR 4 years of applicable cumulative job specific experience required.
Additional Preferences
• Preferred experience: 3-5 years
Querying SQL databases - drafting, optimizing performance and troubleshooting.
Tableau - building and enhancing dashboards.
Prior experience working with coded healthcare data.
Prior experience working with Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services inpatient and outpatient quality reporting programs.
Why Join Our Team

Ascension Seton, based in Austin, Texas, has provided thousands of associates and caregivers a rewarding career in healthcare since 1902. Ascension Seton operates more than 100 clinical locations in Central Texas and four teaching hospitals, including Dell Seton Medical Center at The University of Texas and Dell Children's Medical Center. Join us and create a career path you will love.

Ascension is a leading non-profit, faith-based national health system made up of over 134,000 associates and 2,600 sites of care, including more than 140 hospitals and 40 senior living communities in 19 states.

Our Mission, Vision and Values encompass everything we do at Ascension. Every associate is empowered to give back, volunteer and make a positive impact in their community. Ascension careers are more than jobs

Create new database objects.

Identify when changes need to be made to standard business processes based on changing conditions with business partners or other market forces.

Experience with the 340B program a plus.

Overview

The Senior Management Analyst (SMA) will support the Solid Waste dept in collecting, analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends, patterns and insights that drive informed decision-making for business/process improvements. This position will be responsible for preparing, scrubbing, processing and analyzing data and various datasets, collecting data and translating data into qualitative narrative (dashboards, reports), and monitoring progress of projects on a monthly basis.
Responsibilities
• Scrub, analyze and interpret data from various datasets
• Navigate and utilize various databases to efficiently and accurately identify and extract data
• Define and identify deficiencies in the data
• Monitor progress and identify risks/opportunities
• Ensure accurate data is captured for reporting
• Develop data repeating structure for department leads
• Define/develop strategies for preventing errors from entering the data/datasets
• Distill and translate a large volume of quantitative data into qualitative narrative using a wide variety of productivity tools (software programs, apps, etc)
• Prepare new and/or innovative reports and reporting methods to relay findings/trends/variances/conclusions from produced analyses
• Communication will be in various forms, including but not limited to dashboards, reports, presentations, one-pagers, abstracts, web pages, emails, policy briefs, SOP's and summaries
• Create clear visual representations of data findings through, charts, graphs, dashboards
• Work with department leadership to develop relevant KPI's by working with cross functional teams to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights
• Communicate findings with stakeholders in clear and actionable way
• May be asked to perform additional duties as assigned
Position Type and Typical Hours of Work

Build your career at Planetâ€”recognized as a Top Mortgage Employer by National Mortgage Professional.
Job Summary

The Financial Analyst is responsible for general accounting functions including preparation, analysis, reporting and verification of accounting records and processes, account and bank reconciliation, and participation in the monthly and annual closing.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Manages journal entry postings, reconciliations as well as monthly close related accounting activities. Reviews for accuracy and corrects posting entries.
• Analyzes data and prepares and distributes monthly internal financial reports to Originations channel sales managers
• Prepares managerial and key performance indicator reports for Originations channel sales managers.
• Assists in assuring internal control procedures are followed. Creates and maintains documentation of processes, reports, applications, and procedures as per department policy.
• Supports special projects and performs duties as assigned.
Position Requirements
Education
• Bachelors degree in accounting or finance required.
• CPA preferred.
Experience
• Minimum of two (2) years accounting experience required.
• Mortgage accounting knowledge preferred.
Functional/Technical Skills
• Ability to work independently and communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
• Strong attention to detail, with a focus on identifying outliers, researching them, and obtaining resolution
• Ability to multi-task and prioritize
• Solid working knowledge of MS Office with a strong level of proficiency in Excel
Environmental / Physical Demands

Work is typically performed in a standard office environment. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sustain predictable work attendance, communicate with others, frequently required to stand, walk, sit, and use arms, hands and fingers to reach, handle or touch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus.
Pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of an employee. The Company reserves the right to amend or modify this document at any time and without notice.
Benefits

Our benefits package includes 3 comprehensive Cigna or Kaiser medical plans, dental, and vision insurance. We provide short term and long-term disability insurance, basic life insurance, 401(k), and 10 employer paid holidays. In addition, we offer supplemental benefits to include life insurance, critical illness and accident plans.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The Business Intelligence Analyst develops and maintains reporting and analytics solutions that enable data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role creates dashboards, reports, and visualizations using the Microsoft ecosystem (Power BI, Fabric) while working with data that has been prepared by the Data Engineering team. The position requires strong technical skills, the ability to work independently on complex projects, and a commitment to maintaining comprehensive documentation of all solutions.
KNOWLEDGE SKILLS REQURED
Integrity
Adhere to <b>Fracht&rsquo
column2: s Core Values and Vision. Ability to operate in an open and honest manner and achieve a trusting and reliable relationship with team members, customers, and vendors. Ability to accept mistakes and learn from them without apportioning blame.

column1: Flexibility
Learn and keep up to date with new developments, procedures, and regulations. Work efficiently in an environment with multiple shifting priorities.
Communication
Effectively listen and communicate clearly with team members, customers, and vendors. Ability to interpret and disseminate information promptly.
Problem Solving Measure effectiveness in understanding problems and making timely practical decisions. Ability to work well in groups and/or individually to develop alternative solutions.
Accountability
Justify responsible actions and decisions to management. Be a reliable team player who can make accurate decisions with sense of urgency.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Reporting &amp
column2: Visualization Development

column1: Designs, develops, and maintains reports, dashboards, and visualizations in Power BI and Microsoft Fabric
Creates and optimizes semantic models (formerly known as datasets) in Power BI to support self-service analytics
Builds sophisticated interactive dashboards that meet complex business requirements and follow UX best practices
Implements and manages Row Level Security (RLS) and user access controls across multiple organizational levels
Optimizes report performance, troubleshoots issues, and ensures scalability for global user base
Maintains and enhances existing dashboards based on evolving business needs
Provides technical guidance on Power BI best practices to team members and stakeholders
Data Analysis &amp
column2: Quality Assurance

column1: Develops complex DAX measures and calculated columns to support advanced business metrics and KPIs
Writes optimized SQL queries to extract and analyze data from the data warehouse
Validates data accuracy in reports by performing comprehensive data reconciliation and quality checks
Identifies and reports data discrepancies or anomalies to the Data Engineering team with detailed analysis
Defines data requirements and business logic for new reporting initiatives
Tests reports thoroughly before deployment to ensure accuracy, performance, and functionality across various scenarios
Documentation &amp
column2: Knowledge Management

column1: Creates and maintains comprehensive technical documentation for all developed reports, dashboards, and semantic models
Documents data sources, relationships, DAX measures, calculations, business logic, and data lineage for each solution
Develops detailed user guides, training materials, and quick reference documentation for end users
Maintains a centralized repository of reusable DAX measures, design patterns, and solutions with descriptions and usage examples
Documents troubleshooting procedures, resolution steps, and known issues
Updates documentation promptly when changes are made to existing reports or data models
Contributes to and helps maintain team knowledge base, standards, and best practices documentation
Ensures all documentation is clear, accurate, and accessible to both technical and non-technical audiences
Establishes documentation standards and templates for consistency across the team
Collaboration &amp
column2: Stakeholder Management

column1: Works directly with business stakeholders across global offices to gather requirements and understand analytical needs
Translates complex business requirements into functional technical specifications and dashboard designs
Conducts user training sessions and creates comprehensive documentation for deployed solutions
Provides expert-level support to report users and troubleshoots complex issues
Responds to emails and Teams messages within same business day (within 8 hours during working hours)
Maintains consistent follow-up on assigned tasks and proactively communicates status updates, risks, and blockers
Participates in and may lead team meetings, contributing ideas for process improvements
Manages multiple stakeholder relationships and competing priorities effectively
Technical Leadership &amp
column2: Continuous Improvement

column1: Stays current with Microsoft Fabric, Power BI features, and industry trends through continuous learning
Evaluates and recommends new tools, features, and approaches to improve BI capabilities
Identifies opportunities for automation, standardization, and efficiency improvements
Develops reusable components, templates, and frameworks to accelerate delivery
Participates in peer reviews and provides constructive feedback on others' work
Contributes to the development and enforcement of BI standards and governance policies
May mentor junior team members on technical skills and best practices
Performs other related duties as assigned
EDUCATION AND/OR WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Education
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, or related field
Master's degree or relevant advanced certifications preferred
Work Related
3-5 years of related experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or related field
Proven experience developing complex Power BI solutions in enterprise environments
Strong background in data analysis and translating business requirements into technical solutions
Experience working with cloud-based data platforms (Azure, Fabric) and on-premises systems
Demonstrated experience creating and maintaining technical documentation
Experience supporting global or multi-site organizations preferred
Experience with logistics, supply chain, or freight forwarding systems (such as CargoWise) is a plus
Technical Skills:
Advanced proficiency in Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and Microsoft Fabric
Expert-level SQL skills for complex queries, optimization, and data analysis
Advanced knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) including complex measures, time intelligence, and optimization techniques
Strong understanding of data modeling concepts, star schema design, and dimensional modeling
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel including Power Query and advanced analytics functions
Deep familiarity with Microsoft Fabric components (Workspace, Lakehouse, Semantic Models, Data Warehouse)
Solid understanding of data warehouse concepts (fact tables, dimension tables, medallion architecture)
Experience with version control and deployment practices for BI solutions
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues
Ability to learn new technical tools and platforms quickly
Excellent technical writing skills for creating clear, comprehensive documentation
Soft Skills:
Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present to various audiences
Proven ability to translate complex technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders
Self-motivated with strong ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines
Collaborative team player with positive attitude and willingness to share knowledge
Strong customer service orientation with focus on user satisfaction
Organized approach to managing projects, documentation, and knowledge sharing
Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
<ul><li>

Ability to perform the essential job functions consistently, safely, and successfully in accordance with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance in accordance with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards.
Must be able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.
Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to talk, listen and speak clearly on telephone.

column1: Job Description
EMPLOYER: Tokyo Electron U.S. Holdings, Inc.
Job Title: HR Technology Operations Analyst
Job Location: 401 S 1st Street, Suite 900, Austin, TX 78704
Duties:

Responsibilities include: Design an analytical approach and deliver research and findings using data, visualizations, and effective storytelling techniques. Translate findings into succinct, actionable business insights, often in coordination with partners to help you tell a holistic story. Apply a breadth of tools and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact people-related business questions. Solve sometimes ambiguous business problems by formulating and facilitating solutions that realize the needs and provide for the requirements arising in the organization. Exhibit effective execution by effectively contracting and communicating with customers, partners, and co-workers to define and provide deliverables, timelines, and responsibilities, all the while balancing and prioritizing across multiple and sometimes shifting priorities. Supports and/or consults with other teams on the build and execution of formal experiments or develops prototypes/proofs of concepts, to evaluate the impact of new or changed features or processes. Evaluates data for applicability to answering relevant and impactful business questions, determines methods for integrating data across sources, and addresses data integrity and/or quality issues independently and/or in partnership with other teams. Contributes to the development and/or recommendation of initial/prototype data models and/or tools for consumption by others and escalates complex issues with those models and/or tools to appropriate Engineering or Data-Science teams. Determines appropriate analytical and inferential techniques to address business questions, executes analyses and interprets results with actionable recommendations, and partners to build on others' analyses and frameworks. Develops depth of understanding of the business, its data landscape, and the lineage of those data across multiple areas. Considers relevant data sources and external trends, anticipates data requirements, and probes for insight to understand business- or data-related topics beyond stated concerns. Recommends efficiency improvements for core work related to analytics and reporting that are reusable, self-service, and directed to meaningful interpretation of data and driving business decisions.

Brief Job Description:

Works under the general direction of the DSS Data Team Director with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Works to establish the team's goals and objectives in conjunction with developing guidelines, procedures and standards to ensure an effective, efficient and accountable system for the Data Services team. Position requires familiarity with Behavioral Health Services data systems, structure and function. Responsible for inquiries from external and internal stakeholders and must use judgment in the level and degree of information disseminated, while maintaining the confidentiality of individual providers or other units. Assesses and analyzes reporting needs to ensure reports material and information are appropriate for targeted customers. Performs highly advanced professional, administrative, and oversight of organizational processes and policy analysis work. Evaluates systems and procedures, and operations and procedures manuals, to assist management and staff in operating more efficiently and effectively. Facilitates large-scale work groups and sessions with representatives across Behavioral Health Services. Highly-skilled in the development of complex business requirements and technical documentation. May plan, assign and supervise the work of others.
Essential Job Functions (EJFs):
EJF1

Participates and provides oversight for the HHSC Behavioral Health Services (BHS) data initiatives and project activities to plan, develop, maintain, and update system and processes. Interprets historical data to identify the problems, root cause, and areas of improvements for the procedural or system changes. Reviews and evaluates new or improved business and management practices for application to data-related operations. Develops and manages data analysis projects and initiatives, setting goals and objectives and providing work products
column2: facilitates and participates in cross-program and multi-agency workgroups
column3: consults with programs and IT to resolve problems, identify business needs, and discuss program effectiveness
column4: collects, organizes, analyzes, and prepares materials including templates, reports, work plans, and communication strategies in response to requests from executive staff. 25%.

column1: EJF2

Reviews and oversees the complex analyses and interpretations of data and ensures the integrity of all division and agency information within BHS. Assesses and analyzes data needs in response to stakeholder and program staff feedback. Assesses and determines reports and information appropriate for both internal and external customers which may include research, data collection, and analysis of State and Federal laws, rules, regulations, clinical data, and HHSC policies and procedures. Makes recommendations to internal stakeholders, program staff and upper management including the director, regarding data related improvements and delivery modes. 25%
EJF3

Reviews data for inconsistencies or anomalies that impact analytical results. Streamlines data collection and analysis procedures to ensure fast access to metrics. Compares, analyzes and oversees the statistical information to identify patterns, relationships and problems. Develops detailed reports for management and other departments by analyzing and interpreting data. Generates and reviews documentation for all Data Team processes. 15%.
EJF4

Executes and automates data queries and transformation processes in support of performance management dashboard development. Interprets new and changing business requirements to determine the data changes impact and proposing enhancements and changes to support the new requirements. Executes quantitative analyses that translate data into actionable insights. Provides oversight for analytical and data-driven decision-making support for key projects. 15%.
EJF5
Develops solutions to highly complex issues and concerns
column2: develops implementation plans and helps coordinate and support implementation. Coordinates performance management-related change, and issue management. Analyzes, synthesizes and visualizes complex material at a high volume into visually compelling quality, written reports, analyses, communications, presentations, summaries, specialized reports, updates, and other documents as needed or assigned. 15%.

column1: EJF6
Other duties as assigned. May plan, assign and supervise the work of others. May represent the DSS Director Data Team in meetings. 5%.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
Skill in the use of statistical applications or analysis to drive inferences from data and establish baseline to measure improvement in the future state.
Able to compile and organize statistical information retrieved and present findings to management
Strong technical writing and diagraming skills, including proficiency with modeling and mapping tools (e.g., Visio, or Erwin), the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and MS Project.
Well-developed research and analytical skills with good problem solving and lateral thinking ability
column2: Analysis of existing applications to identify weakness and develop opportunities for improvements

Skill in advanced development, reporting and interpretation of complex client and provider data.

Knowledge of organizational development and management practices as applied to the analysis, evaluation, development, and implementation of programs, policies, and procedures of methods and procedures analysis techniques.
Skill in process mapping and application of business process improvement methodologies.
Registrations, Licensure Requirements or Certifications:
Initial Screening Criteria:

Job Responsibilities:

This position will ensure the team members in the Project Management Office (PMO), Information Systems (IS) department, and other departments are in sync and in agreement about requirement implementation in projects. Business Analysts will enable constructive collaboration on requirements and testing processes, provide regression test coordination for validation, organize artifacts, oversee test plans and cases, and enable process improvement initiatives based on issues detected.

This position will interface with IS technical resources and staff during the development life cycle to maintain the integrity of the requirements and system design. This intentional process ensures all parties maintain an adequate understanding of the requirements and technical design in order to reduce unexpected downstream issues, manage user validation, and implement future system and workflow enhancements.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES AND AUTHORITY
Complete all training and assignments in a timely and effective manner.
Apply departmental standards and procedures to all assignments.
Effective communication with appropriate personnel.
Report status on assigned projects.
Manage multiple projects and requests simultaneously.
Function effectively as a team member.
Attend/organize/document meetings as needed.
Participate in a company sponsored insurance related training program as directed.
Collect, evaluate and compress data and information from multiple sources, resolve conflicts and differentiate between actual and required business needs.
Provide deliverables after thorough research of functional needs by collaborating and communicating between various users.
Research, organize data, and write project specifications.
Consult with business staff to determine the actual needs of the Business.
Determine how changing business needs will affect the system.
Serve as a liaison with IS and the Business staff in support of the system.
Provide coordination of the identification, capture, and obtaining the root cause for problems in the application systems and processes.
Provide analysis and results reporting of the PIR metrics.
Coordinate, lead, and document the Post Implementation Review (PIR) meetings.
Coordinate the assessment of the regression results with IS.
Provide team support for the Business Analyst Intern and the Business Analyst Trainee as directed by the Lead Business Analyst I.
Analysis of detailed user requirements documentation for development of testing plans to validate system performance as specified by the business.
Design and development of appropriate test plans/materials to accomplish user validation of policy processing system and workflow enhancements.
Documentation and maintenance of test plans and related materials.
Assisting in test preparation and execution of automated testing.
Assisting in development of quality assurance test beds for developer unit testing and regression testing.
Assist in website development and design.
Represent and act on behalf of the PMO in Joint Application Development teams.
Ensure that all system and procedural enhancements comply with business requirements as specified.
Maintaining competent knowledge of systems, procedures, and relationships within the Company and maintaining technical knowledge through continuing education and training efforts.
Comply with the Certified Fleet Operator requirements of the Company Driving and Safety Policy.
Other duties as assigned.
Job Qualifications:
At least one of the following:
Bachelor&rsquo
column2: s degree in a computer, technical, or business administration related field from an accredited school with experience demonstrating skills required.

column1: OR
Associate degree in a computer, technical, or business administration related field from an accredited school with experience demonstrating skills required.
Strong decision making/problem solving skills and experience with software development project.

Well-developed communication skills &ndash
column2: oral, written, listening.

column1: Role Overview:

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in building a modern, standardized data foundation that powers insight and decision-making across the organization. This role will focus on ETL design, data standardization, and metric governance while supporting dashboard development and mentoring a Jr. Analyst. Working closely with the VP of Analytics &
column2: AI, this individual will help transition the company&rsquo
column3: s current SQL data lake into a scalable, governed, and analytics-ready platform that supports AI and machine learning initiatives.

column1: Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with department heads and the VP of Analytics &amp
column2: AI to identify business needs, define metrics, and standardize reporting practices.

column1: Oversee dashboards and reporting outlines, delegating updates and visualization tasks to the Jr. Analyst while ensuring quality and consistency.

Support the development of ML/AI data readiness, ensuring ETL pipelines and datasets are structured for advanced analytics.
Lead data governance initiatives by defining table naming conventions, key business metrics, and data documentation for organization-wide use.
Mentor and coach the Jr. Analyst on reporting techniques, data literacy, and technical best practices.
Partner cross-functionally with business leaders to deliver actionable insights and data-driven recommendations.

column2: prepare datasets for AI readiness.

column1: 12 months:

Why This Role Matters

This position is key to transforming our analytics landscape, moving from siloed data and ad-hoc reporting to a unified, governed data platform that empowers leadership with trusted, actionable insights. The Data Analyst III will help shape our data future and directly enable the adoption of advanced analytics and AI.
Building Our Community
