column1: in-12cda621bf4a3d90,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=12cda621bf4a3d90,https://www.virtusa.com/careers/us/plano/business-analysis/lead-business-analyst/creq237618?jobid=CREQ237618-304150926&source=Indeed,Lead Business Analyst,Virtusa,"Plano, TX, US",2025-11-05,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"<div>P1
C3
STS

As a Business Analyst, you will work directly with the product team to develop business requirements for software Development projects. They are engaged with the project thorough all phases of the software development cycle and works closely with the client, the application development department, and other individuals to successfully implement projects. This job is hands-on in performing business level process analysis using the accepted tools and methodologies as well as preparing functional specifications. They will also work alongside the development teams to provide iterative analysis of the detailed specifications and to provide a link between the business and the Development teams.
5+ years of professional experience with requirements documentation.
3+ years of experience in business/systems analysis, mainly using the Agile methodology.
Conduct needs analysis and project specifications for all development projects.
Foster collaboration across the Development teams to solve tough business problems.
Handson in JIRA would be plus
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code.
Work closely with Product and Scrum teams from requirement to deployment readiness
Build relationships with all functional areas and manage stakeholder expectations.
Prepare Functional Design deliverables by analysing requirements, constructing diagrams, studying system capabilities, and writing specifications.
Define, analyse, evaluate, and design solutions to meet technology and business needs.
Documenting the results of business analysis and acquiring sign-off from client on the specifications
Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Experience thriving in matrixed organization, including offshore teams.
Ability to always ask the question why when working with stockholders on design and development.
About Virtusa

Teamwork, quality of life, professional and personal development: values that Virtusa is proud to embody. When you join us, you join a team of 27,000 people globally that cares about your growth &mdash
column2: one that seeks to provide you with exciting projects, opportunities and work with state of the art technologies throughout your career with us.

Description

Under general supervision of the Director, the Electric System Data Analyst is responsible for administering and managing the work order system and performing accounting functions as they relate to the electric transmission, distribution, and general plant. This includes but is not limited to generating ad hoc reports for management to aid in budgeting, cost accounting, rate design, and regulatory requirements
column2: reviewing and monitoring distribution and transmission expenditures
column3: and working with power supply on a variety of forecasting, settlement, and bid/hedging.

column1: Principal Duties
• Work with power supply to track expenditures, create projections for future costs, estimate needs for shortages in contracted supply, and provide recommendations.
Participate in developing and updating system load analysis and power supply forecasts.
Participate in the development of auction strategies, projections, and tracking of COCS&rsquo
column2: s participation in ERCOT&rsquo
column3: s Congestion Revenue Rights (CRR) market.

column1: Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for managing the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) Chart of Accounts (COA) and work order accounting through the City&rsquo

Junior Yield Data Analyst
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly analytical and data-driven individual to optimize and maximize monetization across our publisher partners. As a key member of our Yield team, you will monitor, analyze, and enhance yield performance using complex data sets, producing actionable insights and strategies. We are looking for a curious and proactive Yield Data Analyst who enjoys deep-diving into analysis and technical investigations, and producing creative ideas in a dynamic fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities:
<ul>
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends in complex data sets to maximize publisher yield.
• Extract and analyze bidstream and auction data to surface trends, anomalies, and optimization opportunities. Provide recommended changes to enhance bidding dynamics and yield outcomes.
• Develop and maintain analytic monitoring and alerting systems for yield management, ensuring rapid identification and diagnosis of revenue-affecting issues and performance drops.
• Produce data-driven summaries and actionable insights for internal teams and executives, ensuring technical accuracy and clear communication for a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Support Yield Managers and Publishers in implementing data-driven best practices and monetization strategies.
• Monitor macro and micro trends, providing proactive alerting on network or site-level issues and tracking key KPIs (ie fill rate, eCPM, revenue, latency, viewability).
• Investigate and respond to technical or operational issues to maximize yield without compromising user experience, site speed, or ad quality.
• Build and maintain AB testing frameworks, reporting, and result interpretation.
<li>Perform root cause analysis for data or ad-serving problems
column2: provide technical QA for new publisher onboarding, AB tests, product launches, and engineering initiatives.

column1: • Act as a subject matter expert for Freestar data capabilities. Support data integrity projects.

• Project manage yield and data initiatives from planning through successful implementation, ensuring clarity, accountability, and effective communication. Collaborate cross-functionally with Business Intelligence, Product, Engineering, Customer Success, Business Development, and Demand.
<li>Stay up-to-date on industry trends and emerging yield opportunities
column2: recommend and pilot innovative monetization solutions.

column1: Qualifications:
<ul>
• Bachelor's degree or relevant work experience in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related quantitative field.
<li>2-4 years of experience in ad tech
column2: preferably at a digital publisher or ad management company. Minimum 2 years of experience in an analytical role.

column1: • Deep familiarity with header bidding, Prebid, SSPs, DSPs, ad serving, Google Ad Manager, and major ad tech platforms.
• Advanced skills in Excel and Google Sheets. Familiarity with working with large complex data sets.
• Experience in SQL and willingness to adopt new data tools as needed.
• Hands-on experience with data visualization and presentation tools to tell compelling stories with data.
• Adept at deriving analytic insights, and presenting findings to external and internal stakeholders.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain complex yield strategies and analytical insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
We'd also like to see:
<ul>
• Detail-oriented and organized, able to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders.
<li>Proactive, resourceful, and self-motivated
column2: possesses intellectual curiosity and the drive to independently explore and solve problems.

<ul>

• The opportunity to be part of something BIG

column2: Beyond's business, data, and table structure with little direction.

column1: Lead and contribute to complex pricing projects with minimal oversight.

Must-Have Qualifications

Bachelor's degree (or U.S. equivalent in Economics, Statistics, Business, Information Systems, Mathematics, Supply Chain Management, or related field) and 2+ years of post-collegiate work experience conducting data analysis or PhD in a quantitative field.
Experience with SQL to extract and manipulate large datasets.
Experience with at least one modeling framework (e.g: SciKit Learn, SAS, R, MATLAB)
Knowledge in statistics and mathematical concepts (e.g: hypothesis testing, regression)

Excellent communication skills and experience with cross-team collaboration.

Experience conducting price tests and utilizing statistical methods to measure the performance of new pricing initiatives.
Experience automating analyses and manual processes via SQL and Python scripts.
Experience designing, developing and maintaining Python scripts to automate manual processes.

Education
Bachelor's degree (or U.S. equivalent in Economics, Statistics, Business, Information Systems, Mathematics, Supply Chain Management, or related field) or PhD in a quantitative field.

column2: Responsibilities

column1: As a SAS Monitoring developer needs to work with reporting and data teams to develop codes, reports and analyze data using SAS and build best practices and efficient programs. SAS Enterprise Guide is a point-and-click, menu- and wizard-driven tool that empowers users to analyze data and publish their results. It provides fast-track learning for quick data investigations, generating the code for greater productivity, accelerating deployment of analyses and forecasts. SAS Environment Manager is a web-based administration solution for a SAS environment. The application enables you to perform these tasks: administer, monitor, and manage SAS resources, including administering the SAS Web Application Server and monitoring SAS foundation servers. Monitor log events and report alerts. Incorporate the monitoring and managing of IT and SAS resources into a service management strategy by using the detailed metric information stored in the SAS Environment Manager and the reports provided in the Report Center SAS program

in-a20e051a22dc4627,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=a20e051a22dc4627,https://ibegin.tcsapps.com/candidate/jobs/shared-job/Mzc0ODE2Sg==,Analyst,Tata Consultancy Services (TCS),"Irving, TX, US",2025-11-05,,direct_data,yearly,100000.0,120000.0,USD,False,,,,,"
Data Analyst
Must Have Technical/Functional Skills
• 7+ years of experience in data analysis and/or business analysis, with a focus on data governance.
• Proven experience working with senior management (executive team) and leading data governance initiatives.
• Deep understanding of data governance principles, frameworks, and best practices.
• Extensive experience with data quality management, data profiling, and metadata management tools.
• Advanced proficiency in SQL and data analysis tools (e.g Python with Pandas, R).
• Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, with the ability to tailor communication to different audiences.
• Experience with data governance tools (e.g., Collibra, Alation) is highly preferred.
• Industry-recognized data governance certifications (e.g. CDMP) are a plus.
Roles &
column2: Responsibilities

column1: • "
column2: We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled individual for a Senior Data Analyst / Business Analyst role with a strong focus on data governance. This senior role requires a unique blend of advanced technical data analysis capabilities, exceptional business acumen, and strong communication skills to effectively bridge the gap between technical teams and senior business stakeholders, including the executive team. Candidate will be responsible for leading data governance initiatives, conducting complex data analysis, gathering and documentation of requirements, facilitating communication across teams, and ensuring data governance compliance.&quot

column1: Data Governance Leadership :
• Lead and facilitate meetings with senior business stakeholders (executive team) and technical teams to define and implement data governance strategies.
• Drive the development and implementation of data governance policies, standards, and procedures.
• Champion data governance best practices and promote a data-driven culture within the organization.
Business Analysis :
• Elicit, analyze, and document complex data governance requirements from business stakeholders at all levels, including the executive team.
• Translate business needs into clear and concise technical specifications for data governance solutions.
• Facilitate workshops and presentations to gather feedback, build consensus, and communicate data governance principles.
• Create high-quality documentation, including meeting minutes, presentations, and reports for the executive team.
Data Analysis:
• Conduct in-depth analysis of complex data to identify data quality issues, inconsistencies, and gaps.
• Understanding of data quality dashboards and reports to monitor data governance metrics and provide insights to the executive team.
• Perform data lineage analysis to understa nd data flow, dependencies, and potential impacts of data governance changes.
• Develop a deep understanding of Critical Data Elements (CDEs), Metadata management, and data lineage within the Organization's data landscape.
• Analyze data requirements for applications and reporting, ensuring alignment with data governance policies.
Communication and Collaboration :
• Communicate effectively with technical and business stakeholders at all levels, including the executive team.
• Build strong relationships with cross-functional teams, including data architects, engineers, and business users.
• Present findings and recommendations to diverse audiences, tailoring communication style and content as needed.
Salary Range- $100,000-$120,000 a year

in-78144ce09aad8c87,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=78144ce09aad8c87,https://waterbridge.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/WaterBridgeCareers/job/Houston-TX/Measurement-Data-Analyst_R970,Measurement Data Analyst,WaterBridge Resources,"Houston, TX, US",2025-11-05,fulltime,,,,,,True,,,,,"
Summary of Position:

The Measurement Data Analyst will support the Technical Field Services group, including Measurement Technicians, Field Operators, and other departments within WaterBridge. The Measurement Data Analyst will use analytical tools and databases to ensure data integrity, measurement accuracy, and communication with meters. The position requires compiling monthly volume totals for distribution to customers. The individual should be able to identify data errors and implement new data analysis processes.
Primary Duties &amp
column2: Responsibilities:

column1: The following represents most of the position's duties but is not meant to be all-inclusive or prevent other duties from being assigned when necessary. Employees are expected to comply with all regulatory, environmental, and safety rules and standards, as well as corporate policies.
As a Measurement Analyst, you will be responsible for:
Providing sound technical support to field technicians through analytical training and data auditing.
Troubleshooting and identifying operational issues, providing root cause analysis, and generating resolution recommendations utilizing SCADA software.
Quality control daily volumes. Utilizing existing software tools and spreadsheets to visualize inlet and outlet trends to identify outliers easily.
Comparing data sources for meter volume readings.
Monitoring inlet and outlet volumes on a basin and area level. Ensuring subsystem balances and identifying imbalances.
Adjusting the data source within the database when discrepancies are identified.
Linking meters to the appropriate operator to ensure billing accuracy.
Generating daily volume summaries and distributing them throughout the company via email.
Billing data compilation. Generating spreadsheets of monthly volume totals per operator and basin.
Assisting with answering customer questions and settling reporting disputes.
Creating new data tools to improve the efficiency and accuracy of measurement processes.
Qualifications &amp
column2: Requirements:

column1: A bachelor&rsquo
column2: s degree or equivalent working experience is required.

column1: Strong knowledge of, or experience with, databases/queries (SQL, etc.) and data analysis tools (Microsoft Power BI, Tibco Spotfire, SAP, SAS, etc.) is required.
Must have 3+ years of relevant measurement or data analytical experience.
Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Have excellent organizational skills and time management.
Be able to work in a fast-paced environment and manage well through ambiguity and complexity.
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Strong interpersonal skills required, including the ability to build and maintain effective relationships, and communicate with various agencies, customers, and all levels of company staff and management.
Must be willing to travel to the supporting field locations: Midland, Orla, Pecos, and Kenedy, Texas, and Carlsbad, New Mexico.
Familiarity with field applications such as RTU or PLC is a plus.
Working Conditions/Environment:
Operates in a professional and/or business casual office environment.
Position Type:
This is a full-time position.<ul><li>
Schedule is Monday &ndash
column2: Friday, 8:00 am &ndash
column3: 5:00 pm, with Work from Home (WFH) &frac12
column4: day on Friday

Houston, TX

About Us

The WaterBridge group of companies is a fast-paced and growing organization. Our business lines include produced water handling and recycling, land management and environmental solutions. Our employees provide essential services to unlock sustainable American energy production every day, and we are continually seeking dedicated individuals who thrive on both creativity and challenge to be a part of our team. We pride ourselves for our strong commitment to our employees and for creating a workplace where employees feel genuinely valued and connected. Join our entrepreneurial and innovative team today!
WHO WE ARE

At WaterBridge, we believe that our people make the difference! We are committed to provide our employees with personal development and growth opportunities. We've been leading the emergence and evolution of the midstream water sector since 2015, backed by our strong core values and operational excellence. WaterBridge owns and operates permanent, integrated water infrastructure networks to address the long term produces water management requirements of E&amp
column2: P companies.

column1: Our Mission:
To make WaterBridge the standard bearer for the water midstream industry.
Core Values:
SAFETY
Safety is important. We demand a personal commitment at all levels within the organization. Everyone has the right and responsibility to speak up and stop any unsafe work being performed.
TEAMWORK + COLLABORATION
We work with humility and courage to be a team player. We define success by contribution and not competition. We consider the impact we have on others before we act.
INTEGRITY + TRUST
We honor our commitments. We demonstrate a propensity to trust and act in the very best interest of all. We do not tolerate dishonesty or intimidation.
AUTHENTIC COMMUNICATION
We are honest and respectful. We genuinely listen to each other and encourage healthy debate. We do not spin the truth, have hidden agendas, or hide information.
ACCOUNTABILITY FOR RESULTS

We hold ourselves accountable and take responsibility for results, regardless of outcome. We learn from our mistakes, encourage feedback, and increase our capabilities. We do not overpromise or underdeliver.
ENTREPRENEURIAL INNOVATION

Why Credit Risk Analytics?

GM Financial is the wholly owned captive finance subsidiary of General Motors and is headquartered in Fort Worth, U.S. We are a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in North America, South America and the Asia Pacific region. Through our long-standing relationships with auto dealers, we offer attractive retail financing and lease programs to meet the needs of each customer. Position Summary

The Supply Chain Data Analyst supports operational performance across distribution and transportation functions. This role collects, analyzes, and visualizes data to improve accuracy, reduce costs, and drive efficiency across the distribution network. The analyst will partner with Distribution Centers, Logistics, SIOP and internal stakeholders to build KPI reporting, develop dashboards, and deliver meaningful insights that support informed decision-making.
Responsibilities
Inventory Analysis &amp
column2: Support

column1: Monitor inventory accuracy, movement, and levels across multiple distribution centers.

Transportation &amp
column2: Logistics Analytics

column1: Analyze freight spend, carrier performance, delivery reliability, and route efficiency.
Support cost reduction efforts and service improvement initiatives across the transportation network.
Develop reporting to track trends and highlight operational risks and opportunities.
Operational Efficiency &amp
column2: Continuous Improvement

Data Extraction &amp
column2: Management

Standardize reporting templates and ensure a consistent &ldquo

column3: for performance data.

<div><b>
About Us:
<div>

For over 35 years, TERREPOWER (formerly BBB Industries) has been a leader in sustainable manufacturing, driving the circular economy by extending the life of essential products in the automotive and industrial markets.
<div>

Founded in 1987 in Daphne, Alabama by the Bigler family, TERREPOWER began as a small regional remanufacturer of starters and alternators. Our commitment to quality and innovation quickly earned us a reputation as a trusted name in the automotive industry.
<div>
Recognizing new challenges and opportunities, in 2019 we set our sights on EV battery upcycling-addressing one of the industry&rsquo
column2: s most pressing issues. Our engineering team pioneered solutions to extend EV battery life, pushing the boundaries of sustainable innovation.

column1: <div>

Recognizing that demand for solar panels would exceed availability and 100,000 tons of waste would potentially go into landfills by 2035, our team searched for an innovative way to upcycle solar panels. With an eye on the future, we developed ways to upcycle solar panels.
<div>
Rooted in family and community values, we&rsquo
column2: re proud to have second-generation employees contributing to our legacy. Backed by Clearlake Capital, we&rsquo
column3: ve expanded our footprint into Europe with facilities in Spain, Italy, Denmark, Germany and Poland. We now sustainably manufacture and supply an assortment of nondiscretionary repair parts across more than 90 countries.

column1: <div>
As we move forward under the TERREPOWER name, we remain committed to the same values that have always defined us: entrepreneurship, teamwork, customer-centered, sustainability, safety.
<div><b>

column1: About these Opportunities: 7-Eleven Inc. has several opportunities for Summer Internships. The base salary range for this position is $122,000 - $180,000 per year. Individual pay will be based on various factors, such as relevant work experience, education, certifications, skill level, seniority, and internal equity.

For regular full-time or regular part-time employees of the Company (participating companies as listed in the Summary Plan Description), insurance coverage options include medical, dental, vision coverage, life Insurance, Business Travel Accident Insurance, and Occupational Accidental Death Benefit programs. Employees also participate in a company pension plan and a 401(k) plan. Paid leave includes up to 6 weeks of paid vacation time, up to 11 paid holidays, and parental leave offering 16 weeks of paid leave for birthing parents, and 8 weeks of paid leave for non-birthing parents.

Job Type: Contract
Job Category: IT
Job Description
Role: Senior Product Analyst With AI/ ML Exp
Location: Austin, TX
Contract
Role Summary:

The Senior Product Analyst is responsible for measuring and analyzing how effectively customer service tools and AI-driven automation features support both agents and customers. This role combines analytical rigor with a product mindset. The scope includes evaluating the productivity impact of existing systems, quantifying the value of new features, and identifying opportunities to enhance speed, quality, and automation through data-driven insights.
You&rsquo
column2: ll work cross-functionally with Product, BPR and technical teams (AI/LLM &amp
column3: dev teams) to translate raw data into clear business recommendations that improve customer experiences and reduce handling effort across human and automated interactions. Partner with Product Managers to scope solutions, refine backlogs, and align dependencies across Contact Center and digital platforms.

column1: Key Responsibilities:
Measure the efficiency and effectiveness of customer and internal facing enterprise tools (Chat, telephony, workflow and AI/LLM systems).
Develop and maintain dashboards and performance models tracking key metrics targeted for improvement such as handle time, automation rate, accuracy, and customer satisfaction.
Evaluate the ROI and adoption of new features, quantifying value through productivity improvements, cost savings, or customer impact.
Influence the product roadmap through data driven insights
Partner with engineering and AI teams to analyze LLM bot interactions, comparing outcomes against human agent performance (speed, resolution quality, escalation rates).
Identify bottlenecks and propose data-backed recommendations to improve tool usability, automation coverage, and integration efficiency.
Translate insights into clear narratives and presentations for leadership, highlighting business impact and next-step recommendations

column2: Process Understanding: Familiarity with contact-center workflows, CRM/ticketing tools (Salesforce, Genesys, etc.), and LLM-driven automation systems.

column1: Statistical &amp
column2: ML Awareness: Understanding of accuracy metrics, confusion matrices, and model performance trade-offs when comparing human vs. AI output.

column1: Business Acumen: Ability to translate complex data into clear business stories that drive action.
Collaboration &amp
column2: Communication: Strong cross-functional skills
column3: able to partner with engineers, data scientists, and operations teams effectively.

JOB SUMMARY

The Primary Care Analyst is responsible for organizing and leading teams for small to moderately complex projects to ensure timely and accurate completion of project tasks and goals. This includes managing the project scope, timeline, budget and resources, as well as providing leadership and guidance to project team members.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE ROLE

Establishes project deliverables and timeframes and holds project team accountable for completion, keeping in mind both short-term and long-term objectives. Establishes clear project charter, team roles, responsibilities and accountabilities to ensure success of project. Prepares and presents project scope document and achieves agreement on project parameters and objectives. Receives approvals at each phase of project.
Participates in feasibility studies, business planning, and benefit analysis studies as required to ensure that elements of cost, benefit, and risk are identified and considered.
Participates in primary care business planning and benefit analysis studies, including feasibility studies, to ensure that elements of cost, benefit, and risk are identified and considered.
Conducts research and data discovery to analyze trends, identify opportunities, and make recommendations that support strategic and operational goals.
Creates and manages Excel workbooks for project and team use, ensuring data integrity and usability across stakeholders.
Collaborates with other departments to obtain needed resources to complete projects within expectations and timeframes.
Manages small scale and moderately complex projects to ensure quality and timely achievement of project deliverables and objectives.
Develops clear and compelling PowerPoint presentations from data gathered to support leadership updates, business cases, and stakeholder communications.
Prepares notes, summaries, and action plans from stakeholder meetings to ensure alignment and follow-up on commitments.
Communicates task assignments and due dates in a clear, professional and timely manner. Manages work plan and project tasks to meet committed time frames and project milestones.
Monitors project status, resolves risks, issues, action items and decisions in a timely manner and escalates to leadership for support when needed.
Facilitates team meetings to discuss project progress (daily stand-ups if using Agile methodology).
Serves as a contact to senior management and key stakeholders to report project progress and to assist with problem resolution.
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to ensure project success.
Maintains business operations and applications knowledge level to provide required information as needed.
KEY SUCCESS FACTORS
Bachelor&rsquo

Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication

column1: Do you enjoy researching and extracting insights from data? Would others describe you as being reliable and resourceful? Do you have a background in statistics, mathematics, or finance? If so, being a Risk Management Data Analyst II with Frost could be for you.

column1: Who you are:

As a Risk Management Data Analyst II with Frost, you keep us risk-free! In this role, you will be responsible for applying data analytics to provide actionable insights into financial, transactional, demographic, and behavioral data. Using your analytical skills and observant mindset you will pull, clean, and aggregate data from sources across the bank. You enjoy collaboration and will have the opportunity to work with risk management staff to identify ways to use data analytics.

column2: ll do:

Participate in collaboration efforts with Risk Management Staff to identify ways to use data analytics
Present analytical results to data analytics clients
Maintain direct, ongoing communication with Risk Management clients
Always take action using Integrity, Caring, and Excellence to achieve all-win outcomes

column2: ll need:

Job Description
The Department of Family and Protective Services (DFPS) Data Infrastructure &
column2: Technology (DIT) Division Data Analyst IV is selected by and reports to the DIT Manager. This position performs advanced (senior level) computer data analysis work involving analyzing and identifying user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing systems. Works under minimal supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

column1: Work involves building and maintaining the infrastructure for data collection, storage, and processing. The duties entail creating data pipelines, ensuring data quality and security, optimizing databases, and collaborating with other ODSI staff as well as other DFPS staff to make data accessible for analysis and business decisions.

Current processes within DIT are implemented using Unix Shell scripting for job scheduling, SQL and/or PL/SQL in Toad for the ETL logic, .ASP and VBScript/HTML for reporting. DIT division with other ODSI staff as well as other DFPS staff are working towards modernizing the Data Warehouse ETL Logic using Databricks as the Integrated Data Platform to curate the data for the reporting layer that will be leveraged using Excel reports/ Tableau dashboards. Data Governance is implemented using Informatica to hold the master data for DFPS. This position may have the ability to leverage and use these tools and technologies to implement the data warehouse solution for creating new solutions or when evaluating and modifying existing programs.

The analyst creates original programming logic and evaluates and/or modifies existing programs of any level of complexity to consider changes in requirements. The analyst may prepare diagrams and logic flowcharts for detailed coding and for the documentation of programming work. The analyst may be required to review work products developed by other analysts and to interact with the agency Program staff, division managers, regional staff, and/or other analysts to ensure requirements are met and that all work products are appropriately reviewed and validated.

The analyst may interact with staff from other agencies and outside entities as required to facilitate data collaboration, obtain required work products, or consultation. The analyst participates in system design meetings for new agency initiatives to ensure the agency&rsquo
column2: s ability to report applicable data. The analyst may serve as a lead analyst on assigned projects of any level of complexity and may act as a mentor and on-the-job trainer for new or junior analysts.

column1: <div><b>

N/A
<div><b>
Essential Job Function (EJF):
<ul>
• Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

• Coordinate and/or participate in the development and execution of enterprise-level strategies and technical direction, including establishing processes and procedures for executing and maintaining technology road maps.
<ul>
• Coordinate with users to identify system requirements, develop functional design specifications to meet requirements, and solve complex operational problems.
• Coordinates with end-users and stakeholders to clarify the specifications and requirements are complete to provide recommendations on operational issues.
• Identifies solutions to any complex problems users may have and provides proof of concept or a design solution to meet their needs when appropriate.
• Review existing queries and explain plans for performance issues and recommend alternative ways to resolve performance issues.
• Provides analysis and review of Structured Query Language (SQL), Procedural Language/Structured Query Language (PL/SQL) or other code for validity.
• Completes MDC (monthly data-compilation) support on a rotation schedule after the first few months of being on the job.
• Analyze user needs, define the system&rsquo
column2: s scope, document requirements, and translate the user needs and requirements into functional specifications for the design of business systems.

column1: <ul><li>Participate in requirements and design meetings with stakeholders, requestors and users as needed to identify scope, translate user&rsquo

column1: • Participates in meetings with stakeholders, requesters, and users to present and discuss finalized products.
• Develop the ETL logic for the Data Warehouse tables and implement the reports using the current process identified in the job description.
• After system review, develop and prepare reports and recommendations to include project scope, work and cost estimation for work assigned and participate in project planning meetings.
• Develops and prepares optimum solutions for systems improvements, recommendations to include procedures, reports, upgrades, revisions, business process improvements, etc.
<div>

• Familiarity with modernization tools identified in the job description is essential for this role to be available to participate in project planning meetings, system review, development and recommendation for new data warehouse solutions for data lake implementation and reporting.
<ul>

• Aids others within ODSI and other DFPS staff in the assessment, development and production of ETL logic to develop the back-end tables for reporting, dashboard needs, Databook, automation for reporting LBB performance measures, FCL (Foster Care Litigation reports) and other data and statistical reports as needed.
• Analyzes new or existing procedures, information systems, or utility programs for efficiency and effectiveness.
• Analyzes on an ongoing basis existing functionality (code / procedures / systems) to determine refactoring and reusability can be achieved.
• Analyzes application and system functionality and interprets reporting requirements to develop technical specifications.
<div>
• Coordinate projects that involve cross-functional agency systems and other state entities, including planning and scheduling during project development and implementation stages.
• Coordinates meetings internally within division staff and across agency staff for requirements and design session or clarifying reporting needs.

• Provides data, reporting, and technical support subject matter expertise to agency staff and management and external entities regarding agency data warehouse and reporting systems, functions and processes.
<li>Managers multiple, complex assignments and projects and analyzes data requests.
• Coordinate, plan, and schedule the installation of or training for new or revised systems and define business process requirements.
• Coordinate, plan, and schedule training for new and existing staff on new technical systems and processes.
• Coordinate, plan, and schedule training for new and existing staff on revised technical systems and processes.
• Coordinates testing of data and applications when systems are upgraded and trains staff, as appropriate.
Knowledge Skills Abilities

data.

<li>Skill is using Databricks as a platform for Data Warehousing to ingest, transform, govern and analyze data is preferred.
• Skill in using Informatica for data governance, master data management, data quality is preferred.

• Skill in analysis, problem solving, data comprehension, reporting methodologies, math, and designing statistical reports and charts/graphs.
• Skills in planning, scheduling and prioritizing work assignments.

<li>Ability to compile, review and analyze data

<div>

The Business Development Analyst plays a critical role in supporting the Sales / Business Development team by leveraging data to drive strategic decision-making. This role involves conducting market research, performing cost and comparison analyses, and identifying therapy growth opportunities at Skilled Nursing Facilities (SNFs). The analyst creates data-driven insights and reports to enhance sales pitches, track performance against proformas, and support overall business growth. With a strong focus on analytics and collaboration, the role is essential for shaping proposals and optimizing revenue generation strategies.
Responsibilities:
<div><b>
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Collect and analyze data from external resources to support proposals and strategic decisions
Monitor market trends and provide actionable insights to optimize revenue generation
Conduct cost analysis leveraging both internal and external datasets
Perform comparison analyses between current client models/invoices and proposed sales offerings
Provide insights and reporting on business development metrics, including new business acquisition, churn analysis, and performance against budget
Develop and deliver data-driven stories to enhance sales pitches and presentations
Collaborate with Business Development teams to refine proposals
• Create and maintain business development reports
Maintain Quote Sheet rates by region
Support post-mortem analysis on new business actuals vs. proforma to track and measure bid accuracy on volume, mix, and profitability
Attends all mandatory meetings, trainings, and assignments as delegated
Must conduct self in an ethical, legal, and responsible manner at all times
Must adhere to the policies, principles, and guidance within the Employee Handbook and Code of Conduct
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned
Competency:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Ability to take independent ownership of processes and initiatives
• Highest standards of accuracy and precision

Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. column5: The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
column6: and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst specialized in Power BI dashboard development and reporting to support our portfolio companies and holding organization. This role will focus on creating actionable, real-time dashboards and reports to drive strategic decision-making across finance and operational functions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in KPI development, report automation, and a keen understanding of financial and operational data, with potential to expand into ERP, ENTERPRISE APPLICATIONS, and other business systems.
Key Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and maintain high-impact Power BI dashboards and reports tailored for portfolio companies and the holding company, focusing on KPIs related to finance and operations.
• Collaborate with finance, operations, and executive teams to understand critical metrics and translate business requirements into scalable reporting solutions.
• Develop KPI frameworks and data visualizations that enable stakeholders to monitor performance, identify trends, and support strategic initiatives.
• Build and optimize reporting solutions leveraging data from ERP, ENTERPRISE APPLICATIONS, and other integrated systems, ensuring consistency and accuracy across all reports.
• Automate report generation and distribution processes to facilitate timely and efficient decision-making.
• Assist in data validation, quality assurance, and governance practices to ensure reliable reporting data.
• Stay current with Power BI best practices, trends, and new features, incorporating innovations into existing reporting solutions.
• Provide training and documentation to end-users to maximize self-service reporting and analytical capabilities.
• Contribute to cross-disciplinary projects that enhance data accessibility and reporting integration across platforms.
Qualifications:
• Proven experience designing and delivering Power BI dashboards and reports in a professional setting, ideally supporting finance and operational functions.
• Strong understanding of KPI development, financial metrics, and operational data analysis.
• Familiarity with ERP, ENTERPRISE APPLICATIONS, and related business systems and their data structures.
• Excellent analytical skills with the ability to synthesize complex data into clear, actionable insights.
• Proficiency in data modeling, DAX, Power Query, and data visualization best practices.
• Experience integrating multiple data sources and ensuring data quality and governance.
• Strong communication skills, capable of translating technical concepts into business language for diverse stakeholders.
• Previous experience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment supporting portfolio companies or multi-entity organizations is a plus.
Position Will be ONSITE 100%
We do not sponsor employment visas
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

in-6879c5b1079f4e5a,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=6879c5b1079f4e5a,https://higher.gs.com/roles/154595,"Senior Business Analyst, Transaction Banking, Payments Engineering",Goldman Sachs,"Dallas, TX, US",2025-11-04,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"

What We Do

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

Transaction Banking (TxB) aims to bring innovative solutions to traditional banking and lending activities. We are a global team of lenders, investors, risk managers, skilled marketers, web experts and banking specialists. We provide a suite of solutions to help our customers meet their financial goals. We make direct investments in and manage risk for a portfolio of corporate loans and securities. We help transform distressed communities through investments and loans of private capital.

Within TxB, our Payments team is at the heart of what we are doing in Corporate Cash Management and our mission is to build a market-leading payment platform that meets our corporate client's needs. We are starting with a clean slate and one singular goal in mind: build a highly scalable, resilient, 24x7 available cloud-based payment platform that our corporate clients can run rely on to run and grow their businesses.
Who We Look For

As a Payments Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our product management and development teams. You will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting business and functional requirements for our payment solutions, ensuring that these are clearly translated into actionable user stories for engineering teams.
Your deep understanding of the payments landscape&mdash
column2: particularly in payment rail schemes such as Fedwire, FEDACH, RTP, CHAPS, CHIPS, or experience with batch, RTGS, or real-time payment schemes&mdash
column3: is essential for success in this role.

column1: You will work closely with business stakeholders, operations, and clients to elicit detailed requirements, map processes, and identify opportunities for improvement and automation.
Collaborating with engineering, you&rsquo
column2: ll ensure that requirements are well understood, feasible, and prioritized within the product backlog. You will also be actively involved in User Acceptance Testing (UAT), validating that new features meet business needs and regulatory requirements, and supporting the rollout and adoption of these features by interfacing with both internal teams and external vendors or clients.

column1: A strong analytical mindset and experience in writing clear and concise use cases and user stories are critical. You will support the definition and tracking of key performance indicators (KPIs), prepare reports for senior leadership on project progress and the competitive landscape, and contribute to continuous process improvements across payment operations.

Your background should include practical experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum or Kanban), strong communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to operate independently in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
How You Will Fulfill Your Potential
<ul><li>
Gather, analyze, and document business and functional requirements for payment solutions.
Translate requirements into clear, actionable user stories for development teams.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, operations, and clients) to ensure alignment and prioritization of requirements.
Act as the primary bridge between product and development teams, clarifying requirements and facilitating communication.
Support and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT), ensuring features meet business and regulatory needs.
Monitor and report on KPIs and project progress to senior leadership.
Conduct process mapping and recommend improvements for efficiency and automation.
Stay up to date with payment schemes (e.g., Fedwire, FEDACH, RTP, CHAPS, CHIPS, batch, RTGS, or real-time payments) and relevant regulations.
Basic Qualifications
<ul><li>
Minimum 4 years of relevant professional experience as a business analyst in payments or financial services.
Demonstrated experience gathering and analyzing requirements, and creating user stories for payment-related products.
Strong understanding of at least one payment scheme in areas of RTGS, real-time, or low-value payment clearing schemes.
Proven ability to collaborate with engineering and product teams to deliver complex solutions.
Comfort working in Agile environments (Scrum/Kanban).
Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
Energetic, self-motivated, and detail-oriented with a strong analytical mindset.
Preferred Qualifications
<ul><li>
Experience with payment operations, including process mapping and automation.
Familiarity with payment vendor products (e.g., Finastra GPP, Volante, Fircosoft).
Understanding of payment regulations (PSD2, Open Banking, AML/sanctions).
Prior experience supporting compliance, audit, or SOX reporting.
Background in corporate cash management banking or FinTech.
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. in-2ab153c5ee73a5a0,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=2ab153c5ee73a5a0,https://www.governmentjobs.com/jobs/5118071/healthcare-data-analyst-community-health-analyst,Healthcare Data Analyst (Community Health Analyst),Travis County,"Austin, TX, US",2025-11-03,fulltime,direct_data,yearly,75476.0,98118.0,USD,False,,,,,"JOB

What is the physical and behavioral health status of the residents of our community? What are the unmet needs and what are the necessary services to meet those needs? Where are public organizations investing public dollars? What are the most impactful and successful interventions to meet the health care needs of our community? This is a servant-leadership position which will work at the systems level reviewing the responsiveness of our public and non-profit partners on meeting the public health, behavioral health, and healthcare needs of our residents. The Community Health Analyst is under general direction, analyzes and reviews the financial operations and healthcare delivery of several entities in Travis County. Evaluates financial statements, budgets, forecasts and trend analysis, revenue and expenditure projections, and other financial activities as well as community and agency reports of community conditions and health disparities. Responsible for performing and coordinating data analysis, performance measurement and evaluation, and contract oversight and reporting for public health and behavioral health interlocal agreements. This position involves providing guidance and feedback as it pertains to the development and monitoring of contract performance measures and the development of comprehensive performance reports.The successful candidate will have experience researching or assessing programs in the healthcare field and both a theoretical foundation and work experience in translating quantitative and qualitative health care data into actionable strategies that executives and elected officials can operationalize. Acts as an internal consultant to policy makers, their staff, and senior County leadership, ensuring data-driven recommendations.Distinguishing CharacteristicsThis classification is within the Planner/Management/Research job family with expertise in a specific planning area, representing the department in Commissioners Court proceedings and the County in public forums. This classification requires minimal supervision, exercises independent judgment and initiative, and requires managing high-level, complex projects while simultaneously completing advanced planning and financial analysis work. It is distinguished by the requirements to manage multi-disciplinary county and/or consultant-staffed teams
column2: contract and manage consulting services
column3: and initiate policy and work directly with senior leadership for its adoption and implementation.

column1: EXAMPLE OF DUTIES

Analyze evolving public health and behavioral health conditions, existing research and data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks relevant to organizational strategies.Conduct health and budget finance data analyses, review and summarize reports regarding other public jurisdictions funding health initiatives to inform key strategic decisions.Utilize qualitative and quantitative research methods, including constituent and Travis County resident insights and ethnographic research, to inform strategy and innovation efforts.Prepare detailed reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to senior leadership and Commissioners Court.Establish and maintain effective working relationships with departmental clientele, representatives of outside agencies, other County employees and officials, and the general public.Maintain updated knowledge of horizon issues and economic, environmental, and demographic conditions impacting healthcare delivery and planning.Maintain expertise in health and financial trends, emerging service delivery and health service integration to enhance strategy development.Attend public meetings of healthcare entities to establish working relationships with the staff and stay up to date on partner strategies and budgets.Oversee the collection, management, analysis, and visualization of data related to the Health Planning & Partnership Divisionâ€™s portfolio of investments.This classification will require a flexible work schedule in order to meet the needs of the department.
SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION

Physical requirements include the ability to lift/carry up to 5-15 pounds occasionally, visual acuity, speech and hearing, hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer and office equipment. Subject to standing, walking, sitting, repetitive motion, reaching, climbing stairs, bending, stooping, kneeling, crouching, crawling, pushing, pulling, balancing, squatting to perform the essential functions.Travis County employees play an important role in business continuity. As such, employees can be assigned to business continuity efforts outside of normal job functions.Work Hours: 8 am - 5 pm, Monday-Friday. May work some holidays, some nights, some weekendsLocation: 700 Lavaca Street, Austin, TX 78701. This position is eligible for Telework, with in-office as needed. Must live in or near Austin, TX area. Department: Health & Human ServicesCriminal, Driving, Education, and Employment Background Checks Required.This job description is intended to be generic in nature. It is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. The essential duties, functions and responsibilities and overtime eligibility may vary based on the specific tasks assigned to the position.",Government,https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Travis-County,https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_squarelogo/256x256/cb6e432f6fb207ea95acb7911b12ec17,https://www.traviscountytx.gov,"Austin, TX","1,001 to 5,000",less than $1M (USD),"Travis County is located in Central Texas and includes Austin, Del Valle, Pflugerville, Lakeway, Leander, Westlake Hills, Manor & Bee Caves.",,,,,,,Texas

in-0c8fca3603935d6b,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=0c8fca3603935d6b,https://careers-svclnk.icims.com/jobs/3239/job?utm_source=indeed_integration&iis=Job%20Board&iisn=Indeed&indeed-apply-token=73a2d2b2a8d6d5c0a62696875eaebd669103652d3f0c2cd5445d3e66b1592b0f,"Junior Data Science Analyst -Temporary, Information Technology",ServiceLink,"Irving, TX, US",2025-11-03,temporary,direct_data,yearly,52000.0,83200.0,USD,True,,,,,"<div>Overview:
<div>

Are you a data enthusiast with a desire to expand your understanding and experience with data analysis, visualization and data cleansing? As a Junior Data Science Analyst , you will have an opportunity to apply and develop your skills in analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets with a variety of tools and statistical environments, creating and implementing machine learning algorithms and advanced statistics and using statistical computing languages for data analysis - such as R and Python. If you are ready to take your career to the next level, there has never been a better time to join ServiceLink!
Note- The Junior Data Science Analyst is a temporary role with an anticipated length of 3 months, intended to be an introductory/developmental role.
A DAY IN THE LIFE
In this role, you will&hellip

Conduct research leveraging big data technologies that surface actionable insight that influence analytical solutions roadmap
  • Gather and process raw data at scale by using statistical packages like R, and programming language like Python
  • Process unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis &ndash
column2:
and then do the analysis.
  • Work with images, text documents and tabular data

column1: WHO YOU ARE
You possess &hellip
Recently graduated or currently pursuing Undergraduate / Master&rsquo
column2:
s degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience
  • Effective in fast paced environment
  • Collaborative/enjoys working in teams
  • Self-starter/motivator
  • Some experience in software or applications engineering and/or technical operations

column1: Responsibilities:
• Critical thinking skills to assess how AI capabilities can best be applied to complex business situations.
Work closely with engineering team to integrate your ideas, innovations and algorithms into production systems.
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.
Having the ability to query databases with structured and un-structured data and perform statistical analysis
Being able to work in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment as in a competitive landscape new data keeps flowing in rapidly and the world is constantly changing
Applying quantitative analysis and data mining expertise in presenting data to visualize beyond the numbers and the underlying trends and use that analysis in process automation
Ability to perform in the following areas:
o Analysis and Presentation
o Exploratory Data Analysis
o Predictive Data Analysis
o Streaming Analytics

Experience in creating and implementing machine learning algorithms and advanced statistics such as: regression, clustering, decision trees, exploratory data analysis methodology, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, and neural networks
Proficiency with statistical computing languages for data analysis, such as R and Python preferred.
You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You are constantly exploring new open source tools.
Work on building deep learning models in production for predicting or classification.
Analytical skills, with an emphasis on quantitative analysis, descriptive and inferential statistics a plus

in-93ce1931f156b2b5,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=93ce1931f156b2b5,https://deloitteus.avature.net/careers/InviteToApply?jobId=316733,Epic Cogito Analytics,Deloitte,"San Antonio, TX, US",2025-11-03,fulltime,direct_data,yearly,93000.0,137000.0,USD,False,,,,,"
Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology who wants to work in a collaborative environment? As an experienced Epic Cogito Analytics Analyst you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. The Project Delivery Talent Model is designed for professionals with specialized skills that align to a current client need. Team members focus on delivering services to clients, without additional expectations related to business development or promotion. Their employment is tied to their role on a project, and they are eligible for a benefits package that is competitive for project delivery-focused professionals.
<b>Recruiting for this role ends on 12/31/2025
<b>Work you'll do/Responsibilities
<ul><li>Will be joining a very large implementation and build team from Deloitte for this work.

• Work with the implementation team to plan and complete the build, implement end-to-end Epic module, work command center shifts to investigate during go-live, document, and resolve break-fix tickets.
• Conduct and document root cause analysis.
• Complete any assigned system maintenance.

• Communicate regularly with Engagement Managers (Directors), project team members, and representatives from various functional and / or technical teams, including escalating any matters that require additional attention and consideration from engagement management
<b>The Team
AI &amp
column2: Engineering leverages cutting-edge engineering capabilities to build, deploy, and operate integrated/verticalized sector solutions in software, data, AI, network, and hybrid cloud infrastructure. These solutions are powered by engineering for business advantage, transforming mission-critical operations. We enable clients to stay ahead with the latest advancements by transforming engineering teams and modernizing technology &amp
column3: data platforms. Our delivery models are tailored to meet each client's unique requirements

• Minimum of 5 years of Epic build and support experience
• Excellent attention to detail, including verbal communication and documentation skills
• Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline

in-c51f4c4f03fe9775,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=c51f4c4f03fe9775,https://careers.sysco.com/job/-/-/1105/88026225504,"Data Analyst, BSCC Sourcing",Sysco,"Houston, TX, US",2025-11-03,,,,,,,False,,,,,"

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Sourcing Analyst will be responsible for analysis and reporting required to support Sysco&rsquo
column2: s sourcing activities. This role will require exceptional analytic skills along with a working knowledge of database design and management in Microsoft Access and/or SQL Server. This position will work directly with the Sourcing Team leads, Category Operations, Supply Chain and Business Centers. The Sourcing Analyst will be responsible for gathering and validating all necessary data.

column1: RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct analytics to build the fact base in support of negotiations
Perform sourcing data analysis using data template defined in Category Management process
Lead analysis for visibility in key cost drivers, pricing trends, emerging market regions, supplier capabilities and capacities etc.
Develop ideas leading to continual improvement to the sourcing process at Sysco
Provide data support to supplier relations and category management team
Develop any AdHoc sourcing related reports needed by Sourcing Managers, Category Managers, SSR Managers etc.
Provide the analytical support to SSR Manager during supplier business reviews
Work with the insights team to develop surveys and interview guidelines for the key suppliers
REQUIRED MINIMUM EDUCATION:
Bachelor&rsquo
column2: s Degree required.

column1: EXPERIENCE:
Minimum 1-3 years of business analytics experience, preferably in a sourcing capacity.
Highly skilled in data structures and database access/reporting
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access and SQL server
Theoretical knowledge of statistics and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g. spreadsheet modeling, regression analysis)
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, with the ability to build complex models and compelling presentations.
Hands-on experience with data visualization and analytics tools, including Tableau, Power Pivot, Smartsheet, or comparable platforms.
Proficiency in automation and scripting tools to streamline data workflows and reporting processes, with a focus on Python, Power Query, or SQL.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to synthesize insights from multiple data sources and a natural curiosity for uncovering trends and patterns.
Proven quantitative problem-solving skills, with comfort in managing and interpreting large, complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into clear, actionable business recommendations.
Self-motivated and adaptable, able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Demonstrated success in driving process improvements and implementing scalable, sustainable solutions.
Commitment to continuous learning and improvement, with a proactive approach to skill development and innovation.
Ability to work independently and take initiative, while staying aligned with team goals and responsibilities.
Detail-oriented and highly organized, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all deliverables.
INTRINSIC CAPABILITIES
Ability to pull disparate pieces of data together to form a coherent story
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment, adapt to shifting priorities, and be very detail oriented
Self-driven individual with intellectual curiosity and pushes to understand underlying issues

Collaborative team player who can work across functions (e.g., Analytics, Category Management, SSR)

in-58c46e4607d6d831,indeed,https://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=58c46e4607d6d831,https://jobs.aa.com/job/Dallas-AnalystSr-Analyst%2C-Procurement-Data-&-Analytics-TX-75201/1340388700/?feedId=198700&utm_source=Indeed&utm_campaign=AA_Indeed,"Analyst/Sr Analyst, Procurement Data & Analytics",American Airlines,"Dallas, TX, US",2025-11-03,,,,,,,False,,,,,"

Intro
Are you ready to explore a world of possibilities, both at work and during your time off? Join our American Airlines family, and you&rsquo
column2: ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you&rsquo
column3: ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!

column1: Why you'll love this job
This role is a part of the Procurement team within the Finance Division. The Analyst/ Sr Analyst, Procurement Data &amp
column2: Analytics supports Procurement operations by driving performance measurement, cost-saving strategies, and data-driven decision-making. It combines advanced analytics, machine learning, and scalable data infrastructure to deliver actionable insights, improve reporting quality, and enhance operational efficiency.

column1: What you'll do

As noted above, this list is intended to reflect the current job but there may be additional essential functions (and certainly non-essential job functions) that are not referenced. Management will modify the job or require other tasks be performed whenever it is deemed appropriate to do so, observing, of course, any legal obligations including any collective bargaining obligations.

Support Procurement operations through performance measurement, cost-saving strategies, and efficiency improvements.
  • Collaborate with business leaders to define reporting and analytic needs to deliver data-driven actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Monitor industry trends and analytic advancements to identify opportunities for process and performance improvement.
  • Apply analytical models and data optimization techniques to support decision-making, policy development, and financial analysis.
  • Design and deploy machine learning and AI models to enhance business outcomes.
  • Manage a diverse report portfolio and develop high-impact analyses to improve Procurement performance.
  • Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support operational decisions and profitability.
  • Integrate new data sources to improve reporting capabilities, enhance data quality and define technical specifications for reusable data objects to simplify analytics in the department.
  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and structures for accurate, timely, and self-service reporting and analytics.
  • Contribute to Data Governance initiatives, ensuring proper data cataloging and compliance.
  • Serve as a data steward and support data access policies for owned data assets.
All you'll need for success
Minimum Qualifications - Education &amp
column2:
Prior Job Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Sciences, Engineering, Economics, or equivalent training/experience
  • 3-4 years experience in data science, analytics, forecasting, automation, or relevant experience

column1: Preferred Qualifications - Education &amp
column2:
Prior Job Experience

  • Master&rsquo
column3:
s degree in Data Sciences, Engineering, Economics, or other related field
  • Agile project management experience
  • Knowledge of American Airlines data landscape and understanding of a variety of data sources across the business
  • Experience with data integration, data ingestion, ETL pipelines
  • Automating data ingestion from multiple sources into data lakes or cloud data warehouses
  • Logically structure analysis of complex issues and develop creative solutions to business and operational challenges
  • Querying large data sets using SQL
column4:

What Does Steel Dynamics Do?

Steel Dynamics is a leading industrial metals solutions company that produces lower-carbon, high-quality steel products primarily from recycled scrap. Operating through a circular manufacturing model, the company manufactures a wide range of steel products including flat roll, structural, and long products for industries such as construction, automotive, energy, and manufacturing. In addition to steel production, Steel Dynamics operates metals recycling facilities, steel fabrication plants, and aluminum production operations, serving customers across North America with a focus on innovation, efficiency, and sustainability.
What Makes This Internship Different?
What sets this Data Analytics Internship apart is the opportunity to directly support business intelligence development for one of the company&rsquo
column2: s largest recycling divisions. The intern will help design and automate interactive dashboards and data tools that provide real-time insights into divisional performance, sales, and marketing metrics. Rather than working with simulated or academic data, interns will work with live reports from our new ERP system being implemented in February 2026, giving them hands-on exposure to large-scale data migration and analytics integration. This role offers an exceptional opportunity to work cross-functionally with leadership in operations, marketing, and IT, building end-to-end reporting solutions that drive business decisions.

Join Our Team as an Inventory Control Data Analyst!
Work Location: Waco, TX
Travel Requirements: 10%
Who We Are Looking For

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Inventory Control Data Analyst to support our supply chain and operations performance. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys diving into ERP data, solving inventory accuracy challenges, and partnering across departments to improve processes and system reliability. If you thrive in a data-driven environment and want to make a measurable impact on manufacturing and distribution efficiency, this is an exciting opportunity.
Why You Should Apply
<div>As an Inventory Control Data Analyst at Uzin Utz North America (UUNA), you will play a key role in ensuring accurate, reliable inventory data and supply chain performance. You&rsquo
column2: ll build dashboards, analyze root causes, and support continuous improvement efforts that strengthen operational excellence across the organization.

column1: Who We Are

Uzin Utz North America, Inc. is a leader in flooring installation systems and a North American subsidiary of Uzin Utz SE, based in Ulm, Germany. Since 1911, Uzin Utz SE has been a global innovator in product systems for flooring installation and maintenance. We are committed to fostering a culture of safety, sustainability, and operational excellence across all levels of our organization.
In the United States and Canada, Uzin Utz North America offers its products under the renowned UZIN, WOLFF, and PALLMANN brand names, delivering industry-leading solutions for flooring professionals.
Position Overview

The Inventory Control Data Analyst ensures inventory accuracy and operational efficiency by analyzing ERP data (primarily SAP), identifying root causes of variances, and implementing process improvements. This role develops dashboards and reporting tools, supports physical inventory programs, maintains master data integrity, and collaborates with procurement, production, warehouse, and quality teams to reduce discrepancies and optimize inventory performance. The Inventory Control Data Analyst ensures inventory accuracy and operational efficiency by analyzing ERP data (primarily SAP) to investigate and resolve stock variances and discrepancies. This role develops and automates dashboards and reports in SAP, Tableau, and Excel, and extracts, transforms, and validates data to support root cause analysis and decision making. The analyst leads inventory cycle counts, physical inventories, and audit activities, monitors key inventory KPIs, and partners with procurement, production, warehouse, and quality teams to identify process gaps and implement improvements. They recommend safety stock and reorder policies, maintain master data quality, drive continuous improvement initiatives, and provide training and data-driven guidance to stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities
• Perform end to end inventory analysis and reconciliation using ERP data (primarily SAP) to investigate and resolve stock variances, shrinkage, and discrepancies.
• Develop, maintain, and automate inventory and operational dashboards and reports in SAP, Tableau and Excel (including PivotTables, advanced formulas, and macros).
• Extract, transform and validate data from SAP and other systems for reporting, root cause analysis, and decision support.
<li>Lead and support cycle counts, physical inventories, and audit activities
column2: analyze results and implement corrective actions.

column1: • Monitor and report on inventory KPIs such as inventory accuracy, days of inventory on hand (DOH), fill rate, service level, and inventory turns.
• Partner with procurement, production, warehouse, and quality teams to identify process gaps and implement inventory control improvements.
• Recommend and model optimal safety stock and reorder policies using historical demand, lead time, and variability analyses.
• Maintain and improve master data quality (e.g., item master, location mapping, BOMs) to ensure accurate system transactions.
• Drive continuous improvement initiatives (root cause analysis, standard work, SOP updates) to reduce recurring inventory issues.
• Provide training and data driven guidance to operational stakeholders.
<li>Other duties as assigned &ndash

Job Summary

What is the physical and behavioral health status of the residents of our community? What are the unmet needs and what are the necessary services to meet those needs? Where are public organizations investing public dollars? What are the most impactful and successful interventions to meet the health care needs of our community? This is a servant-leadership position which will work at the systems level reviewing the responsiveness of our public and non-profit partners on meeting the public health, behavioral health, and healthcare needs of our residents.

The Community Health Analyst is under general direction, analyzes and reviews the financial operations and healthcare delivery of several entities in Travis County. Evaluates financial statements, budgets, forecasts and trend analysis, revenue and expenditure projections, and other financial activities as well as community and agency reports of community conditions and health disparities.

Responsible for performing and coordinating data analysis, performance measurement and evaluation, and contract oversight and reporting for public health and behavioral health interlocal agreements. This position involves providing guidance and feedback as it pertains to the development and monitoring of contract performance measures and the development of comprehensive performance reports.

The successful candidate will have experience researching or assessing programs in the healthcare field and both a theoretical foundation and work experience in translating quantitative and qualitative health care data into actionable strategies that executives and elected officials can operationalize. Acts as an internal consultant to policy makers, their staff, and senior County leadership, ensuring data-driven recommendations.
Distinguishing Characteristics

This classification is within the Planner/Management/Research job family with expertise in a specific planning area, representing the department in Commissioners Court proceedings and the County in public forums. This classification requires minimal supervision, exercises independent judgment and initiative, and requires managing high-level, complex projects while simultaneously completing advanced planning and financial analysis work. It is distinguished by the requirements to manage multi-disciplinary county and/or consultant-staffed teams
column2: contract and manage consulting services
column3: and initiate policy and work directly with senior leadership for its adoption and implementation.

• Analyze evolving public health and behavioral health conditions, existing research and data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks relevant to organizational strategies.
Conduct health and budget finance data analyses, review and summarize reports regarding other public jurisdictions funding health initiatives to inform key strategic decisions.
Utilize qualitative and quantitative research methods, including constituent and Travis County resident insights and ethnographic research, to inform strategy and innovation efforts.
Prepare detailed reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to senior leadership and Commissioners Court.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with departmental clientele, representatives of outside agencies, other County employees and officials, and the general public.
Maintain updated knowledge of horizon issues and economic, environmental, and demographic conditions impacting healthcare delivery and planning.
Maintain expertise in health and financial trends, emerging service delivery and health service integration to enhance strategy development.
Attend public meetings of healthcare entities to establish working relationships with the staff and stay up to date on partner strategies and budgets.
Oversee the collection, management, analysis, and visualization of data related to the Health Planning &amp
column2: Partnership Division&rsquo
